We had to hold the button down the entire time the coffee was brewing.. and then put it into the two paper cups! Really, not even a ceramic cup? The view was lovely, and the quality of bedding was excellent. We have been attending company parties there for years and our overnight was to be a treat, but it was a big disappointment. We have always parked for free on the street for these events, so the $25.00 extra for the parking was an unpleasant surprise because as we learned there is no street parking between 2AM and 4AM. When we checked out there were room charged on our bill that were not ours! You can see that this special event wasn't quite so special!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Shabbiness”
Reviews.Author: thenewval
Reviews.Content: My first impression when I walked into my corner waterfront view “suite” in the tower – wow, a large room with a great harbor view! But over the next two days, I became more and more disappointed due to the following: -Stained table in living room - large brown and pink stains all over the table. Aside from the stains, table had dirt, crumbs and hair on it; I asked the front desk to send someone up to wipe it down. Unfortunately the stains remained. Table edge is falling apart. -Hole in ottoman. -Food encrusted on one of the couch pillows. -Stained table top above mini fridge - appeared to be coffee stains. -Large scuff mark on the closet door. -Bedroom curtains had dark stains in two places. -Large crack in toilet tank lid. -Extremely stained soap dish. -Two long blond hairs on the shower wall. -Very dusty telephone in bedroom – clearly hadn’t been touched in awhile by housekeeping. All of these things turned a classy room into a shabby room. This hotel could be great if they would pay attention to these small details - the grounds and area are just beautiful. But currently, it’s a disappointment. Upon checking out, when the desk clerk asked how my stay was, I was brutally honest and gave him a written list of all of the items above. He said he made a copy of it and gave it to the manager, but I find it very odd that a Platinum status member can hand over a page of complaints without the manager making a personal appearance. This hotel’s only saving grace is their Regency Club staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Hlondon99
Reviews.Content: This is a property that has nice rooms in the tower, beautiful grounds, and pleasant staff. The room was large and clean, modern, but not wild. The restauarant and bars are nice, food more than decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for summer time”
Reviews.Author: Amandamluz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a big open are space and two big pools facing the Marina. It is a great hotel for summer time, but just keep that in mind if you are going in winter. It is a litlle bit far from the city center, since in San Diego you will depend a lot in Taxis and the fares are not at all cheap! In the hotel there is also an alternative for breakfast, a shop of the Einstein Bros bagels, where they serve one of the best bagels I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessie222
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel and incredible view! I stayed in the Towers and enjoyed the balcony with a gorgeous view of the bay. My room was beautiful, however, the cleaning staff had to be called to re-clean my room, especially the drapes. Once that was done, the room was fine. The food at the Red Marlin was exceptionally good. The front desk staff and bell men were most polite and professional. I plan to stay there during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “the wait for check in was forever”
Reviews.Author: quynhvy
Reviews.Content: we reserved 5 rooms for our family. It took from 2pm - 7pm to check in all the rooms, The receptionist was very courteous and professional only they don't have the room ready for us. Check in time was at 4pm. we arrived the hotel at 2pm hoping they would let us check in early. however each hour we got 1 room and the last room given to us was at 7pm. (They try to make up for that by charging us 3 car parking instead of 5) For the pool, it was very nice except it's too too too small for the hotel pululation.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: hunnylvr
Reviews.Content: I alway enjoy Hyatt, but this was one of the prettiest I've stayed at yet, the property is beautiful - lots of lush plant life, a great pool area, and even a breezy, comfy lobby. The room was large and comfortable, and our every need attended to. The location is excellent - close to Sea World, but not right in the downtown area, so it's less hustle and bustle. You get a much more vacation type atmosphere. The restaurant serves GREAT food as well. Great place to get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel - L. Larry”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham_ALOmari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 7 nights at this hotel. Everyone was so very nice and accomondating. Special Kudos to Duane and Joseph who went above and beyond to make sure we had were satisfied. Never in our entire history in staying in hotels (we travel a lot) have we had anyone to be as helpful!!! The manager went above and beyond as well to make sure that we had a comfortable room and was satisfied because we switched rooms on the 2nd day because we wanted a king. It did not hold up our day - all we had to do was leave our luggage and everything was moved for us and we received a complimentary call to tell us that our room was ready. This hotel staff is to be commended for their interest in making sure that their customers are well satified. I can't say enough about Duane and Joseph (concierge). Baris was great @ checkout - so personable! Would definitely stay here again without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean and great view”
Reviews.Author: explore2
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 2 small kids and I wanted a nice place to stay after staying at VRBO"s for the last few trips. We got an king suite and were in the suite building overlooking the marina. It worked out well as we had the kids on the one side of the room, that we could close off (when they went to bed early or were taking naps). There was a pull out couch in there and also lots of room for the crib. It was fun to hear the sea lions "singing" and pushing each other off the docks in the morning. The pool here is also great! There are 3 pools and 3 waterslides.We were in the water even though it was only 60'. The entire property is very clean and well maintained. It is centrally located in the city- easy to get to Coronodo, downtown, la jolla, and mission or pacific beach. We did have a car and I think you would need one for this location as it is isolated a little bit. The cons- You have to pay $20/ night to park. They must have worked something out with the city as you can't park out on the street from 2-4am. ( ugh!!) You have to pay for internet. -really in 2011? The are definitely out to make money out of everything they can. I also felt that the ft. desk staff were just there. We heard so many times through out our 5 days in San Diego how the economy had hurt the tourism in the city so bad, but I didn't feel that the staff were excited, thankful etc. that they had guests. When I asked about addition things we could get at the hotel- I got a blank look b/c I didn't book it directly through the hotel even though I did try, but got a much better deal on travelocity. They have no shuttle for sea world, the zoo, down town etc. They don't have any idea of how to advise guests to use public transport either.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Hyatt Standards”
Reviews.Author: Jeannemacl
Reviews.Content: We had visited this property years ago when it was the Islandia. All I can say is that they rally haven't done beyond cosmetic touches much to upgrad it. In order to get a room above the first floor in the "old" section we had to pay an additional $30 a night. Granted we were there with a conference, butthe differnce was a bit extravagant. The bathroom needs upgrading; the hand lotion "amenity" was half used; the bashroom door needed to be repaired before we could coose it, the tile in the shower needs re-grouting. The pool area is beautiful, and the conference food we had was very good, but the on-site signage is poor, the walk-ways confusing and very dary at night, and the staff appeared to be uncertain what to do for a medium sized group (200 people).

Reviews.Title: “Good for business or personal travel.”
Reviews.Author: lorider11
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicer Hyatt's I've stayed at that is near an amusement attarction, in this case Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by its location”
Reviews.Author: LudwellMom
Reviews.Content: This property is beautifully located in Mission Bay but tattered at the edges. Our room was very clean and spacious, but the bathtub was cracked and peeling as was the wallpaper in several places. As we walked the property, we noticed the same sort of shabbiness in several places -- doors to conference rooms were seriously worn, hotel walls were marked up, etc. We ate at the Red Marlin Grill and were very pleased with our meal, but the prices are steep. In the mornings we opted for Einsteins Bagels -- a nice alternative along the boardwalk. We stayed several nights and enjoyed ourselves, but I do not think this property is up to the usual Hyatt standard. Perhaps our most disappointing experience was that, upon arrival late at night and with heavy luggage, we were completely ignored by the doorman. He simply did not acknowledge us let alone offer to assist (although we were the only guests arriving at the time). Again, not what we expect from Hyatt. The rest of the staff, and the concierge in particular, were extremely responsive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susana C
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old daugther and I had an awesome vacation at this hotel. It is extremely clean, with beautiful view and excellent facilities. It is located in a nice area of San Diego, only about 10 minutes from downtown, and right next to Sea World. The staff was super nice and friendly. We were very impressed and satisfied with this hotel. Highly recommend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: jws920
Reviews.Content: Overall great stay, beautiful property, good food, nice views, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: kik23
Reviews.Content: After a long day at the zoo we were ready to check into our room and relax. Our check in was quick (no line) but once we got to our rooms there were glasses and a plate left on our balcony. The second room had an ashtray full of cigarettes left on the balcony. In the hotel's defense there was a convention on property and the tent for the convention was near our rooms. It is possible that convention goers decided to use our balconies. Needless to say the items left were unacceptable. We are non smokers. I called the front desk and spoke with Laura. She offered to have it cleaned up or asked if we'd like to change our rooms. I told her to change our rooms. She told me that she had to do some checking since we had two rooms. It only took her about a minute to find us two rooms on the same floor close to each other. It is employees like Laura and your beautifully kept property that, when we travel back to the San Diego area and the price is right for your hotel, we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapporting with room”
Reviews.Author: Philip J
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel my wife and I stay in a very very long time. The room smelled. It was very small and look like a motel room we stay in back in the 70s. The room and where they put us was way below our expectations. Don,t be fool that this is 4 star as advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: VacaGypsy
Reviews.Content: The hotel and amenities are nice. I feel like the pool, landscaping, marina make this place. The standard room was very average. No upgrades given out here.

Reviews.Title: “Second Bad Hyatt Experience In 12 Months!!!”
Reviews.Author: tokkihazel
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 17th September for a 5 night stay in a Bay Front Suite, check in was OK. Arrived at the suite which was WAY BELOW expectations: on entering the lounge/seating area looked like something from a down-market car rental reception and was dark smelly and scruffy, the sliding door to the bathrom was jammed half open and the "balcony" was so small there was no room to stand because the two tiny wooden chairs were using all the space and you could not sit on them as there was no space between them to put your legs! We phoned reception and after about an hour a maintenance man arrived who fixed the bathroom door so it could be opened and closed. The bathroom itself was tatty, dirty and had seen better days, as had the whole suite. We were extremely unhappy and went to Reception and told the Manager we would only be staying one night instead of the five we had booked. It used to be that Hyatt was an up-scale brand, you paid a premium and received a premium product. The Hyatt Mission Bay Resort is trying successfully to destroy Hyatt's brand and reputation - DO NOT STAY THERE. Our previous bad experience at the Hyatt Santa Barbara combined with this disaster at Mission Bay means that after years of being a Hyatt Gold Passport Elite Member I have transferred my points elsewhere and will not risk staying at Hyatt in the future - very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gbtraveler2
Reviews.Content: Stayed October 27 for three nights with my wife and two children. The staff was very friendly and our room was perfect. We stayed in the tower on the club floor and had a great view of the ocean. The kids gave the pool and slides two thumbs up while we give the resort an "A" for cleanliness for the rooms, pool area and grounds. The afternoons were a little breezy at the pool each day when the on shore ocean breeze picked up. I'm sure this was just a result of the current weather pattern. The pool area was calm in the morning until after lunch and we had a great time enjoying the sun and water.

Reviews.Title: “Liked This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaAudrey
Reviews.Content: In late June we stayed at the Hyatt with our four grandchildren and daughter and son-in-law. I really don't understand some of these bad reviews. I thought it was a lovely hotel, well-located to see a lot of the San Diego attractions popular with children as long as you have a car. We had two connecting rooms in the Tower overlooking the pool area which we really liked. The three connecting pools are great for kids. Another plus was the senior rate offered by the Hyatt chain. I do agree that the food was over-priced in the bar, Red Marlin restaurant and even the bagel place. Also, the only bar was right by the pool. It would have been nice to have more of an "indoor" bar in the lobby area and to have a more casual sit-down restaurant than the Red Marlin.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I have ever been in in”
Reviews.Author: Surfer1012
Reviews.Content: I have never been in such a bad hotel, everything was horrible. Our rooms stank and they blamed it on the sea air. The food was horrible in every restaurant, the only decent thing about the hotel was the quick ascess to Sea World and San Diego Zoo. Overall this is a let down compared to the other hyatt's I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite upgrade delivers spectacular view(s) of bay and ocean.”
Reviews.Author: Weinbob
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline for $96 (thurs/fri/sat) and was offered an upgrade to corner suite for $25. Eighth floor, three views, balcony, seal or sea lion spotted daily , kayaks and boating sunshine spectacular views"experience" combined with 4 star sophisticated suite. Parking was $20 however it did not seem crowded and street parking seemed possible. Complicated but easy access to everything. Red Marlin restaurant pricy however great food and atmosphere. Good cheap fish and chips next door at marina. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Janus”
Reviews.Author: Mendeleev34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is, and if you've read a lot of the reviews here, kind of a two-faced monster in that guests can end up in one of two situations: tower rooms or bay rooms (I don't have any experience with the third option: the suites). We booked a room on priceline and were given a bay room, which is a motel style room. Upon getting to our room, we found a member of the service staff inside who said he had just replaced some kind of filter. The room smelled of powerful organic solvents. I'm a biochemist and I couldn't place the smell, but it was awful and headache inducing. Not to mention, the bathtub was more or less rotting out of the floor. We requested a new room and were given another bay room. This room smelled fine but was close to the hotel entrance and some of the bedding was ripped. My girlfriend and I looked at each other and just knew this would not be a relaxing situation for our weekend away. Both of the rooms we saw needed a total facelift. So we returned to the lobby for the third time, and I paid to upgrade to a tower room. I'd still say the tower room we got needed a little work (as far as cleaning) but it was so much better than the bay rooms. Plus, it had an awesome view, which distracts you from any other minor details (for example all of the dead bugs in the overhead light panel in the bathroom, or the ridiculously dirty patio furniture). The upgrade was well worth the price, I guess, but the thing is that when you go to a Hyatt, you just don't expect to see the kind of low quality rooms you find in the bay buildings (there are two of them). Additionally, you have to pay $20 per night for self parking. Yuck. I explained to one of the front desk personnel that the bay rooms I saw weren't consistent with Hyatt hotel quality. She replied that the bay rooms were their "standard rooms." I get that. If standard = disgusting. Had I not been locked into the priceline deal that I made, I would have left.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ccinchico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the warmth of October and found it very comfortable. We had a large suite that was on the first floor of the Suites building and in actuality it was too much room for us. We really never used the sitting room but it was so large that a family could have easily enjoyed the space. The room had nice views even if there was a small gate leading out to the boats right in front of us. This walk way did provide some traffic so we had to be careful to keep the curtains shut when walking around and dressing. For those looking for a beach hotel I would say this may have been a little out of the area but for family time like Sea World it was very conveient. With our case I do wish that there had of been more to "walk" to so this might not be my choice next time. We really enjoyed the little fire pit by the pool side bar and the various drinks that we partook in. It was quite relaxing outside during the Fall evening! Everyone that worked there was quite friendly as well. The pools and gardens were well maintained. We did not really get to enjoy them to swim in but they were beautiful in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: RSMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina suites ( a corner suite), where we got a very good corporate deal. Our experience was overall very positive, the location (overlooking the marina) and space /comfort of or room made it perfect for just relaxing and kicking back. We used Red Marlin mostly for breakfast, it is a little pricey, but we found the quality and service to be excellent. Daily housekeeping also very good We had a small problem on check in with our room not being ready due to some work being done, but the hotel were very nice about it and compensated us later with a free bottle of wine. If you can stay at one of the marina suites, would highly recommend. Sportsmens seafood's next door is great for a fresh fish takeout, if you want a cheap dining alternative. Firefly restaurant in the Dana hotel across the road also a good alternative, otherwise agree with a previous reviewer a car is needed. Downside is $20 a day for parking and don't make the mistake of thinking the small bottles of water in the fridge are complimentary ($5.90 a bit ridiculous!)

Reviews.Title: “It was just OKAY”
Reviews.Author: drewbucks11
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that I am by no means a picky person or someone that has my nose up in the air. I enjoy traveling and this was my first trip to San Diego (which was beautiful by the way). We stayed in the Tower, on the 9th floor. I was really nervous about the hotel after reading some of the reviews on here, but knowing we were in the tower made me feel better. But the fact is, it just wasn't that nice either. Everything in the room was dusty, the lamp shades were stained, the outdoor furniture was disgusting and the shower bottom was peeling up. The beds were nice and they did give us new towels everyday, but it just wasn't up to par for a 4 star "resort." Also, if you are a light sleeper, the seals bark all night long on the bay and will keep you up. We did not use the pool area as the water was FREEZING and it was so windy that even with the sun out, it was still chilly. It looked good though. Red Marlin is a joke. If you think you are going to a "fine dining" experience think again. Servers were RUDE and the food was not good. No way worth paying that much for that. There are too many nice places in San Diego to go here so I would recommend skipping without question. This was the most disappointing part of our trip. Great location for Mission Beach..we walked to the beach. The Wave House on the beach has GREAT food, and Luigi's on the Beach has the best pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views from the Tower”
Reviews.Author: LLSquared
Reviews.Content: I recently attended the Waste to Fuels Conference at the Hyatt Regency at Mission Bay... It is quite the facility, the hotel rooms themselves are nothing too special but the beds and balcony in the Tower are amazing! The bar in the hotel is also great and has a really neat outdoor fire pit (gas not wood). The pool is great for kids and adults and in the evenings they really didn't enforce the 11pm pool close as long as you were quiet. So take advantage of a late night dip in the hot tub! I would suggest a vehicle if you ever stay at the hotel because there are very few places to eat within walking distance... Mission Beach is a short and pleseant walk (<1 mile) from the hotel and has some great little shops and local eateries in addition to a long boardwalk. Don't bother talking to the concierge at the hotel, they offered poor information and were very rude!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Tower”
Reviews.Author: yippyskippy092
Reviews.Content: It seems to me there are two Hyatt Mission Bays - the Bay rooms and the Tower rooms. The reviews of the Tower seem to be generally positive whereas the reviews from people staying in the Bay rooms are rather negative. We stayed October 2-4. I got the room on priceline for $85 per night. Upon checkin I requested an upgrade to the tower and received one free of charge, since the hotel was not near capacity. Service was pleasant and efficient in every interaction. The room was quite nice. The view was breath-taking. The bath tub needed a bit of work. Rusty pipes and some chipped tile. All amenities were there. I checked right away after reading horror stories! Coffee was stocked, plenty of clean towels, hair dryer, magnifying mirror, etc. all accounted for. The carpet was spotted and appeared unclean. I blame the amount of children staying at this resort, plus the damp weather coming in more than I blame the cleaning staff. I slept like a log on those comfortable beds, lulled to sleep by the occassional barking seal. I never heard another human sound. Room service was very expensive but that is par for the course. I was sad to miss the summer only boat shuttle to SeaWorld but would never have gotten Hyatt at this price during summer . The weather was uncooperative and we didn't spend time at the pool but it looked quite nice. Dined at Red Marlin. Server was sweet but I think a bit young for such an upscale / expensive restaurant. He completely missed our salad order and was not particularly apologetic about it. The food was excellent and the view was gorgeous. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...but a little isolated....”
Reviews.Author: Denbo24
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with lovely views of Mission Bay...was 25 min walk to the nearest shops or bar...was a little disappointed with the room which felt a bit Claustrophobic and could have done with the benefit of a balcony ! Lovely pool area and The Red Marlin Restaurant was good...but a little expensive. A lot of kids in the pool so if you are looking for a child free hotel...maybe this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickpharris
Reviews.Content: we had a deluxe room with a sea view which was really nice. The hotel itself has a nice pool area and is in a great location for sea world but its far from downtown san diego ($25 in a taxi) and there is not much around there in terms of restaurants and amenities. Nice spot if you want a quiet pool holiday but not if you want something livelier

Reviews.Title: “Overrated,Overpriced & Not a Five Star!”
Reviews.Author: SeanM186605
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had been travelling around California for a week and had decided to make a week long stop at the Hyatt as it promotes itself as a resort hotel. While the hotel itself is nice enough, it was the staff reaction to a noisy neighbour that took from our stay a little. We had been checked into a room in Bay 2 which was ok but had an adjoining door to the next room to cater for families. This was locked when the rooms were sold separately. Two days before the end of our stay, what I can only describe as a number of neandertals moved in next door. As the door was not soundproofed we could here every word they said aswell as various other unidentified bodily sounds. I called down to the night manager to inform him of the situation and he was quite helpful offering to do it straight away. I declined as my girlfriend had miraculously fallen asleep but asked if we could move first thing in the morning. He provided us with some earplugs, said he would inform the day manager and it would not be a problem. The next morning I arrived down and found myself having to explain the situation again to the girl at the desk who offered me an upgrade for $50. I asked her why should I have to pay extra to move room when I just wanted a decent nights sleep? We would've been happy to stay where we were had the Beverly Hillbillies next door vacated the premises. She had to adjourn to the back with her manager who hadn't got the decency to come and talk to me face to face. Eventually with a delivery that should have led me to believe Moses had once again parted the Red Sea, the girl returned to announce " We are prepared to offer you a complimentary upgrade". Why thank you. The whole debacle took over an hour when it should have taken only a few minutes. The hotel seems to only want to cater for those whom money is not an issue to and preferably own a yacht. Upon check-in the girl asked if she could put a $450 hold on my credit card, when I asked why she quickly amended this to $200.????? Ate at the swim bar one evening and paid $60 for two average burgers and some wings. $6.95 for 15 minutes internet access, come on, what kind of a resort charges that? Surely it wouldn't kill them to provide complimentary access. If you like seafood, try Sportmans Seafood across the car park, doesn't look much from the outside but is good for some lunch. World Famous on Pacific Beach is worth the cab ride too. Overall, the staffs attitude soured our stay as we were made to feel like it was our fault that we wanted to move room. Certainly not a five star and we won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “A "Reactive" Customer Service Mindset In An Attempt To Compensate For An Aging Resort-Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TejasTiger
Reviews.Content: We had a poor experience, given the rating and class of this property. Items that did no work or were unsatisfactory included a broken A/C (forced move to room on edge of property), poor reception on TV, stray human hairs stuck on bathroom ceiling above shower, very low wireless signal and inoperable Ethernet jack (staff worked on but could not fix either, very annoying due to need to work from room), repeated requests for items missing from room, like binder containing property information and bath towels ( only 3 total on check in for 3 adults and child). Staff did what they could, seemed as if comping people was SOP for the hotel's many weaknesses. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “You must avoid the "Bay 2" Rooms”
Reviews.Author: groverly
Reviews.Content: I was given a room in the Bay 2 building on check in, told that my rate (Corporate) was only for rooms in that building, not in the tower. The building was motel style with open-to-the-outside doors.... Kind of creeped me out. The room looked ok, decor-wise, but was dark and very musty. My co-worker was spot-on when she said that the smell of my room was like a basement. ew. I requested another room (less musty please) and finally given a room at the very bottom of the tower. It smelled far better and did not have the damp-dark feel of the Bay building. Be sure to AVOID the Bay buildings. I am pretty sure those are the rooms that are generating all of the bad reviews on here. Other items: Swim bar was great place to hang out, casual, great for football watching, cool bartenders (this is a bar BY the pool, not a cheesy swim up bar) Red Marlin food and service was great! Enjoyed a nice breakfast and dinner there, very enjoyable, significantly betterr than most hotel restaurants. If you like to run, ask the concierge for a map. They have little cards to take at guide you on 3 and 6 mile routes.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Mission Bay - Motel not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reidwb
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was at best a Motel, On arrival we were told that the room we booked was not available and so were 'upgraded' to a suite that had two queen size beds (we booked a King Deluxe Room). As it was 9pm when we arrived we had no choice but to take the room. On arrival at the room, we found it to be dirty with wet cleaning cloth's on the floor and table, the bedding had holes in it, some of the towels had obviously been used and then put back on the towel holder. The enamel surface on the bath was missing in large areas so leaving a chipped surface so making it unsuitable for having a bath and the blinds on one of the windows was held on with White tape. The lounge area was dark and smelt dirty/damp. We complained the following morning and was advised that there was currently no alternative at that time but they would call later on that day when a room was free. We left the hotel all day and received no phone call so on our return I went to reception and complained again, this time we were offered another room again a suit in the same block, this room was cleaner however the following morning we noticed a smell of Sewerage from the bathroom, missing foam seats on the chairs on the balcony and the patio door glass was misted up so you could hardly see out of them, I phone reception and asked for someone to have a look at the terrible smell, two days passed and not one came, I then complained again and a man turned up with some drain cleaner, this resolved the problem for a few hours then it returned. The following day we checked out and I complained again about the smell. In short after staying a various Hyatt Hotels around the world this would have to be the worst of any hotel I have ever stayed in, the fact that this hotel has supposed to have recently had a $46 million dollar upgrade is a total joke as the rooms are tatty and dated as as for the pool area, this had old and warn sun beds and the pool had a large chuck of concrete missing from the side leaving a sharp edge that could easily result in an injury. In addition, the 'Suites' are located right on the Marina which is open to the public, this resulted on a few occasions looking out onto the public foot pat and finding one of the local down and outs going through the bin which made us feel very uneasy as there are NO locks on the patio doors overlooking this area. Whilst the 'Hotel' is in a good location for Sea World I would recommend you look else were, maybe the Hyatt at Manchester whilst a 20

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a Resort without the extra fee or golf course (thankfully)”
Reviews.Author: 4-star-traveler1952
Reviews.Content: I think I found my new home on the west coast. I could live on "my" balcony on the 11th floor. Arrival: you know you aren't in Kansas (or Boston) when you find no "please use the revolving door even if you're too tired to push it" sign. The lobby always has two wide open doorways at either end with sea air flowing through. It also has 2 small modern gas fireplaces so if one is already taken your party can share the other. Melissa jumped through hoops to get us the perfect room (but then, all rooms in the tower have balconies and views ... so everyone wins.) Main attraction: This place is based on water, 3 regular heated outdoor pools, 3 water slides for the kids (though ours is a little old for these) and the most popular of all, the oversized hot tub. (Sorry, almost forgot the dock on the bay just off the ocean) If you are paying attention, you now know that this hotel features the four elements from the pre-science of alchemy: air, fire, water and earth (it is on shore, not in the bay.). So why go here if you don't golf? swimming, sunning, spa, walk to Sea World (literally), bike to Mission Beach for breakfast at Kono's, or rent anything you can imagine down at the docks: paddle boat, canoe, kayak, motor boat, personal water craft, you name it. Plenty of staff (more than guests?). For balance, I can only advise that the tower is the place to be. It may not affect you but my wife's intuition told her that she didn't feel safe in the motel-like, 3-story suite building. For her, the extra space wasn't worth it. But I don't have intuition and if you don't either you'll be fine there - - there is a keyed security door and the place has plenty of human security. Full disclosure: I can be a little biased at any Hyatt because I love the brand - - a cut above the Big 3 and many more properties than Fairmont. But when room service promises 30 minutes but arrives in 10? Someone is trying very hard to please you. I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roaddogg_BC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our anniversary night on the 14th floor. We had a clean and comfortable room with a balcony and view of the hotel pools/hot tub and Mission Bay. We also had a fantastic time at the poolside SWIM lounge. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous. We would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Christy617
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay! The rooms were very nice and comfortable and our view was fantastic. We had a great view of Mission Bay. We will definitely be making another trip to the Hyatt in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for my husband's work trip”
Reviews.Author: KaleeRae85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year for my husband's work conference. Even with our afternoon planned, I felt like I was on vacation. When we checked in we were bumped to a tower deluxe corner room with a great view. We had our own cubby hole for our bed, living room area, and a balcony. I never got to swim because of the fluke weather, but enjoyed looking at the nice property. It's neat getting to see all of the seal out and about on the marina. The staff was very helpful and recommended on our free day that we go to La Jolla. They even helped us rent a car. **TIP if you are in San Diego you must make the short drive to La Jolla. Absolutely breathtaking coast line, beautiful sunset, and so close to the seals. Pro: -This property is exactly like the hotel pictures. -Very clean -Friendly staff -Excellent food prepared for the conference. I think I gained 10 pounds before the week was over. -Beautiful landscaping. Cons: -No airport transportation. -Not about the hotel, but San Diego was cold and rainy when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: TNTORTIZ8809
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a waterfront suite for a 10 day family vacation. This is as objective as it gets. The hotel is split between the tower, two buildings labeled Bay I and Bay II, and the suites building. I know many people have stated they had old, worn, smelly rooms in the tower and in rooms in Bay I & II, however there was no such smell in our suite and the furniture was actually quite nice. My wife and I have stayed at many Hyatt resorts and the furniture was consistent with the Hyatt style. The grounds were very nice and we walked them almost every morning with coffee. We had a nice (but small) balcony on the 3rd floor of the suites building. The view was very nice overlooking the boardwalk and marina. For anyone in the suites....yes the sea lions do bark, yes you can hear them in the suites and YES THEY DO THIS ALL NIGHT LONG! Lucky for us, we're not light sleepers, but there were a few nights we woke up in the middle of the night from our lovely 2yr old's kicking and could still hear the barks. Belmont Park and Mission Beach IS, let me repeat that IS in walking distance and can easily be walked to. Anyone who is posting that it's impossible to walk to or it's too far is BEING LAZY! It's about a mile away and it's a very scenic and relaxing walk. You will need a car to get around and do other things such as going to Garnett and Mission Blvd where you'll find a majority of the bars, restaurants and shops. Also, you will need a car or taxi to get to SeaWorld. BE ADVISED-if you are getting the GoSanDiego cards (which were amazing and I highly recommend) you cannot take the water taxi from the hotel. This is because the water taxi goes to the back entrance of Seaworld where you have to present the actual paper ticket. Well with the GoSanDiego Cards you have to go to the ticket counter, present your card and then get the paper ticket...not possible to do with the water taxi as there is no ticket counter at the back entrance. The food...the only food purchased from the hotel restaurants were bagels one morning from Einsteins and coffee daily (need it to function). We did not try the Red Marlin, we thought about ordering from SWIM the poolside place, but the prices were honestly ridiculous. I recommend going around and trying local eateries and restaurants, this worked out well for us. If you find yourself in the Carlsbad area...LOOK UP ANGELOS BURGERS...OMG!!!! The most amazing place ever, tons of food, great value and absolutely delicious! Weeks later and we're still talking about Angelos. They have different chains we went to one in Oceanside and one in Irvine. Other than that...staff was okay, didn't interact with them much. The kids loved the movie night, but we got our own smores ingredients from the Ralph's supermarket on MIssion Blvd. The kids loved, loved, loved the waterslides...perfect for all three of them ages 2(almost 3), 8 &10. BTW, we got parking for free. We checked in late (around 12:30am) and I didn't want to pay $20 for parking so I mentioned to my wife in front of the guy at the check in counter that I'll just park in the street and carry the bags, well he offered to cover our parking for us for the whole stay....GREAT! It is a nice hotel, there is quite a bit of nickel and diming but you don't HAVE to spend the extra money if you choose not to. We'd stay again, but it's a little sad that the Hyatt brand would go so far to nickel and dime it's guests....oh and one last thing....NO FREE WIFI!!!!! If one could go to a motel 8 or Starbucks and get it, the Hyatt can afford to offer it to it's guests! I have pics of the suite if anyone would like me to fwd them along.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Getaway with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Simchok
Reviews.Content: Stayted here July/August. This place was perfect for a family getaway with our twin 2.5 year olds. We booked a room in the main tower (they are not clear on the website - I believe they are the rooms that are listed as Deluxe Queen Ocean View) and my kids loved it! You can see the ocean, the marina with boats, AND the fireworks from Sea World every night at 9:50pm. Request a high floor. The grounds are perfect if you are with little kids. There are little nooks where you can hang out and read and the kids can run around safely. The pool is also perfect for kids; especially the water slide. The big fire pit was fantastic at nights and my boys loved making their first Smores! Red Marlin is great - amazing food, decor, service, and they know how to treat families with young children. The $5 per adult boat ride to Sea World is a MUST (The hotel has its own boat that takes you there). First of all, that alone is an experience for the kids. Secondly, you get a VIP back door entrance and avoid the crowds. Note that you have to have pre-purchased Sea World tickets though to get in through that entrance. Last, the "captains" were fantastic and would stop or slow down so the kids could sea the seals, pelicans, etc. Oh, and with a AAA discount we saved over $30 a night! Another note: We drove 10 minutes to Downtown San Diego and spent one evening there, eating and walking and we also caught the Sea World fireworks from there. Came back to the hotel, made Smores, and hit the sack. Look, this is not a 5 star hotel, but it gets 5 stars in my review because it was everything that we wanted and needed for a family vacation. I would even come back here with my wife sans kids.

Reviews.Title: “happy”
Reviews.Author: UofMN
Reviews.Content: great location, right on the ocean. nice staff, need car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Best Granola Ever”
Reviews.Author: Islandheat
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Hyatt Mission Bay for two nights in the early part of August, 2011. Our room on the 14th floor was clean and had a good view of the bay area. We took the water taxi to Sea World, a nice feature not found at other hotels. We enjoyed pool area, but getting a lounge chair by the pool wasn't easy during the afternoon, and the hot tub was a little crowded at times. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant - The Red Marlin - and enjoyed the best granola ever. We commented on the granola to the table server and she told us about the chef who was acquired recently by the restaurant. Yes, I'm raving about the granola, it was that good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowgirl_upquilts
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip with my husband. I could walk to a lot of places from this hotel. We were also there during the blackout. I felt like they did a great job of keeping everyone informed of what was going on. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: miloSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with resort like pool. Our room faced the marina and at night we got a front row view of fireworks at Sea World!

Reviews.Title: “"Unbelievably poor"”
Reviews.Author: Mkrt1972
Reviews.Content: Anyone that has enjoyed their stay and has been satisfied with the rooms at this Hyatt property has made poor choices previously in hotel selection. I booked through British Airways and was placed at the far end of the building. The room I was allocated led directly out to a communal walkway with open ceiling structure and direct access from the street with no security. This in my opinion would class this as a "Motel". It is difficult to describe how poor the condition of the "Motel" room that I stayed in was. The smell was intoxicating, the cleanliness was unacceptable. The front desk blamed the smell on being located close to the bay. I booked a four night stay and left after one. Don't be fooled by the Hotel websites advertising and pictures because their interpretation of contemporary furniture is poorly constructed flat pack units made of chipboard and vinyl covering.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday2010oct
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and had a fantastic stay, on checking in we asked to upgrade our room to the 'Tower' which they did for an additional charge of $20 dollars per night, which we felt was very reasonable. The room overlooked the pool, small balcony, plenty of room for a family of 4, good view of the beaches, the sunset in evening is worth watching. We booked into the 'The Red Marlin' for our first evening, this is worth visiting not cheap, but the food and setting is worth the money,we also used the pool side bar and bagel cafe and again very good value all the staff could not have been more helpful.We used the 'Water Taxi' to Sea World this is a must for $5 dollars return takes you right into the middle of the park no hassle with queuing to get in. Location you do need a hire car, we used taxis in the evening to go out for dinner, which worked out at $10 each each way into Ocean or Pacific beach which we felt was not out of the way. We a great stay and would stay here again, but would only use the 'Tower' rooms or 'Suites' .

Reviews.Title: “Stay away . . . filthy”
Reviews.Author: JC99_11
Reviews.Content: My room smelled moldy, the carpet was thin, stained, and . . . well gross, the walls were filthy and looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years. The walls were rice-paper thin. The only pleasant part of this hotel was the Staff . . . they were happy and helpful. I wonder if Hyatt knows this place is destroying the value of its brand.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia M
Reviews.Content: Did not have a good experience at this hotel. We were up-sold at the front desk on check-in. I did not consider the room we received to be an upgrade at all. Our room was overlooking the pool, however, this proved to be a very loud room. We should have been told that they show a movie every Saturday night poolside and that it might be loud, but were not (it was actually loud all weekend fromt the pool users). Called the front desk and spoke to the manager on duty who was actually quite rude to me and raised her voice. I did not appreciate that. All she wanted to do was pass the buck. Her response was that the film will only last 45 more minutes...enough to ruin our evening. We felt like we had to leave the room while the movie was playing and we did. She sent up a bottle of wine, but that was way too little, too late. Additionally, the room was FILTHY! Dirty and stained couch including the pillows, stained lamp shades and stained draperies. Upon check out, I spoke with one of the front office supervisors who deleted the upgrade fees from our bill after I asked. Again, nice enough gesture, but way too little too late. I will tell everyone I know not to stay here and I will never be back. I expected more from the Hyatt name.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I expected.”
Reviews.Author: jennembler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights for our family vacation. We were in one of the suites which was average at best. When we arrived our sink was backed up and the light in the bathroom was out. They had to fix both and ended up refunding us one nights stay. The location is beautiful and they have a very nice pool area. We really like the pool. They also have a very nice workout facility. The concierge was very helpful in helping us find fun things to do and places to visit while we were there. We might stay there again, if we can't find something better.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nicola S
Reviews.Content: This was our final stop during a three week tour around California with two young teens and husband. During all our other stays in a variety of hotels we always felt and appreciated genuine American warmth, friendliness and hospitality. We had really looked forward to this hotel as it looked great in the brochures and felt that negative reviews focused on stuff that didn't really bother us. However although everything was clean and efficient, the place certainly lacked charm and heart. Money was clearly the most important thing on the agenda. Actually it did annoy us to be charged for eveything. They offered us the same water bottles that I had bought (24 for $5) with us at $2.75 a go. We paid $6.75 per 15 minutes to use computers and although we were told printing boarding passes was free we were charged for that too. Ironic that we had to check in on line for home here as in all other places it would have been free! Parking was extra and both restaurants were pricy but tasty! Concierge was quite rude and abrupt- again a new experience in California. Pool was great to look at but busy and noisy at all times. Also true that walls are very thin- did not sleep well here!

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: SDteach126
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear for my wedding, the night before and the night of. Room was not ready by check in time, 4:00. Front desk was rude and uncooperative. Room was decent, but toilet ran and room had a funky smell. Sea Lions are charming during the day, but noisy all night long. Fitness center small and cramped, no room for any matt stretching or exercising. Not impressed, would not recommend. Think there is better out there for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place close to Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: jacksuncle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 24 and 25, 2011. Had booked through Hotwire. No resort fee was charged that I saw, which was great, I though they charged that but I guess not. Parking was self park, $20 per day. Location was less than 10 minutes to Sea World, and since it was the summer, we took the Hyatt water taxi to Sea World the second day, it was great for my girls. Location right on the marina was nice, as was the Red Marlin restaurant. We had two rooms, one was fine, one did have a slightly musty smell, but in checking the room, didn't see any mildew or anything like that. Room itself was fine, it won't be mistaken for a Mandarin Oriental, but was adequate. The location was definitely the best part, right on the water, and you could rent kayaks, paddle boards, etc. All in all a good stay, and I think it was in line with what I expected. Just wish it would have had free wifi with the price. As for noise, etc. there wasn't anything that I heard, but I was on the 2nd floor on the side building, so no one above me and my mother stayed next to me on one side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Near Sea World”
Reviews.Author: tmcinnis949
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here at least four times in the past few years and we keep coming back. The hotel is clean and in great shape. The staff is friendly and professional. The hotel is in a beautiful location, with ocean or harbor views from every room. It's a 5 minute drive to Sea World, or you can take a 10 minute boat ride from the hotel to Sea World. The zoo is only 15 minutes by car. There are several pools and three water slides -- one for younger kids, and two for the older ones. During the height of the season, the pool area gets very crowded, so be prepared. There's an outdoor fire pit near the pool where you can make s'mores (hotel will provide the ingredients and tools). The hotel restaurant, Red Marlin, not only has great harbor views, but is very family friendly. However, it is on the pricey side for adult meals. It has a good breakfast buffet, but as an alternative, there's an Einstein's Bagels a short walk along the waterfront from the hotel, near the hotel fitness center. You can also pick up wine and food at the provisions store connected to Einstein's. Kayaks and other small boats can be rented next to the fitness center as well. All in all, it's one of the best places to stay in San Diego, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “"We enjoyed our stay but..."”
Reviews.Author: Amee78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is asthetically beautiful on all accounts and has plenty to offer with it's water slides and movie night at the pool for the kids but it lacked affordable dining options. The cleanliness leaves room for improvement. However, the customer service was excellent. The front desk attendant and the concierge were very helpful and accomodating. We were overall pleased with our stay there for the second time. I would come back when the kids are older. A little tip to save money is to park on the street instead of paying an additional $20 a night.

Reviews.Title: “The Sealions Barked All Night Long....”
Reviews.Author: KidsTravelGreat
Reviews.Content: After reading countless reviews, I booked three nights at the Hyatt Mission Bay during our recent trip to San Diego in August 2011. We booked a one bedroom suite with a separate living room overlooking the bay. The room showed signs of wear with stains on the floor and couches in the living area. The porcelain in the bathtub was significantly worn and chipped. I would have checked out after the first night, but I pre-paid for the suite to obtain a better rate of $370+ a night and it was non-refundable. The room was clean. However, sealions perch on a dock at the marina in front of the suites and bark incessantly all night long. I have never knew sealions could bark so loudly. The only saving grace was that the room was clean and my two boys enjoyed racing down the waterslides at the pool. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE RIP OFF!”
Reviews.Author: kevinsyou
Reviews.Content: They should be given 1 star and only for the restaurant "red marlin." everything else about this hotel is motel 6 quality but then again I've stayed at motel 6's that are better than this DUMP. Not one thing about this place is a "resort," perhaps they need to do a little research on the term. DO NOT spend your money here, it's simply not worth the $200+ you are going to spend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- suites too remote - too cold/windy for pool”
Reviews.Author: julieod
Reviews.Content: I stayed here w/my family- 2 kids ages 3 and almost 2 for four nights. We enjoyed our stay for the most part. As other reviewers have wrote- parking & wifi are expensive but most hotels in San Diego have this charge as well. I was worried about mold issues but didn't have a problem with that either. Self park if in the suites- as it is very far to the valet lot. The hotel is quite remote- there is not much right there if you like to walk to several options to eat, etc. Take a drive to Mission Beach- it's very close! Pool- water slides were great- there is a tiny one for all ages but the two larger ones were 42 inches and they are strict on it. My 3 year old was disappointed he couldn't get on there. Older kids seemed to be having a blast and there was one organized race/activity for them during the day. However, the pool was freezing in the middle of August. It really needs a heater. Unless your child is a bit older and will stay in no matter how cold it is - we spent more time in a very crowded hot tub. The staff said it was like this all of the time- and this was pretty calm. I expected to spend a lot more time at the pool. Also- there's a ridiculously small number of lounge chairs at the hotel. We were offered folding chairs two days. Annoyingly, some people would leave an item on a chair but be gone for 3/4 of the day to reserve for later. Food- HIGHLY recommend the fish & chips at the restaurant just before the hotel- I believe it's called the Sportsmen Lounge. Fish tacos just ok. Cheap beer, etc. compared to the hotel and if staying in the suites- very close. We ate at Sweim once- which was just ok- kids liked the fish tank. Smores kits were a lot of fun- are for purchase f $20 - last about 2 nights- or bring your own if you plan ahead. Rooms- we only entered the lobby/main part of the hotel once after checking in- the suites are quite remote. It seemed like they just bought a motel next door and redid it. We didn't really like it. There was strange club music as you walk into the unmanned lobby- which required a room key. It was the awkward- do you hold the door open for someone coming- but wanting to be sure they were staying here. The rooms were nice enough- separate bedroom- small hallway w/bathroom btwn bedroom and living room with pocket doors. You can hear people walking along the marina early in the morning so plan to be an early riser. They really should have tile floors throughout- as the carpeting always seemed slightly damp- especially if sliding door was left open. We were on the 2nd floor- i believe 219- we had a slight view of the fireworks. I would ask for a 3rd floor room a little closer to the hotel so you can see them well. All in all the hotel was nice- but overpriced for what it was. I would try somewhere else if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: jandjfox
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st stay here w/ my husband and two kids, 8 and 6, and we enjoyed everything except having to pay $20 to self park and another $20 for internet service. Also wish there was a coin-operated laundry room to wash our wet and dirty pool/beach clothes. These were the only negatives about this hotel. Next time, we might opt to try and park for free on the street which was literally steps away from the hotel anyways. As for the positives...we stayed on the 4th floor in the tower w/a great view of the marina. I must compliment the entire staff being always friendly and helpful everywhere we went from check-in, concierge, restaurants, pool, housekeeping, etc... Of course my kids LOVED the waterslides ! They also loved making smores at night. Btw, the smores kit cost $20 and provides you 4 sticks w/enough of everything for 2 nights worth. We went to SeaWorld and decided to drive vs. take the water ferry to have the option of leaving and coming back. The water ferry cost was $5/adult and $3/kid....VS. $14 parking your car at SeaWorld. This hotel is also just about 2 miles away from Mission Beach and we enjoyed a day there. For food, we ate at the Red Marlin 1 night, which was fantastic and worth the $70 dinner bill. We ate every morning at Einstein Bagels which was conveniently located on the Marina. The hotel has a fantastic workout room overlooking the Marina w/a t.v. on each cardio machine. Another nice touch was the complimentary morning paper and apples in the lobby ! We would definately like to come back again !!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mycollage8
Reviews.Content: After reading some horrible reviews of the bay suites (our accommodation) I was a nervous wreck when the bell man showed us to our room. Wow. What a nice surprise. It was spacious, clean had a beautiful view and none of the bad things I read in the reviews. The employees are wonderful. Our 10 year old loved his bedroom (the living room with a great TV) and we were very happy. The water taxi to Sea World is a good feature.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Bank Account when you get back home”
Reviews.Author: seanie94
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family have stayed at many Hyatt hotels across the USA and have always enjoyed them, hence the reason for choosing this particular hotel over many others, the hotel itself is in an ideal spot to explore San Diego although it did feel a little secluded and if you wanted to dine anywhere other that at the hotel you would need a car or a taxi, the rooms were spacious and clean and as we were on the 15th floor of the hotel we had a great view of the nightly Seaworld fireworks, unfortunately this is as far as the compliments go. The pool area although having 3 pools is particularly small and on a number of occasions we found groups of people waiting for sunbeds as the pool area was simply full, another disturbing issue is the number of children that slipped over around the poolside Hyatt really must sort this problem out before someone gets seriously injured. It has been mentioned before in other reviews about the cost of the internet which is shocking at $6 for 15 minutes or $9.95 per day per DEVICE and an additional $20.00 per day to park you car (The Hyatt really should take this kind of feedback into consideration as a number of other reviewers have also commented on exactly the same issues and I am sure that a lot of potential customers will be reticent from staying here because of these ridiculous charges). However the biggest issue I have with this hotel is the fact that although I had pre-paid for my accommodation in full via British Airways 8 months in advance of arriving at the hotel I was staggered to find that upon checking my Bank Account when i returned home to England that the Hyatt had deducted the full amount for the 7 night stay again from my bank account! After a conversation with their customer services department they admitted that this amount should have deducted from British Airways and not my account. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world and this is the first time this has ever happened to me. I would definitely come back to San Diego as I thought it was one of the best cities in the USA but I would definitely not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you have small children run for the hills!”
Reviews.Author: Denise E
Reviews.Content: My husband I arrived with our 13 year old daughter on a Friday. We stayed in a Regency Club room (very nice). We checked in online and were advised that our room was ready at 9:00 a.m. We arrived at 2:00 and were told our room would not be ready for 2 hours. We showed them our confirmation e-mail for early check in and they were "so sorry". The Regency Club was very nice and we used it to check e-mail, happy hour and breakfast. That was the best part. Here was the worst. We had to go the front desk no less than 10 times in three days to replace keys. We could not get into the pool. The Gym. Our floor. Over and over again. And we were not alone; there was a never ending line of people getting new keys. Next - the pool. The pool are is not very big. There is a huge garden area with seating areas that nobody uses but there are a LOT of people jammed into the pool. If you have small children under 4 this is probably acceptable, but there were way too many people. Running, yelling, jumping in the water. Twice there was an "accident" in the kids' pool area, so it needed to be closed and cleaned. Last, the beds. We were really surprised at the lack of quality. Backache is an understatement. The staff was great and seemed a bit overwhelmed by the busy weekend. We would probably pass on this resort and choose another Hyatt in San Diego instead.

Reviews.Title: “a bit of a disappointment ...”
Reviews.Author: RonandLou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was fine, but not what I expected.... 1. Check in took AGES 2. The room was not cleaned properly - my pet hotel hate is hairs in the bath.. you guessed it, yuk, hairs indeed. This and the mini bar wasn't re-stcoked and was worried we would be charged for things we hadn't used so I called the housekeeping team and explained my concerns. Given that I had already raised the concern I did expect that next time they would do a better job... they didn't, 3. Car parking charges are high. Though I am not sure if this is imposed by the state or the hotel - either way we were not anticipating these charges, so if you go consider this. Considering all of the above I probably would not go back, though it does have a lovely location overlooking the bay, a nice fire pit in the pool/bar area and was close enough for our trip to SeaWorld, but probably not great value for money

Reviews.Title: “enjoying the bay”
Reviews.Author: charger06Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay, centrally located and great place to walk around the Bay. Beautiful view from the upper floors overlooking all the boats! Great !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: april_honeybee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is WONDERFUL for families! After a terrible night at the Harborview Inn and Suites no thanks to hotels.com for a last minute booking. We finally arrived at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay. As I walked into the lobby to check in I was greeted with a, "Welcome to the Hyatt Mrs. Rosales". What a breath of fresh air! We were checked in quickly, answered every question, and given every detail about our stay. The gentleman working the front desk apologize for our horrible experience with hotels.com and the Harborview Inn and Suites. He agreed that it sounded awful and assured us that the Hyatt would make sure that our stay was comfortable and relaxing. We got the room key and hurried up to the waterfront suite. We walked into the room and my jaw just dropped. BEAUTIFUL, comfortable, contemporary, large, and with a gorgeous view of Mission Bay's marina. I LOVED it! I immediately collapsed onto the bed, it was soft and smelled so clean! The kids were so happy! They loved the sound of the seals barking and the seagulls in the distance. After relaxing in our room for a bit, we all got dressed and headed to the pool with WATER SLIDES! My 6 year old was in pure heaven! So was my 3 year old because they had one the perfect size for her. They both went down those water slides a ton of times while my husband and I drank a margarita and gave a toast to beginning of our wonderful vacation! It was fabulous! One thing I can say is that this hotel is for families. It would be hard to avoid the scene of extremely happily playing children. If you have no children and want a relaxing adult vacation by the poolside, I would not recommend this hotel. Otherwise, for my family it was probably the best vacation we've ever had thanks to the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay!

Reviews.Title: “nice central location”
Reviews.Author: kala6763
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hyatt mission bay for a conference. overall nice central location, near sea word, the zoo and balboa park, beaches. the rooms were clean, just slightly dated. staff was overall friendly and helpful. Mission bay is extremely popular with locals and visitors, driving around the bay can be somewhat intimidating, a GPS is a lifesaver. We stayed in the tower and had a nice view of the fireworks at Sea World. overall satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lions1
Reviews.Content: Had a large room overlooking harbour 2 double beds plus sitting room with extra tv great pool area and hotel ran childrens activities, food at both dining venues was very good and well priced, San Diegos attractions are well spread out so a car is an advantage

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: Masie01
Reviews.Content: Room was musty smelling, stain on the ceiling, the door to the room would not shut properly, AC not working properly. Internet $6 for 15 minutes and $20/25 to park you car a DAY. REALLY! I am not a complainer but I was disappointed in this Hyatt. The one in Long Beach Ca was lovely. This one not so much. Big whoop they removed $40 from the parking charges and doubled my points they could have done better. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTCI!”
Reviews.Author: CassieinRSF
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego, and have several friends visit me throughout the year. I stayed for my brithday and I thought it was great! Ths hotel is one of the best! The staff was great, very professional and friendly. Commented on a hallway odor and the next minute they had fans and cleaners fixing the problem. The room was gorgeous and the view unbeatable. It is walking distance to Ocean Beach, but you do have to drive other places, like you would from any other hotel. It would be nice if the parking was not so much. I understand with hotells downtown where parking is at a premium, but this hotel has plenty of room and I really think it shoudl be complimentary, given the location. I agree with another review that coudn't understand why people were so negative. it's fabulous and like a tropical vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Perfect location...Staff...oh well!”
Reviews.Author: RollPositive
Reviews.Content: We stay each 4th of July week in San Diego and stay here at Mission bay Hyatt or on the beach at Ocean park...based on who gives the best rate. This year is was Hyatt, Arrival is hit and miss, sometimes the come out to great you and help with bags, this year a miss... Its been remodeled so lobby is nice open and fast check in, it was my Nieces 9th birthday and the young lady that checked us in said she would arrange something special on day 5 for her and never did? We upgraded to marina suite so the room is big, bathroom is big and small patio over looking the harbor! Over all the hotel is great, nice pool with water slides, game for the kids, outdoor bar and fire pit you can do smores at night. Staff for the most part friendly helpful. We had one issue with housekeeping not really cleaning and straitening our room each day and the manger said they always get blamed for stealing so they leave personal things right where you leave them the night before? Only complaint we had was we had a birthday cake delivered from room service our last morning and it was $50 for a kids cake? Over all great place to vacation, relax and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bean1e0
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights and were impressed. The location is great, the hotel is right on the beach with a brilliant hotel pool area and really good choice of food. Staff were all helpful and friendly. The room we had was slightly dated but with such lovely grounds we were happy to spend most of the time out of the room anyway. Our friends had a room nearer the pool area which had a lovely veranda area onto a garden, our room had a balcony looking out towards the beach. Overall a good hotel, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: joglen10
Reviews.Content: We always book Hyatt whenever we travel. And the hotel and its service is one reason why we always do. We always do not expect perfect accomodation, this hotel may be dated but with its proper maintenance, we would not mind. The location is great, close to the beach and to the major attraction in San Diego - Seaworld. Check in was a breeze for us and being a member in one of their rewards programs has its perks. Overall, this hotel is perfectly located, great for honeymooners and vacationers and close to major watersports activities. It's not perfect, its not really brand new but the staff made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephmck1312
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a Hyatt in Florida a few years ago which we loved, we thought we would try this one, as it looked nice and was convenient for the San Diego Zoo and Seaworld. We waited 2 1/2 hours for check in as our rooms were not available! Quite honestly I wish we had left then as by the time we did get to our room 'Disgusting' doesn't come close to the standard of it! They tried to mask the awful smell of damp and mold with an over powering smell of room spray. There was mold on the air conditioner unit, the bins, the bath everywhere! There was a communal balcony, which left little privacy. It was noisy at night. The food in the main restaurant was inedible,the toilets in there had a strong smell of urine and someone was hoovering near us whilst we ate. We checked out a day earlier even though we had already payed for it! Apart from concierge staff were very unhelpful. We would NEVER stay here again even if it was for free! Believe all the bad reviews that you have read!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool but Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: firefly6
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great pool with three slides that the kids loved. Although they did run out of pool towels by 3 pm. We had a jr. suite which was spacious and had a great view (especially of the fireworks over Sea World). However, the cleanliness was not what I expected for what we paid. Service for dinner at the restauant was horrible. Children's buffet food was cold and they didn't replenish when items were gone. Adult meals were average. Location was perfect for going to Sea World and they offered a shuttle (boat) ride to the park. The boat let you off at the back entrance so you have the park to yourself for a while before the crowds pour in from front gate. Overall, hotel was great location but poor service. Wouldn't pay that price again for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this family friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: Took my 8 and 11 year old kids last summer, just forgot to review it then. We stayed in the suites in the bay the first few nights. It was right on the marina, and we had a great view of the awesome sea lions! One problem….they bark at 2:30 in the morning. No problem, I called the front desk and they sent me a fan to help diffuse the noise! The staff was always accomodating. We decided to move to a tower room for the last 2 nights and I think we liked it better. It wasn't a suite, but the room was very large and still had a sofa and king bed. The view was phenomenal. There was a water taxi to take you to the back gate at Sea World every half hour. (just $5 for 10 and up) Well worth it, and fun as they take you right by the sea lions basking in the sun. We did paddle boats and kayaking in the bay, had sea lions swimming around us. It was so fun and the kids especially loved it. I have never been disappointed with a Hyatt Regency. The pool was heated and had water slides for the kids. The restaurant on property was good, but a little pricey. But overall, we had a fantastic time and would love to go again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute beach trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: andysmom
Reviews.Content: Summer in Arizona is like living in an open oven, so many families like to trek across the desert to San Diego to escape. San Diego, however, is like Times Square at New Years so you need to plan ahead to find a decent hotel, condo, timeshare, etc. We decided last minute to drive over for one last beach trip before school starts so finding a decent place to stay near the ocean was not easy. Unless you can stay near the beach, it's dumb to go...why drive 6 hours to the beach if you have to stay inland? I looked at every condo rental site and all the beachfront hotels from Coronado to Carlsbad and there were just 2 or 3 available for 5 days in late July. I decided on this hotel because of its great location and have not been disappointed about that. A $5 water taxi ride took us to Sea World yesterday and we avoided the crowd and parking nightmare by coming in "the back door". Our ticket is good for consecutive days so we ran around the park in the morning doing all the rides and when the weekend crowd swelled, we took our water taxi back to the hotel and spent the rest of the afternoon at the beach. We plan to do the same tomorrow. The pool at the hotel, however, is in some sort of wind tunnel so the pool was not fun for the kids nor for us...it's the strangest thing. The first room they put us in was looking over a roof and air con unit...totally unacceptable...so I paid for an upgrade and we're now on the 17th floor, Concierge level, which is fabulous. Free breakfast in the a.m. and Happy Hour could replace dinner if desired...love the cocktail selection too. It doesn't get any better than having a free glass on wine in your room looking out at the beautiful ocean! We have a perfect view of the fireworks at SeaWorld which starts at 9:50 every night. For $300/night, this place is a bargain considering the other options, time of year, late booking and location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this location!”
Reviews.Author: Arizona828
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in June. Staff was wonderful and our room, gorgeous. We watched the sunset everynight from our balcony and walked to the front of the hotel to watch the fireworks from Sea World. GREAT little take out type restaurant just down the walk called The Sportsman. Best fish tacos we have ever had. We ate there 3 times during our 5 days!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to go with Children”
Reviews.Author: ginger1234LasVegas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Mission Bay area several times, and cant believe we didnt know this hotel was here. We have two boys 8 and 15 and it was wonderful! All the rooms have an outdoor balcony which you can actually step out onto. We got lucky with our room, because ours overlooked the pool and a bit further you could see the bay. Gorgeous View! The pool slides kept our boys busy for hours, and the pool temperature was nice and warm. They have very friendly cocktail servers all around the pool area for your convenience too. The only downside, and its not really a big deal, was the restaurant there was very expensive and touristy food. But with the location of the hotel, is just a short drive to multiple restaurants you can choose from. This will definitely be our new place to stay when we visit Mission Bay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: grandma73034
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this hotel gets sucjh poor reviews. Our 2 rooms were in the tower and were clean and well kept. We were on a high floor so the views were fantastic. The three pools and marshmellows roasts were favorites of our three teenage grand daughters. The concierge provided them wiht many beach activity options. The private boat to Sea World was also nice. This was the girls first trip to the West coast and the proximity to the ocean made for a great vacation. Lots restaurants in all price ranges close by as well. Locatio, Location, Location says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the service”
Reviews.Author: robinc308
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into this hotel (we're actually still here for a few more days), and, frankly, for the price, it's disappointing. Firstly the room - it's nice, but when you look closer, it's a little shabby - peeling paint on the bathroom door, cracked tiles in the bathroom, filthy baseboards in the bathroom, scuffed walls, peeling wallpaper, a hair left in the shower when we first checked in, a hairdrier that belched acrid smoke when turned on. And the service is slightly inept - our used towels were removed, but not replaced! My pajamas, which I had left under the pillow were tossed on the floor. Even more disturbing, we found a child's drawing by the bed on day 4 of our stay: we don't have children. Either someone else accessed our room, or it was left by the previous occupants of the room, and housekeeping failed to find it for 4 days. The front desk staff, in particular, have been very apologetic and friendly after the fact, but it doesn't change the fact that these things shouldn't happen at a high end resort that charges correspondingly high end prices. I would overlook almost all of the above if I were staying at a budget hotel - but I'm not. On the plus side, it's a great location, the restaurant, while expensive has been generally very good. We used the spa services and they were fantastic. I just wish the service and room lived up to the same standards.

Reviews.Title: “Tell me WHY this has any bad reviews!! People are crazy! Resort is A+ don't hesitate at all.”
Reviews.Author: pisces219
