Reviews.Content: Cannot, cannot, cannot believe the bad reviews!!!! Ok...let me start by saying we did an 11 day trip in California starting in San Fran...Our last stop was San Diego and to be honest I was really nervous regarding this hotel because of the reviews and how low it is rated. I actually thought that if it was as bad as the reviews are saying that we would just lose our money and move to another hotel if we needed. Well I guess we saved the BEST for last because this resort was and is amazing. I am actually really angry at some of the reviews on here. Were these people staying at the same resort?!!! The resort itself was tropical with lush gardens and palm trees all throughout the grounds. There is music playing, some of the friendliest staff ever and beautiful views. I am actually ASTONISHED that anyone could say bad things. I would consider having our wedding there thats how beautiful it is!! Our room was located in Bay 2. There is a Tower, Bay 1 and Bay 2. We had a view of the pool. Gorgeous room with great patio and great views. There are 3 pools in the pool area with palm trees all around. Servers are abundant and if you want food or cocktails they bring them to you poolside if you don't want to get up! You can see the Bay and Marina from the pool area and that is so nice too. There are kayaks etc to rent also. I was actually laying in my lounge chair and heard a sea lion! I got up to see it swimming in the bay! There is a pool bar and restaurant called "Swim" that serves sandwiches, salads, appetizers, cocktails etc. Everything we had there was great! There is also a fabulous restaurant on premises called Red Marlin. If you don't eat here at least have a drink there and appetizer. Sunset was amazing from the outdoor bar/lounge. Its right out on the pier. The staff throughout the entire resort were super friendly and accommodating. I cannot say a bad thing about this place. I don't give 5 stars away to just anything but this Hyatt definitely deserves it and opened my eyes to the Hyatt chain. If i had my computer with me when i was out there, I would I have wrote this sitting poolside but i guess its sort of good I didn't because as I said before it really gets me angry that this is rated so low. I would recommend this place to anyone-family member, stranger, friends...and we would without a doubt stay here again, there is no question about that.

Reviews.Title: “great location to get around town and loved the spa”
Reviews.Author: Ellenie_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner suite and loved the space and amenities. The bed was really comfortable. The spa was nice and we could get to Old Town and the Embarcadero easily. Some of the furniture was a little worn but still in good shape. It was a relaxing two day get away location. The cold hand towels at the gym was a great surprise!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Hotel; Fabulous Regency Club!!!”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for famalies however for the single business traveler I personally would recommend another place. I was traveling with my wife and children and this is our 2nd stay in the past 12months and both times we found this hotel to be simply perfect for our family needs. The 2nd stay for us, the Hyatt Regency Club Floor was open so we made our reservations to be on the Regency Club; excellent and very well stocked lounge; excellent staff service all around. Water slides and pool area are well serviced and perfect for children. My children only want to return back to this hotel when in the area. Close to SAN airport so again perfect for famalies flying in and out of SAN. You can also purchase a Smores pkg. for a nominal fee and roast smores on an outdoor spit; very fun for the children. I highly recommend staying on the Regency Club Floor; it is worth the extra money as you can get drinks and snacks for free all day long. I have stayed on other Regency Club Floors with Hyatt hotels and I must say this one is one of my favorite along with the Hyatt Regency Club at Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore beautiful San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SydneyGlobalShopper
Reviews.Content: After a lot of planning, thought, reading reviews and consideration, we decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay for 8 nights as our base in San Diego. The Hotel ticked all the boxes: Great location to San Diego and short drive times to all the major Theme Parks and attractions. Large room (we booked a suite which overlooks the Gym and Einstein Bros outlet on the Marina) Modern Decor and nicely appointed 2 Queen Beds which were very comfy - particularly after a long day walking around the Theme parks Good breakfast at Red Marlin Well equipped Gym (although got a bit busy with 6+ people in it at one time) Easy self parking (except for July 4th weekend - which was understandable due to celebrations in the area) Short drive to Restaurants, laundry and Ralphs Supermarket for supplies Quiet rooms Our suite was on the top floor - so we were able to view the fireworks at Seaworld each nice from the communal corridor/balcony that runs along the back of the rooms Pool was nice and staff was friendly and attentive - however it was extremely busy over the July 4 holiday (standing room only in the pool) - which put us off but was understandable Lots of kids activities around the pool and slides were a big hit with our 9yr old Was really nice to catch the water taxi (very reasonably priced) to Sea World. Room service pizza and buffalo wings were huge serves and quite nice Customer service and really friendly staff was a big plus Highly Recommend: Aqua Adventures kayaking trips - a short distance from the hotel Ralphs Supermarket (for non Americans) - this is a supermarket a short driving distance from the hotel Rubios Mexican Grill fast food - was excellent value and quality food (try the blackened salmon tacos) Chipotle Fashion valley mall for shopping Carlsbad outlets Cheesecake factory (at Fashion valley) was great for dinner - dont be put off by the wait time Sees Chocolate outlet shop

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa631
Reviews.Content: I thought that the location of this hotel was beautiful, right on the bay overlooking the marina. Within a minutes drive to Seaworld and Mission Beach. The pool was great although a bit small for the amount of people who want to relax poolside. There was no lifeguard but a pool attendant who helped us find available lounge chairs. The kids loved the water slides. The staff was very nice and helpful. We stayed in a suite which was our only option for a family of five. (suites are not in the Towers) The room was very spacious and clean. We liked the fact that it had a large sectional/sleeper in the living room for one of our kids to sleep on. So why do I give it an average rating? There are little things that make this hotel not up to Hyatt standards. The room itself has been updated but the exterior hasn't, there were several light bulbs out in the room, the refrigerator didn't work, there were cigarette burn holes in the cushions on the patio...to name a few. $20 to park? Not happy with it but expected. Very comfortable beds! Liked the Einstein bagels. Not sure if I would stay here again, I have mixed feelings on this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to get around in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: J1HOLMES
Reviews.Content: Not bad of a hotel for the location, stayed at the older part of the hotel, which was ok. Clean and easy place to get to other places, especially Sea World. Took a ride in a boat we rented on missin bay, weather was awesome .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanieO
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt in Mission Bay is great place to stay when visiting San Diego. it is centrally located and all the sites are within minutes of the hotel. The hotel is sparkling clean, cheery, and cozy. The corner sofa gave the room even extra comfort. The view of the bay is beautiful. Einstein Bagel was a great bonus since we like to have a quick breakfast and start our day early. The restaurant has great food and the view overlooking the bay was awesome. The pool bar offered a nice variety and the best Mudslides! Our only complaint was that there were very young children in the hot tub and usually that is reserved for adults only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - if you're in the Tower rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gomom88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our last 2 nights of our Disney/So. Cal trip. Were disappointingly booked in a room in the gross 'motel' looking section - not disclosed anywhere on website; paid a sizable fee to upgrade to a real room in the tower (Regency King corner room), which was worth the $$ for better view etc. Great room service (convenient for late arrival) / bellhop Ryan was so nice/helpful! Employees were all great overall. Buffet breakfast in Red Marlin was good (healthy options). Didn't spend much time in hotel, but pools looked nice w/ waterslides for kids (closed before 6 though - letdown for my kids on one and only night we tried). Room was nice overall (comfy bed, but small bathroom), but I think next time I'd try to stay closer to Coronado in a different type of hotel. Didn't love this format - strange mix of buildings/'motel' rooms with exterior access - (spoiled by Huntington Beach Hyatt - top notch in every manner).

Reviews.Title: “The bad reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: Kcali8496
Reviews.Content: Disgusting smell, mold, mold, mold.... I am in this hotel now and so compelled to write a review about the most disgusting room ever. The smell, old decor, mold in bathrooms, carpet stains, GROSS! This room is not worth the money. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kfloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I got an older room with no view, but price was cheap. However, smell of the room made me nauseous all night. I still feel sick from the smell. Concierge helpful. Red Marlin good. Fitness facilities too small for a hotel of this size, but nice to have it located right on the marina. Could not easily walk to Sea World with kids. I like hyatts all over the world, but the room smell was so bad, I could never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bank account closely!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMominator
Reviews.Content: These guys are financially inept! We stayed at this hotel for a week in June 2011. We had prepaid for the entire stay, and I made that very clear to the clerk checking us in, even showing her the confirmation. After we checked in I happened to go online and look at my checking account. To my surprise they had authorized over $1,700 in charges. I was shocked! The front desk informed me that they had to place a hold on the entire cost of the stay plus $75 per night for incidentals. When I informed them that the stay was already paid for, they tried to take the hold off, but it took about 4 days. But it doesn't end there! Now I'm back home and we've completely settled our bill, I can see the final charge has cleared my bank account, but they have placed a duplicate authorization for the same amount in my pending amounts. In essence they still have a hold on the entire amount that I have already paid them. My bank needs a signed letter from the hotel to release the hold. I spent 45 minutes on the phone, 30 of them on hold, waiting to talk to a manager to fax a letter to my bank releasing the hold. Unfortunately a very nice hotel is tainted with a huge waste of time and frustration!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ptamom1967
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days away with my son. My son enjoyed the pools but I was surprised that there wasn't a lifeguard on duty. The pool closest to the slides wasn't heated while the one closest to the jacuzzi was. The rooms wee spacious and the beds comfy. Within walking distance of Belmont Park and the hotel offers valet service to this destination until 7pm. The kids also enjoyed watching the fireworks from SeaWorld. We took the Amtrak down and the hotel was close to the bus stop which was convenient to the use of the trolley. If the price was right, I would definitely stay here again. My main complaint was they didn't offer shuttle pickup from the Amtrak station but Best Western did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, great service”
Reviews.Author: pug42
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly for the pool and slides. We thought our kids would really enjoy that aspect even though it was more expensive. Our room was ok, nothing special. We had no view at all, but it was quiet. The pool was excellent, but very crowded. The kids loved it. The service was exceptional. To a person, everyone was very polite and seemed sincere in wanting to help. Even though we only ate at the Red Marlin one night, we really enjoyed the food. The fitness club was nice as it looked out over the marina. The only negative is that everything is extra - parking, internet, etc. It does really add up over a few days.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sar4you
Reviews.Content: Best location, gorgeous views from the harbor, Very clean room and spacious, great shower. After reading other people's reviews our stay worked out better than anticipated, would def recommend. Great massage in the spa!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with fantastic view and resort ambience”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny2011
Reviews.Content: I've never written a hotel review but I think this Hyatt deserves a much higher rating & more love. Just returned from a lovely stay in a fabulous ocean view room on the 16th floor. We had a great deal that included breakfast and evening appetizers and honor bar at the Regency Club lounge on the 17th floor. The hotel was a breath of fresh air after our 3-day stay at the underwhelming Manchester Hyatt downtown (rooms there had tired decor and were tastelessly bland and cookie-cutter). We walked into our modern sunny room and were instantly relaxed. We ate each night at a beachfront restaurant recommended by the excellent concierge (World Famous restaurant was the best). The kids loved the pools & Sea World was a 5 minute drive away. This hotel really doesn't deserve the bad reviews! It appears to be one of the nicest in Mission Bay & the location was fabulous. The only downside to our trip was the "June Gloom" that gave us very little sun during our week in San Diego. No fault of the Hyatt & we still got tan.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else :(”
Reviews.Author: Our-family-time
Reviews.Content: I spent months looking at trip advisor in preparation for our first family vacation and after reading the reviews, I had reservations about staying at this hotel. However we love boats and the marina environment and loved that the location was not in a crowded area since we had our kids with us. If I had to do it over again though I would stay elsewhere. Let me be clear though that the staff at the hotel had nothing to do with our bad stay. Check in was fantastic, staff in the SWIM lounge, even housekeeping were all wonderful, my choice to stay elsewhere would be based on room condition. We chose to stay in a suite overlooking the marina. The room description really seemed to suit our needs and we knew that a suite would offer the space we needed for 2 adults and 2 kids. DO NOT stay in a marina front sutie. Upon entering the room you step into the "living room" where there is an L-shaped pull out bed couch, a sitting chair, and a table with a TV. The couch was DISGUSTING!!!! Food stains all over it, smears of who knows what, torn throw pillows. The magazine rack on the side of the lounge chair had travel guides etc that were COVERED in GREASE! The carpet was stained and there were black scuff marks all over the walls. NEXT: The actual bedroom was better. Big enough for space, however the beds were awful, the furniture was broken, or cracked, and dusty. The sliding door out to the balcony was covered in fingerprints. The balcony view was beautiful with the boats and the bay right outside. However, the furniture on the balcony was gross. Stained cushions again, and cracked wood. BATHROOM: Make sure you bring your flipflops or water shoes! The tub was ridiculous! The enitre inside of the bathtub was stripped of paint, yet the sides had the remaining paint. Almost like someone tried to peel the paint off but couldn't do it. There was flaking paint ALL OVER the tub. Everytime one of us got out we had paint chips on our feet! GROSS! Almost like how a person with peeling skin from a sunburn would look. I was so sad. Yes, the pool area is nice which is probably because it is the only thing that has been updated in a long time. Not a 4 star quality. I hated going back every night and we were there for 5 days. If I could have slept in the pool area it would have been a great rating :)

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel stay in more than a year”
Reviews.Author: pauditore
Reviews.Content: The location is the bad, unless you are spending your life at sea world and when I entered my room it was overwhelming with a mold stench beyond belief. It gets worse and worse as I wake up the next morning and step into the shower to find clotted blood streaks on the inside of the shower curtains I could not believe it. It took two calls to the front desk to get it cleaned but they did replace the shower curtain. You really could not get fresh air because that meant opening the sliding glass doors to the sounds of screaming children into the night. And the hideous stream of music which was the same every day. Last night a family arrived and checked into the room above me. Two hours of children running from one side of the room to another promoted a call to security. The half chaise lounge on my deck was the most uncomfortable seating I have seen in some time. And they had them everywhere. Combine this with overpriced food and drink and you get Disney land. The red marlin is trying but their service is not there, I watched the bartender wait and bus a large table outside the bar and it screwed up the bar big time. This place overall looks poorly managed and is in severe need of new staff and management. If you want a lowest common denominator place to stay near sea world this is it for a high price. Stay at the hyatt Manchester better location and views I love the navy ships.

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jdm113
Reviews.Content: We spent our spring break at the Hyatt Mission Bay and the stay was fanstatic! This hotel has wonderful staff, beautiful rooms and great facilities. The pools are beautiful. Our room overlooked the pools and Mission Bay area. The rooms are well cleaned and nicely appointed. The beds are very comfortable. I can't say enough about how beautiful the view was! The hotel is within walking distance of Sea World. The walk was nice with our daughters aged 6 and 9. It was also an easy drive to Lego Land. I don't think anyone would be disappointed to spend time at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I love hyatt....but not this one”
Reviews.Author: AZscimom
Reviews.Content: O.K. I generally have loved the hyatt resorts...they are very kid/ family friendly and generally clean and spacious and offer reasonable rates. But.....NOT THIS ONE. We had a hard time getting a reasonable rate at this hyatt, every time a special offer/rate was emailed to us when we called up to book, the rooms for that rate were already gone....this became a bit much after we finally booked a room online at a higher rate and a lower rate room became available later and we were not allowed to move our room. Most resorts do this all the time, allow you to move to a lower rate upon availablity....but the service at this hyatt is very poor. Will not go here again.....I would have to rate this as the worst hyatt I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Easter vacation at the PERFECT family hotel"”
Reviews.Author: palacegang
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view, pools were hopping from sun up til sun down - but that was fine for us, meeting our 3 adult children here for a long Easter weekend. LOTS of activities for kids, really FUN to watch the watermelon eating contest and the under water egg hunt! Fantastic weather! Had Sunday brunch at the Red Marlin - could NOT beat the food and the views of the harbor. Staff were wonderful and so accommodating. Came pool side several times to see if everyone was having a good time, and we WERE! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Worlds away but minutes from downtown”
Reviews.Author: pinknermal
Reviews.Content: The tropical and open air ambience was wonderful after visiting the city each day. The rooms were great the pool area was nicely landscaped. The only downside (which was minimal) was the lack of dining options outside of an expensive contemporary restaurant and breakfast at Einstein Brothers bagels (no complaints there.)

Reviews.Title: “OK once the room was changed”
Reviews.Author: Texan254
Reviews.Content: We checked in memorial day weekend at around 2pm. I booked a corner suite and requested a water view. I knew I was in trouble when the gentleman at the front desk said, that this room had a great view of the sea world fireworks. I asked if there was anything with an ocean view and he said no, since we were checking in early but our room had a partial ocean view. When we got to the room,4th floor I was really disappointed. It overlooked a parking lot, and the only thing you could see in the distance was the sea world tower(hense the fireworks). The room did not look like the picture on the web site, and most important there was no couch, which my 3 year old likes to sleep on. I decided to wait till after 4, and then called the Hyatt Gold Passport # given to me on check in. I spoke to a nice lady who said they had another room on a higher floor, opposite end. The room was 10x nicer with a water view, boats and we could still see the fireworks (ask for anything with 19 at the end of it in the tower). As far as the rest of the hotel, the pools are nice but they need more heat. The restaurant is ok for bkfst and dinner, but way too expensive. It never seemed busy at bkfst probably it was so expensive. Cocierge was good. Hyatt if you read these comments, in general if your hotel is not that busy(which this one wasn't) offer your nicer rooms to your guests first without having them jump hoops to get to a room that is up to usual Hyatt quality.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: gksmj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 4 nights at the Hyatt on a family vacation. The property itself was fine and located close to Sea World and Mission Beach area. Our adjoining rooms were located in the lobby building, not the tower. The kids enjoyed the heated pool and water slides. Our check-in experience was terrible. We arrived at 2:30pm and were informed that our rooms were not ready which was understandable since check-in is actually 4:00pm. We were issued a temporary pool key so that we could "enjoy the property" while waiting - even though our luggage had been taken away so we had no access to bathing suits or a place to change into them, leaving the bar or restaurant as our only real options for kililng time onsite. Long story short, we were only able to access one of the rooms by 5:30pm - after a 3 hour wait during which staff could not provide any estimate of when the rooms may be ready. After complaining to the manager we were finally offered a $75 credit to spend at the property and 3 entree vouchers for the SWIM pool bar (when I pointed out that $75 would not go far with our party of 6 after seeing the menu prices). We did use the entree vouchers later in the week and the 3 beers, 3 Shirley Temples, a kids meal and dozen hot wings that we were billed for used $47 of that credit. We used the concierge service to arrange tickets for the Old Town Trolley Tour which also provides shuttle service to the hotel, for a van taxi to Sea World, and to arrange a rental car on our last day and they were helpful. Otherwise, we made our own arrangements as much as possible. Side note: our van taxi driver Fran (US Cab) was fantastic. We called him direct for transportation the remainder of the week and it felt like we had our own personal driver. He happily stopped by a store so that we could pick up a few items on the way back from Sea World and also took us by the hotel and waited for our son to change out of wet clothes when going from Sea World to dinner another day. He is highly recommended. As for the hotel, we appreciated the location but based on the service our first day and the prices we would probably look elsewhere next time. I think we could have done better. San Diego itself was great!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay here over Memorial Weekend :)”
Reviews.Author: njoytraveling
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over Memorial weekend and really enjoyed our stay. We stayed on the 17th floor and it was a great experience. The pool and slide made it enjoyable for our 12yr old while we stayed here. I highly recommend this place!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hyatt is a dump”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee12Three
Reviews.Content: This place is dirty. The lime green duvet and that long green pillow thing were dingy and stained. really bad. really dirty. gross. This hotel still has popcorn celings. The only thing nice about this "resort" is the pool area. It is not walking distance to mission beach. You have to drive 3 or 4 stoplights to get to it. It sits on the bay as the name describes and you can see the bay but can't put your feet in because it's a bay with no beach or safe entry point. save your money and stay at a budget hotel. parking is not free - $20 a night to self park and $25 if you valet. dumb. oh and the wifi isn't free either. It has T-Mobile hot spots as it's service and you have to pay. Stayed three nights at the comfort inn-sea world and it was 10x's better than this dump with free wifi and a good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: wsv81
Reviews.Content: The good: Wonderful outdoor area! My young children loved the pools and roasting Marshmellows at the firepits. The location is exceptional if you are headed to Sea World or the beaches. The views are great...if you get one. Our room overlooked tress and maintenance sheds. The Bad: The room was not worth the price! We had dirty pillows and we killed two spiders. The second day of our stay the hot water did not work and we had to take cold showers. The staff at the front desk didnt seem too concerned when we called to complain. They did take care of the issues, I was just expecting compensation for dealing with dirty pillows, spiders, and no hot water. We also had to deal with maintenace men in our room trying to fix the hot water. I guess thats not a big deal, but not something you should have to deal with for that price. The rest of the Staff that worked the bars, dinner staff, housekeeping, etc, were all very kind. Wifi is not included in the price of the room, you'll have to pay over 12 bucks a day for it. The bar "SWIM" at the pool is awesome, but you will PAY for it, about 25 dollars for 2 mixed drinks. All in all, the hotel itself is nice and our kids had a blast, but I wouldnt stay there again. You pay the high prices of a Cruise Ship without the luxury. I didnt really like paying 20 a day for self-parking either. You can get more for your money at the Hilton downtown! We have stayed at a Hyatt before and this one does not live up to the typical standards. It was also a bummer that the room did not have a mini-fridge (to keep drinks for our kids) or a coffee pot for the mornings. You can have room service bring you coffee for 9 bucks instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place..Very bad beds”
Reviews.Author: cozdog1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property and the pool and fitness room are top notch. It was tremendously clean and quiet. It is rather isolated as far as restraunts and activities unless Sea World is in the plans then it is perfect. My only serious complaint is that the beds were very poor. Everyone woke up with back soreness and it was difficult to get comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: carrieag1
Reviews.Content: We called quickly as we were driving down the freeway on Saturday morning to make a last minute reservation. The managment of the hotel could not have been more helpful. The hotel was clean, the people friendly, the service wonderful. The hotel went out of it's way to make sure we were happy. We have two small children, and took the water taxi to Sea World. Now that we have passes to come back for free to Sea World all year. We will be back at this very friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: missaimeej
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were located in the Tower and had a beautiful view of the ocean. Unfortunately, our room smelled like smoke, the walls were all scuffed up, and there was a large hole in the upholstery in our room. At night, the rooms were ridiculously hot and it didn't seem the air conditioner worked. In another room it looked like there was mold near the ceiling. This is not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel or a Hyatt Regency hotel. The lobby and public spaces of the hotel were beautiful. We ate at the Red Marlin and it was very over priced, but the view was amazing. Was frustrating to have to pay $20 per night for self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Stay at Hyatt Mission Bay Area of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jemerson
Reviews.Content: Wish I could move it up to 4 stars, but just can't. The lobby is very modern and has a nice feel. Greeted warmly and given my room keys. I stayed in the Bay Units on the right of the pool, not the tower. Room was spacious and had been modernized. Was right next to the pool, so heard the noise of the kids yelling and screaming all day. In addition to that, the put speakers right in front of my unit to broadcast to the pool. Up until 10pm, the music is blaring away. I didn't as for this for sure, and went back to the front desk and asked to be changed to tower. Was told they were pretty booked for my coporate rate, but could updgrade for $50 more per night. No thanks. The rooms were available so they should have moved me due to the loud noise and music. Anyway stayed there two nights, and tried to be gone most of the day. When I did go to the pool area to use the famously advertised water slides, you guessed it, they were shut down. Hey, little bit of false advertising here? Oh, and self parking is $20/day; valet $25/day. Adds up to the total cost of the stay. So, for a Hyatt expectations this one did not meet mine for sure. It is in a nice location, and the view from the restaurant and bar is really nice overlooking the yachts/boats and inlet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: wearsy2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego. We stayed at this resort for 4 nights. I like to stay at hyatts when travelling for business and found this property in-line with Hyatt quality. Resort is a little older but you can tell they have tried to keep it up to date. Location is near SeaWorld(5 min), Airport (10 min) and downtown (15 min). Pool area was nice - would probably get pretty packed if the hotel was full. The weather wasn't great so the area was not very high in demand. Gym is reasonable. 2 Elipticals, 1 bike and 3 treadmills for cardio equipment. Also had dumbells and about 7 machines for weights. Coffee Shop next to gym (Einstein's) was a great place to grab a coffee and bagel post workout.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough but not sure we'd go back”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaBC2011
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the pool(s) and our kids loved swimming there. The pool area is quite a lovely setting. The property is quite close to Seaworld (the 2nd reason we selected it) only about a 2.5 km walk or an $8 taxi ride. The hotel does NOT offer any shuttles. Luckily we did not have a car as there is also a parking fee (Ithink it is around $25 per night). Out room had 2 queen beds (we were in Bay II which was a two storey building) and the room was clean - nice fresh looking bedding but the room itself was a bit dated. They have tried to freshen them up with paint, carpets, bedding and new bathroom countertops) but the room still shows its age. We were happy with the room however. The Hyatt does not offer free WiFi (which seems crazy) so you have to pay for that. They also charge you to use the computers in their Business Centre if you want access to the internet UNLESS you are getting your airline boarding passes. The rooms are not cheap and then they want to charge you for anything extra - kind of lame. We ate at the Red Marlin (the hotel Restaurant, looks over the marina) - the food was fine but you are going to pay hotel prices. There did not appear to be many other dining choices in the area. On the weekends they have a buffet breakfast - $10 per child and $21 for adults so for a family of 4 it adds up quite quickly. All in all everything was fine but you end up paying alot for just fine. I think if the room had been a more reasonable price and they didn't charge for every extra then we would rate it a bit higher. But overall, it was expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, one of the very best hotels we've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: TJnCher
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us a rare 100% perfect stay. The room, pool, restaurant, staff, maid service are all top-notch. The location is perfect for walking to Sea World, driving a short distance to Mission Beach or Old Town San Diego, or catching I-5 to the Gas Lamp, Balboa Park, or Coronado. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel with our two young children, but also know that we would have enjoyed it in our pre-kid days. This hotel really made our vacation wonderful. Big thanks to the wondeful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Spotty Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: FoodLoverUs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt hotels around the world on business and am a loyal customer to this hotel chain. The Mission Bay hotel has a great water front, hotel hardware and stores. It would have been perfect if the service that the Front Desk at this particular Hyatt could be more consistent and on par with other Hyatt hotels. It does have mostly professional staff of what you would expect out of Hyatt, and a few that may be doing as little as possible to provide help. For example, I have had Front Desk who would transfer me to Reservation to get hotel receipt email that was missed by the hotel in the first place, or to get any changes done, or would charge extra on one-day extension over original reservation. Yes, perhaps Hyatt hotel procedure allows these responses. I must say under the same set of circumstances, virtually 100% of the time other Hyatt hotel Front Desk would just take care of the requests as a matter of course. The latter service level would befit the Hyatt chain I admire.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice for a San Diego stay”
Reviews.Author: Millcaro
Reviews.Content: As I was with my last stay at a Hyatt hotel, I was pretty disappointed with my stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay. My partner was there for a conference, otherwise we would have certainly stayed at the Omni San Diego - and as it turns out, I wish we would have. Our first room here was too loud to stay in. When we requested a move to the Towers, where my partner had stayed before, the staff took more than an hour to get back to us about our request. When they finally worked out a transfer (after haggling over maintaining our original rate), the tower room was lovely - much better appointed and with a superior view - definitely request a room in the tower, should you choose to stay here. Unfortunately, our adjoining room was inhabited by smokers. Though there are balconies in these rooms, our neighbors smoked in the room - the staff did what they could to address the problem, but ultimately it wasn't in their power to make their guests stop smoking. As far as we were concerned, however, it made for an unfortunate stay. The smoke was bad because our rooms shared a door, and so was the noise. The fitness facilities were great - replete with a lovely view of the marina. The pool was nice, too. Not much in the way of eating or nightlife here - if you don't have a rental car, you'll need taxis. We ended up moving downtown on our last night in San Diego, and I'm so glad we did. The Hyatt has sorely disappointed me in my last couple of stays at a number of their branches. They nickel-and-dime you, and it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing ...”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveller5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days with my 12-year-old son while visiting 20-year-old son who's a college student in the area. While the hotel is in a great location, and the views from the 9th floor room were very nice, I found the overall experience to be a bit disappointing. The room, including the bathroom, seemed a little tired and vaguely dirty; the lampshade was stained and dusty, and the grout in the bathroom needed some serious work. I could hear every word of the conversations between the woman and man staying in the room next to ours -- very thin walls. Housekeeping didn't do a great job -- at one point it was very clear the carpet hadn't been vacuumed. Check-in on our first day and valet parking on every day took a considerable amount of time because of lack of staff. And the concierge I spoke with twice for recommendations seemed supremely annoyed with my questions for restaurant recommendations and zoo information, as if I were bothering him, not to mention that he professed no personal experience with any of the restaurants he was recommending. At one point I was waiting at the desk to speak with him (he was away from the desk for several minutes), and a male hotel guest was waiting behind me, and when the concierge arrived back at the desk he assisted the male hotel guest first. Even my 12-year-old son was astonished. On the other hand, the employees at the Red Marlin restaurant where we had breakfast three mornings were very friendly and accommodating. And although a spa visit was somewhat mediocre, the employees there were also friendly and professional, and the manager who oversees the spa and the pool area was an admirable representative of the hotel -- very visible, and working very hard. However, my son went to the gift shop at one point and the employee was lying on the floor behind the counter ... taking a nap? I might give the hotel another chance, because of its location, and because I will be traveling to the area several times a year, but if disappointed again I'd look for another option.

Reviews.Title: “Complete rip off. Stay somewhere else and save money and heartache.”
Reviews.Author: joejitsu4
Reviews.Content: Complete rip off. The reservation lied to us and sold us an ocean view room. When we got to the room it was facing exactly opposite way. No sign of the Ocean. When we confronted the manager she was very rude and blamed me for not reminding her that I had an ocean view room reserved. They were more than glad to charge me $20 for parking even though there was no parking on the property. Had to park across the street and walk back to the hotel in the rain. They ruined my weekend getting away don't let them ruin your holiday. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 5-day stay at the Hyatt. This is a very family friendly hotel - they showed a kids movie on a big screen the night we arrived, there was a watermelon eating contest poolside, and a bonfire each night (s'mores fixin's for sale). Our boys (age 6 and 11) loved the pools and the waterslides. The pool with the 2 big slides is nice and warm, as is the larger saline pool. The pool with the little slide is not heated - brr! Hot tub is great. There is poolside drink and food service from Swim on the property. Our AAA rate also came with complimentary breakfast and free parking. The breakfast was at the Red Marlin which is the property's nice restaurant, and the buffet was quite good. Read the fine print because we didn't understand that the free parking was for self-parking only... not free valet parking. But their valet staff was very helpful and even put air in our rental car tire when a warning light came on. There was a problem with our queen suite but after quite a wait, they were able to give us a king suite and comped us an adjoining king room which were great. Good water pressure in showers, all staff were very friendly and professional, good spa experience, clean and roomy. Loved the bagel/espresso place on property too. Of course, very close to SeaWorld (cab fare is less than parking, btw). All in all, a great stay - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation hotel in sunny tourist-friendly city, San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: kimba65
Reviews.Content: My vacation friend and I stayed 6 nights from Mar 12-19/2011. We were on the 16th floor. The best things about Hyatt Regency Mission Bay are the views, the pools/gardens and the great service. Each pool side room in the Tower Building has it's own private balcony, with 2 loungers to view the 3 pools, the harbor and the ocean beyond. The pools were heated, not too full of people, and open until 11pm. There were 3 water slides running nearer the weekend. And while we were not traveling with kids, the kids we did see on spring break with their families were respectful of other guests. The rooms were clean and fresh. While they were sparsely furnished, the bathroom and shower was spacious and very modern. Nice rain shower nozzle in the big tiled shower. The hotel staff proved friendly and very informative about their city and sights to see. The front desk staff, the consierge, and Regency Club 'cafe' staff were all so helpful, easy to approach, and were willing to assist regardless of the time of day. It's worth it to pay a little extra each day (I think maybe $10) and get the Regency Club service. With your hotel key, this enables you to get a continental breakfast in the hotel each morning, which was more than enough to help start your day. Also bottled water, coffee, pop etc. was on hand. Then appy's at supper, and dessert each night too. It pays because there's not many restaurants near the hotel. We used public transit a lot during our week stay. SD had a great system of buses, trolleys, etc to make your holidays travel plans within the city less expensive and convenient. I'm glad we found this hotel. We felt lucky to be in a luxurious hotel with a beautiful view. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hyatt - and a perfect location for those who plan to visit multiple areas in SD”
Reviews.Author: MOTraveler010
Reviews.Content: I am just returning from a three night stay at this property - my wife and I had a long weekend in San Diego and chose this property because we wanted a little of the "vacation" feel as opposed to staying downtown. As far as the location - we loved it! We had a rental car and it was a short 10 minute drive to any where - Coronado, Downtown, LaJolla, Fashion Valley. We are active vacationers and appreciated being able to get anywhere quickly. San Diego is an easy town to get around and we never had traffic issues. The property - we were very pleased. It had the resort feeling which was great if you are looking to relax. The grounds are very well kept, lots of plants and greenspace. The pools appeared to be a lot of fun - we did not partake. The marina with all of the boats is a great sight. We stayed in the tower in a club room on the 16th floor and loved it. Pretty view and a nice terrace, clean, updated room. The room was a great size and we enjoyed the access to the Regency Club (which has a dynamite view). The service was outstanding - all of the valets and front desk folks were great. The housekeeping staff was so friendly when we'd pass them which is such a nice touch. We worked with Nur in the concierge who was excellent. The only (slight) downside is that the parking can get dicey if you return in the evenings after 10 or 11. We really didn't mind the walk - but the closer spaces are all occupied - lots of families with younger children who probably turn in early! Overall - this property is an easy reccomendation to family and friends. We loved it and wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Chenier11
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at this hotel and since I've checked in it's been very noisy. I'm staying in one of the side buildings on the lower floor and everywhere the people walked who were staying above me I could hear. Just stomp stomp stomp when I was trying to sleep as well as all this morning. When someone else turns on their water for a shower you can hear it. Also I've heard people that work here all morning outside talking. When I was dropped off at the hotel (my friends live in San Diego) the parking guys immediately became uninterested in helping me since I wasn't using their parking service. I also started hauling my bags and almost into the lobby before they bothered to ask if I needed any help and when they finally did I was too annoyed to say yes. I feel like the money I'm spending here ia not worth it. It's way too noisy and I haven't felt relaxed at all since I've checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view, pool and fire pit”
Reviews.Author: j0nes81
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in a Waterfront Suite (comparable in size to an Embassy Suites basic room) with wife and two teenage kids. The Hyatt Regency web site offered a 3 nights for the price of 2 deal which made it reasonable. Suite had a refrigerator but no microwave. Enjoyed the view of the marina, nice landscaping and beautiful pool area. Slides into the pool were fun. Staff was friendly and helpful. One unique feature is the large fire pit near the pool. Kits to make smores are sold at the hotel and were very popular in the evenings. Didn't eat at the Red Marlin, but ate dinner at the Swim Lounge. We liked the March Madness special of burger, fries and a beer for $10. But $11 poolside bloody mary made us quit drinking. Einstein's (on-site equivalent of StarBucks) was convenient. Noticed the prices charged for bakery goods were higher than shown in the display case. When I pointed it out to the employee, he admitted that the prices charged at this hotel location are higher than at other Einstein's locations.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great. Mixed signals as it relates to kids.”
Reviews.Author: falconsIrving
Reviews.Content: For some background, I am a top tier 'diamond' frequent guest for Hyatt and I have been for many years. I see a lot of Hyatt's for both business and for family trips. The checkin process was easy and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The front desk was also helpful when i asked for a disposable razor for my wife. We used the concierge shuttle once and were extremely pleased with the vehicle - clean, easy to seat 4+, driver was super nice. The concierge was also helpful for their recommendation of a place for dinner. This hotel is older but ownership has attempted to refresh the property. The lobby definately looks great but the rooms didn't quite get the same attention. The rooms are good but not great. The bathrooms are unnecessarily small as there was room to expand them during renovations. The shower head was installed for a very short person as the head is placed about 5 ft high. The pillows are not king sized - not a huge deal but are comfortable. Tv is smaller than other Hyatt's I stay at. there is a fridge in the room which is nice touch. The pools are decent and have water slides the kids like a lot. This hyatt gives the impression that they are kid friendly but sends mixed signals - ie. the kids are forbidden ( and the staff will remind you - way too strict and for no good reason in my opinion. Maybe after 8pm but not 5pm) from the regency club starting at 5 pm and they advertise s'mores being available via TV and signs but when we inquired we were told it was $8 per 'kit' that you use on your own. Really?!? At other properties such as: lost pines & hill country this experience is included as a part of the overall experience and is managed on by the staff. It is a great experience and is cheap to host. The regency club is just 'ok'. There is not an automatic coffee machine as there is in every other RC Club I visit and we ran out of coffee this morning. The food selection is average to below average compared to other hyatts. Another patron shared my views about regency club in a conversation we had this morning while waiting for the coffee to be replenished. The spa is nothing special and not on par with other hyatt spa's. We did not use it this trip but I did on a previous stay and thought it was worth mentioning here. Overall, I think this hyatt is just 'ok' and I really don't see coming back with my family or on business again because there are some other great Hyatt's nearby. We do like seeing and hearing the sea lions outside! That is definitely unique! Over the years Hyatt has elevated my expectations wuth regards to service and product. While the Hyatt at Mission bay is not on my list of best Hyatt's it is still a nice hotel and would definitely offer great service still likely offer a better product than the other properties in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: trvlNstyle
Reviews.Content: This is an older Hyatt property which has been very nicely restored. The location is beautiful and convenient to the airport. The restaurant is a beautiful location right on the bay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: ucosandier
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. For a low price we were upgraded to a corner suite with views over the ocean, beaches and marina. We booked this hotel through priceline.com. Everybody was very friendly and made us welcome the minute we arrived. The Concierge was most helpful in finding us great but still reasonable restaurants. The hotel and pool area were spotless. The only small complaint we have is that Internet was not free and parking was $20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't have the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Doxin
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as I loved the modern look of the hotel rooms in the pictures. I was down in San Diego for a girls weekend with my mom, it was her Christmas present. I was impressed with the lobby and couldn't wait to get to our room. I was somewhat disappointed by our room. It smelled a little musty and the bathroom wasn’t clean and some of the lights weren’t working in the bathroom. We turned on the A/C unit in the room while we checked out the pool and hotel grounds. We came back to the room and noticed the musty smell just wouldn’t go away and the A/C unit was broken. I went down to the lobby and mentioned it and they said they would send us a repair man shortly. We went out for the rest of the day and came back late that evening. When you stay at this hotel you have to choose between valet ($25) or self-serve parking ($20). We decided to do self-serve as we don’t mind walking, however what they don’t tell you is that there are not enough self-serve spaces for everyone staying at the hotel. After looking for 20 minutes one evening, we finally had to park in the street super far from the hotel. Since it was very late and we were two women, I didn’t feel that safe. We were still charged $20 for parking that night even though I told the lobby attendant there was no parking in the lot and we did not end up parking there. That is ridiculous! When we got back to the room we noticed the A/C unit was still not fixed. I again went to the lobby (annoyed) and told this person that our A/C unit was down and it was supposedly already fixed. He didn’t offer to change our room or anything. He ordered another maintenance person to fix the unit at almost 1am. We were so annoyed. The repair man fixed the unit fairly quickly and we went to bed. However, after the parking issue, bathroom dirtiness, and A/C unit issue I couldn’t wait to leave. The bathroom when we arrived had several little hairs still in the tub and the sink was that well cleaned. Also, they don’t inform you that the pillows and duvets are down. My mom is severely allergic to down and couldn’t stop sneezing. Nowhere in the documentation in the room does it say what the duvets or pillows are filled with. We finally had to pull them out to figure out they were filled with down. They should have a card stating what it is. Another issue we had was with the noise in the hallway. We could hear everything that was going on, including a running child up and down the hallway at 7am as well as the cleaning carts at 8am. After our experience here, I am not sure I would recommend this hotel. The lobby and the grounds are beautiful but not sure it is worth a stay after our issues.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Beautiful views, Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Susan1661
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for our Honeymoon then returned in July with our big kids (16 and 22) so we could all swim in the pool and go on the slide. The pool slide is on top of a tropical mountain and is an easy glide down. The pools were a nice temp., clean and there were plenty of chairs, with pool side service. The bar is near the pool which is also convenient. The rooms were perfectly clean, with all the ammenties stated on their website. The first time were there, our room was on the corner so we had a great view out of both windows (second one in the bedroom). One view looking toward Mission Bay, the other toward the ocean. We could see the boats going by and looked down on the pool area, with all the palm trees and other beautiful landscape. We have no complaints about the hotel at all, from either visit and are looking forward to returning again someday, but just the two of us!

Reviews.Title: “We are still not sure what that smell was!!!”
Reviews.Author: Giant-Racoon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many great Hyatt Hotels over the past few years, the Hyatt Mission Bay is not one of them! It is not only the worst Hyatt room, but also the grottiest and smelliest of any hotel room I have ever stayed! The staff were very friendly, and helpful in as much as they changed our room, however, it too was grotty and smelly!! The hotel has a nice pool area and the Red Marlin Restaurant served good food overlooking the marina they gym was OK but some equipment was out of order. The rooms that we were offered were simply horrible! Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: bahash
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were wonderful. Friendly, professional staff. Nice room and excellent surroundings. Pool and spa were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Shikari
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night during their off-season. It is a beautiful resort hotel and I wish I would have had time to use the pool, jacuzzi, etc. Every single employee was nice and had a smile on their face. The bed was very comfortable. I was given one of their hypoallergenic rooms and it did smell super clean (naturally, not a chemical smell). I like there was a small refrig - not a super cold one, but enough to keep things fresh. They've updated recently, and the bathroom was lovely. I missed not having a bathtub, but maybe it's been determined traveller's don't really take baths, I don't know. The grounds were incredible. There are only two downsides - one you really do need a car at this location, and the $20 parking fee is a bit high, but I know standard for San Diego. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LizaAllee
Reviews.Content: The reviews do not lie! From the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel to the moment we left, the staff went out of their way to help make us feel at home! Dwayne took our luggage to our room, introduced us to the hotel, told us about the area. We ate on site a few times and the food was great. The spa was fantastic. I travel 2-3 days a week and am in hotels all over the country, this one will absolutely get my business again as well as anyone else I can convience to stay there! Great deal

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Kehaulani808
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and very spacious. The property is very well manicured. Location is about a 5 minute drive to SeaWorld. You can walk, but not recommended if you have small children because of the busy streets and lack of sidewalks. We caught a taxi for $5 plus tip. They have a wonderful pool side restaurant with yummy burgers and guacamole with chips. The pools are heated and they have slides for the kids. It's right on Mission Bay so you have spectacular views. It's a very relaxing, family friendly hotel. Our only negative was that we called for extra towels and had to wait 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: withliberty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only 2 nights out of a planned 7 nights because of rain. The hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful, but there is NOTHING do to here if it's raining. You will need a car (which costs $$$) to park on-site or prepare to take a taxi into the city ($20+ one way). Staff was very friendly and helpful (found my daughter's stuffed animal that we had left behind) and the food was good, but not exceptional. Everything on site is very expensive because this is a "captive" location. $10 a day for Internet is always an insult. Both of my children asked if we could come back when the weather was nicer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: cyberdudeAustralia
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I found this hotel to be one of the best places to stay due to the wonderful staff who were all so friendly and made us feel welcome every day. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suites and the view that we woke up to every morning was stunning. Looking out to the marina and the awesome gym that is part of this hotel, even sea lions were out soaking up the sun in the marina.The room was so lovely that we didn't want to leave. I would stay here again and plan on doing so for even longer this time. San Diego is the best city in America and it was easy to explore from this hotel. You will need a car as it is 10-15 mins from city but only 5 min (if that)drive to seaworld. The heated pool and spa area are beautiful and so relaxing. I wish I could remember the lady who checked us in as she was truly one of the nicest people I have come across ever. I can not fault anything about this hotel so do yourself a favour and treat yourself by staying here.Thanks again and will be back to stay longer for sure next time

Reviews.Title: “Fun beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: karap727
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fun the best part was the outdoor jacuzzi and pools which we used regardless of it being kind of chilly there. We were only around one morning to use the two great water slides but we were out there like kids. The resturants and bars on site were a little pricy but we really loved the outdoor fire pits at the bar and the relaxing beachy vibe. We loved San Diego and mission bay was a great area. When we arrived first room was smelly but they put us in a comparable room righ next door. Room service was great. The beds were not as comfy as I wouldve expected. (hyatt grand) but the linens were soft. The view from the balcony was amazing and I loved the view

Reviews.Title: “Recommended except for the rude wake up call!”
Reviews.Author: allymo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for two nights this December while in town to visit relatives. The buildings were old but the rooms were nice despite that. They were a little dirty however at closer inspection, very dusty in places and the bathroom had some hair in it. We enjoyed our stat anyway until the morning. At around 8:30 am very loud music started playing in the pool courtyard. Since our room faced the courtyard it sounded like there was a concert going on outside our window. We were up late the night before and didn't appreciate this early wake-up call of bad Christmas music. Try turning it down a little!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tadak
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at Mission Bay, a 10-15 minute drive from most attractions in the San Diego area. A car is a must, as the hotel is not within easy walking distance of anything (Even the walk to seaworld takes about half an hour, vs. a 5 minute drive). Hotel grounds are beautiful, a tropical garden setting on Mission Bay. 3 great swimming pools with water slides and a pool-side restaurant and bar. Grounds also had fire pits, palm trees, many seating areas - a really relaxing environment. Really pleasant to walk around the grounds on the Bayside trail, passing boats, sea lions, and great sunsets. We were very impressed. Rooms were very nice. Comfortable beds and nicely furnished. Staff were very warm, helpful and enthusiastic. Food at hotel restaurants (Swim and Red Marlin) was top notch - pricey, but way better than the average hotel fare. Lots of restaurants within a 10 minute drive. There is an Einstein's bagel shop on site as well, but it's really expensive. Parking was $20/day, but we knew about this prior to booking. Room was a bit noisy one of the nights when there was an event on site on a Tuesday! (we were in one of the 2-floor buildings), but not much the hotel could do about that, and it did not happen again. Our son loved the grounds, the room and the hotel in general. We are really happy we decided to stay here! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice--Would Come Back”
Reviews.Author: dianabb02
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, I wasn't quite sure about this hotel but booked it because of the good rates during Thanksgiving week. What a lovely surprise! Yes, some things were expensive (parking, for instance), but we had a very good time and would enjoy a return stay. Our room was in the renovated tower--quite lovely with fantastic views. The staff was unfailingly helpful and enthusiastic. You can't really walk to any attractions, but many things are a quick ride by car or taxi. And the staff will provide directions to any locale. This is a very nice business class hotel, good for family trips to San Diego, or hanging out by the pool and spa. Not a resort, but a good hotel with reasonable amenities, warm hospitality, and excellent views for travelers looking for a mix of business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shawna33
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for a fun vacation before we had our first child. This hotel was awesome, however, I only gave it four stars because of the location. They told us it was within walking distance to shops and restaurants, however, it was only close to a couple of restaurants one of which was extremely pricey. We loved the hotel but did not rent a car because we were told that everything we would need was within walking distance. This is true if you wanted to go to a pricey restaurant or a bagel shop but that was it. I would recommend the hotel if you rent a car. The spa was the most amazing spa I have ever been to!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: DLCAlberta
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights recently at the Hyatt Mission Bay resort in San Diego. I wasn't sure what to expect as had read some bad reviews on this site. I guess I was pleasantly surprised - the hotel was attractive, rooms nice, clean, pretty views, and great vegetation - lovely lush greenery, well maintained. On the downside, rooms were expensive and the on-site restaurant equally so. We ate a couple of cheap fish meals at the fish-fry place within walking distance along the marina. Even the wine wasn't too bad there for $3 a glass! I didn't have time to get into the pool but it looked nice and there were some nice poolside areas. The staff was helpful and welcoming. Internet connection in the room was expensive but reliable; they had a very roomy business centre where you could print your boarding pass free - useful. their conference catering, set-up and food were all fine. Being a northerner, I enjoyed the ease of drifting from indoors to outdoors for meetings and networking. Overall, though, not sure it was worth the $200+ nightly rate and it was also out of the way, requiring a $12-15 cab ride to get anywhere in the main part of town. Morning sun glistening on the marina waters is a sight that will stay with me though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Ooskus
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent 6 nights at this hotel. We checked in at around 6 pm and found our room to be exactly as pictured on the Website, with the bed facing the windows, which looked out on the water/marina, studded with yachts. We had several issues with the room, which we mentioned the next morning. All of the issues were taken care of right away (to our satisfaction) and on top of that, we were given a substantial discount on the first night's bill. The location could not be better - only about a mile's comfortable stroll through parkland to Sea World, right on the water with spectacular views of the sunset. We had a great balcony where we could sit with a drink and watch the sunset over the Pacific. (OK - we only glimpsed the ocean, but it was still wonderful.) We took the Old Town Trolley tour of San Diego - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, good service, okay rooms, not so great area.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraverler
Reviews.Content: When we first pulled up I was a little worried because the buildings are pretty old, but I was pleasantlly surpirsed to see that everythign was very recently remodeled and in excellent shape. The property is beautiful and the pools are great. They have like 5 pools and 3 water slides all are heated. There was a zero depth entry pool that was great for my young daughter. The staff were great and the service was very good. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and they were very accoomdodating. We had two rooms in the tower facing the pools. During the week they were fine, but on the weekends we heard every sound from the peoople at the pool late at night. I was about ready to change rooms when I noticed things got quiet by Monday night. The rooms are very simple.....in good condition with flat screen TVs and balcoies and very comfortable beds and pillows. I only had two compliants besides all the noise from the pool area (which I'm listening to now as I type this).....there is not much storage and the thermostats are very inconsistent. We set both thermostats to 72 and one room was freezing cold while hte other one was really warm. The cold room wasn't hte problem....teh warm room we woudl have to set the thermostat to 60 to get it comfortable enough to sleep. I walked as far as I could in each direction around the harbour and there isn't a single thing worth walking to and there is no where to eat off the hotel grounds besides a single hole in the wall restaurant. If you want to go anywhere you have to drive, which is pretty easy in San Diego, but I thought from the description of the hotel that the beach was only a few minutes away walking and that wasnt' the case. For what we paid I thought it wa s good value. Just make sure you request to be opposite the pool if you don't want the noise and be prepared to drive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Staff - Very Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: PAC71
Reviews.Content: We held our annual national sales meeting here. Outside of having the worst weather San Diego's seen since the Ice Age, everything went terrific. The staff at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay were OUTSTANDING to work with - no matter what last minute change/request we had. I have never seen such quick and efficient turnaround to accommodate our needs when the weather was not cooperating for our outdoor venues! The Spa was a wonderful retreat with excellent staff as well. I would suggest giving them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - really enjoyed ourselves”
Reviews.Author: shaybaby25
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. The rooms were great - - we had a balcony overlooking the pools, bay and beach. The room has an iPod radio where we listened to music, had a glass of wine and enjoyed every evening watch the sun go down. The hotel was packed when we first arrived which was a bit annoying at the pool but luckily the crowd died down the second day and we had a great stay. The food and drinks were a bit pricey (but I guess they always are at hotels) and not very good. The room had a fridge so I would advise bringing your own drinks and snacks. We stopped by a convenience store on our walk back from the beach and grabbed some goodies. The hotel has a few fire pits where you can relax or do s'mores. The hotel sales s'more kits :) We walked over the bridge to the beach (about 30 minute walk) and had a great time on the beach. Wow, the people watching was GREAT! If you walk down the marina from the hotel there is a bagel shop (owned by the hotel) - we ate breakfast outside and watched the seals - - it was really neat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: timber118
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff good, some amenities lacking. Much appreciated staff offering us complimentary champagne to celebrate our anniversary and great service at the Red Marlin restaurant. Would have expected robes in the rooms for walking through the extensive grounds to pool area or lounging on our balcony. Water sports desk was never open and we were eventually referred to a competitor's rental service down the boardwalk. Not close enough to restaurant/retail area which would likely have been fine had the weather been better and we'd spent all our time by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrible stay EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Blairlola
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Hilton but I wanted to give Hyatt a try because we had never stayed at a Hyatt. We booked a suite for a 2 night vacation package through Sea World and added an extra night directly through Hyatt. We planned on staying for 3 nights. From the time we walked up to the front desk it was disaster. First of all the young lady named Bekka greeted us as though it was painful for her to do so. And when we gave her the confirmation number she said we were only booked for 1 night. I had explained to her that we were booked for 2 nights originally through SW and added an extra night. She made calls and could not find anything but had said we were ok for 3 nights. She did not let us know anything about the Hotel or what the Hotel had to offer and did not even offer us what had come with the 3rd night stay ( a movie and 25% off meal in their restaurant and free parking). She has no buisness in the hospitality buisness because she lacked hospitable skills. Then we get to our room. Where do I start? The roomed smelled obnoxious because of the deodorizer the housekeeper used to cover the smells of the musky room, we had to pay for internet service and pay for cartoons on televsion for our daughter (this is unheard of to me),on the balcony was bird droppings from birds pirching over the balcony with no chairs on the balcony to sit. Parking is also 20.00 a day. We were paying almost $300.00 a night. The upgrades in this hotel are tacky and cheap looking. Very cold staff and very cold stay. Needless to say, we cancelled the original 2 night vactaion package through Sea World with the Hyatt and stayed only 1 night. We booked the remaining 2 night stay with Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa up the street. My gut did try to warn me as I was booking this trip to stay with Hilton where we have only got the BEST service in all our visits with Hilton. I I have to mention that we are disappointed with Sea World as far as not even getting an apology for the waste of money and time Hyatt Regency Mission Bay caused and cost us. We will probalby not book a vacation package through Sea World in the future and we will NEVER stay at this Hyatt or any other Hyatt as long as we live. Do not waste your money or time here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: DrBunBun
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel was a fun place to stay for a recent conference. The beds were comfortable and I appreciated the small balcony, which faced a stunning view of the marina - a real plus! The hotel's "Red Marlin" restaurant wasn't cheap but was surprisingly good, I willingly paid. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful with local sighteeing and dining recommendations, just great all around. Only a few drawbacks here - some of my colleagues reported being kept awake by noisy sea lions (!!), and I found it a bit far off the path, every time I wanted to leave the hotel I had to spend a small fortune in taxi rides back and forth. Would recommend renting a car if you choose to stay here. Overall a lovely experience and I would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - family oriented Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: NewRide
Reviews.Content: Given Hyatt Mission Bay's website, I thought this was another business man's stopover. It had all of the usual Hyatt amenities (great bed, nice bathrm, etc.), but I wasn't prepared for how family friendly it was. A couple of pools, one with dualing water slides, family movie at the pool, and tons of kids over April break. The location is good, just a short ride to Seaworld and the beaches. It would have been nice to be able to walk to the beach, but it wasn't far. The restaurant, Red Marlin, was good too, as was Epstiens for bagels. Great spot for families looking to explore San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for and more!”
Reviews.Author: tbuchal
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews on here before our trip, I was worried we picked the wrong hotel. However, we loved staying here! They had us booked in a waterfront suite in one of the bays, but after reading many reviews I asked if we could get a tower suite. They had no problem changing our rooms. We were on the 12th floor overlooking the marina and Seaworld. I would highly recommend getting an upper floor in the tower to avoid street and other noises from the marina. We also brought our daughter's sound machine to drown out noises we may have heard. We really didn't need it that high up, but she's used to it so it did help. Our bed was soooo comfortable! The pillows were plush and plentiful. We didn't rent a car and just used taxis which are plentiful outside the front desk. I believe the hotel charges $25 a night to park. It was $6 to Seaworld and $25 to the zoo. They offer free shuttle service to and from Mission Bay Beach which is less than a mile from the hotel. We went during the off-season which was great when visiting Seaworld and the zoo. It was also nice because the hotel was not crowded and loud and we still had nice weather. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. They recommended restaurants for us and knew the cab fare to each place we wanted to visit. We ate at Swim one night which is a bar/restaurant poolside and the food was fantastic. It was a little pricey ($14 for a burger) but the quality was wonderful. The fish tacos were excellent as well as the kids meals. Each morning we ate at Einstein Bros. Bagels and sat on the marina. The bagels and bagel sandwiches were very good and seemed to fill us up. We just loved sitting out on our balcony and looking out at the city. We enjoyed walking around the grounds of the hotel because they were absolutely beautiful. Our 3 year old thought she was on a safari! The pools were heated and very fun with the waterslides. They also didn't charge for towel service, maybe because it was in October and not many guests. If you are traveling to San Diego, going during the off-season was great since they always have great weather. It's nice to avoid the crowds. The hotel did not offer the ferry service to and from Seaworld though after September. No fireworks at Seaworld either after September. Otherwise, everything else was great! We hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel and location, but don't expect to lay out at the beach.”
Reviews.Author: OneTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times now. It is located in Mission Bay, right along the marina area (not suntanning beach.) This hotel is less than a 5 minute drive from Sea World, has amazing newly renovated pools and a pretty marina. The pools have a waterslide for toddlers and another for bigger kids---probably the most family-friendly pools we have found in San Diego. Rooms are newly renovated, clean and trendy. We really love this hotel and it reminds us of a resort you might find in Hawaii. Parking costs daily.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good value, great location even though not in town”
Reviews.Author: ericagee1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was excellent value, especially as we upgraded to a corner triple aspect room overlooking the ocean and the Marina. The room in the Tower building was spectacular, roomy bright airy gorgeous. I only discovered on our last morning (after 4 night stay) that the radio behind bed had a docking station for my ipod! We booked online and went for the upgrade option where you agree to pay if it's available, and this was only $12 per night so we did it and were very happy we did. This, on top of a promotional one night free rate, made it the best stay of our trip in four hotels. Spacious attractive pool area and lovely restaurant with outdoor firepits and views of the Marina. Service was excellent in this hotel, from the reception (Molly)to the concierge (Ed) to the restaurant (everyone) We didn't mind being 10/15 minutes out of town as we took the trolley bus tour to see it, which picked us up from the hotel. Also, with the suggestions of Ed, we chose to eat out a few times in other districts which were easy to get to, to park and were good value for excellent food. There were lots of activities you could do on the water or on bikes, although we didn't. If you're happy not to be located centre downtown, then book this hotel. But ask for a high room so you're not disturbed by pool noise. Wen would come back here

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mgm252
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights in oct 2009 after driving down form vegas/la. perfect relaxing end to a busy holiday. room (suite) fantatsic overlooked marina. clean and very spacious. pool clean and relaxing. pool bar ideal. restuarant overlooks marina and food was great. must hire bikes and ride around mission bay. word of advice carry passport if u want an alcoholic drink as most places wont accept UK driving licenece - not what u want to hear after a 3 mile walk in the heat! must visit old town san diego - like mexico (well the border is so close). very laid back. beaches amaxzing. hotel in great location and well worth money. only downside was parking quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: citydweller32
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly and accomodating. When we first arrived we were somewhat put-off by our room. There are several building around the hotel and we were initially in a small room with no view in a front facing building.
