With one call to the front desk, we were upgraded to a great room with a waterfront view for a nominal charge. We were able to check in early. The concierge sells little packages to have smores around the fire at night....The room was comfortable and very modern with a nice little deck. The parking was $20/night, or $25/night for valet parking. We would like to return to this hotel again soon! Able to walk to Sea World in only a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, okay room, and ridiculous charges.”
Reviews.Author: Clymer5
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay after reading the great reviews. Also, the website stated that a $65-million dollar renovation had been completed. Above all else, i value new, clean hotel rooms, which is what I expected to find at this Hyatt Regency. Check-in was a lengthy process, even though they were not that busy. The desk clerk was friendly, just slow. The bell hops and valet guys were very nice. They gave us great info on things like where to eat, and what time the fireworks display was every night. (You can see Sea World's fireworks show from the property.) Our room was in one of the two "Bays", which are two-story buildings with several rooms in them. Our second floor room was small and cramped. There was little room to move around with the two queen beds, dresser, nightstand, desk and bench. The bathroom was a bit better. It was standard, except the long countertop, which was nice. Although the rooms were "newly designed" and furnished, they were not as clean as I expected. The carpet felt sticky, there were dust bunnies in the corners, and the bath tub was stained and dirty looking. Not quite the standard I expect from Hyatt Regency. Unfortunately, one of our kids got sick and we needed clean sheets for one of the beds. I called and requested a full set with blankets and pillowcases, and was told they would be sent to us. It took about 40 minutes for the stuff to be delivered, and when it arrived, it was 3 sheets, no blanket, no pillowcases. So I had to wait again for the pillowcases and blanket. Finally, the pillowcases arrived, but we never did get a blanket. The other disappointment was the lack of a balcony off of our room. The grounds of this resort are beautiful. Generous landscaping lends it a lush, tropical feel. The pools were nice, and had small slides that my kids enjoyed. One of the pools also had a zero-entry which is great for my one-year old to splash and play in. We also enjoyed the cabanas with sofas that were available. It was nice to sit in them at night, relax and enjoy the fire. There is a restaurant on site. My husband ate lunch there and said it was just okay. Overall, this resort hotel was okay. The grounds were very nice, but the rooms were lacking. I expect cleaner, larger rooms for the amount of money we spent. In addition, I think it is ridiculous for a hotel to charge $9.95 for 24 hours of hi-speed internet service. Thankfully, we travel with mi-fi and don't need it. Also, we needed to print something while we were there. So, we went to the business center, and incurred a $5 charge to use the PC and print a one page form. Another ridiculous charge! I certainly don't think the 10 minutes we used the PC and printer was worth the money they charged

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed by pool and very over priced..save your money.”
Reviews.Author: stevemb60
Reviews.Content: Very small pool area for the size of hotel. This is a very expensive hotel with decent rooms and a marina next door, but nothing much else in this area. Apart from an hefty price tag on your room rate, but I can't understand why? Choose a much cheaper hotel in the downtown/city area..................wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: smaragdpete
Reviews.Content: The Regency Club was shut due to a business decision by management. OK I got points compensation but even so!! Rooms were scantily decorated. Front office girls very service minded but often had to queue. We were at the Red Marlin for breakfast and wanted a seat outside (there were plenty of them) but were told the server had his break! Is that of interest to me as a customer! Agree with a previous reviewer, they seem to want to make bucks on everything. There was a huge parking lot outside and even that cost $20. I would recommend a Hyatt Summerfield Place at least if you are on business. Would not use this facility again. Even part of the pool was shut so not sure if it is a good family stay or not. Staff over zealous in the Swim bar which was cramped and the only option after 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: SKGfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had a great time and so did the kids ages 8 & 11 - The room was very clean and updated. The waterslides at the pool were really great for the kids along with the smores kits that can be purchased and enjoyed in the evenings at firepit next to pool. The Red Marlin restaurant on property was amazing - 5 stars ( Recommend the Salmon ) and the kids "buffet" on the weekends was perfecto ! Great location in San Diego - short drive to all the attractions and the water taxi to SeaWorld from the hotel was added fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a place...”
Reviews.Author: lipnmin
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I saw this hotel was #89 out of all the hotels in San Diego but booked it anyway becuase it was under $200 a night.. WOW, this place was great. The location was wonderful. The views from our room were so beautiful. We overlooked the harbor and pool. You could also see the fireworks from Sea World everynight. The kids loved the 3 pools with water slides. We took the ferry into Sea Worlds back door. Everything we could of asked for and more. Cant wait to go again...

Reviews.Title: “We Made the right choice on this trip”
Reviews.Author: snoozie60
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but great things to say about our stay at your hotel. We could not believe how nice and accommodating EVERYONE on your staff is. I don't usually fill out reviews but I thought it would be unfair if I didn't this time. We loved our room and the entire facility and would recommend it to everyone. The location was perfect for the boys as they could walk to the beach. The location was also perfect for sightseeing and all the things we wanted to do. The view out of our room was beautiful. We enjoyed the sea lions on the dock. We just had the greatest time and will definitely be back. I am trying to talk my friend into getting married at the hotel. I am sure I will win this. OK one negative thing not enough teenage girls were there on our week. It was ok with me!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I want a home as central and relaxing . . .”
Reviews.Author: dpfeiffer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited San Diego for the first time, traveling with our 6 year old daughter. We wanted a place that felt fun and leisurely but also a little sophisticated - to give ourselves a little treat. We feel like we found just the right place. All is not perfect, but on balance, we had a great time and were pleased with the service. The hotel is perfectly located. We traveled around the area each of the 7 days we stayed and all trips were less than 30 minutes. Can't find a comparison in Chicago where we came. Longest trip was to Legoland at about 35 minutes. Our first night was lackluster. We reserved a waterfront suite, but found the room a little less than we hoped for, but a trip to the main desk yielded us a really nice junior suite room in the main tower for the remainder of our stay. No questions asked. I can't say enough about the staff that work in the resort. You can't pass a single person without that person saying hello or striking up a conversation. The people are fantastic. The Red Marlin restaurant is great. The SWIM bar at the pool is nice. The hotel showed movies at the pool the first night we were there and had activities for kids each day. The pool was never overcrowded, but always full of kids. This is a great place for parents that want a little pampering, while the kids feel like they're the center of attention. I'm not thrilled with the fact that everything has a hefty price tag. Parking costs $20 per day - going green foregoing a car is a good thing here. Red Marlin is not cheap. The dinner's seemed worthwhile to me, but the $20 breakfast buffet is a stretch. Snow cones for the kids at the pool - which seemed like a free treat - cost $5. A kit for making Smores over the open fire pits at the pool costs $8. None of these things are outrageous for a short trip, but on a 7 day stay, you're constantly reminded of the credit card bill. How about costs that decrease based upon the length of time that you stay at the hotel? In total, the environment, the location, and the people made this a great stay. It costs money to keep a complex like this going and we chose this place knowing that it would cost us more. I still kind of resent the feeling of being nickled and dimed while there, but our family had a great trip and were happy to arrive back at the hotel each night. We felt safe, clean, and happy. You don't always get that when arriving in a city for the first time. I'd recommend the stay. I'd also recommend a Junior Suite in the tower facing the marina. Great view of fireworks each night, sighting of dolphins in the marina, sea lions barking each night, and a great room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: d105raynee
Reviews.Content: This is a great central location. You can get anywhere you want to go staying here. Great view of the bay and sea lions on the harbor. Large rooms for great price.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Savvycantu
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in!! The views were impeccable!! The pricing was not over the top either. It was a good price for what you were receiving in exchange!!

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next stay”
Reviews.Author: TXgirl70
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay --July 23rd-30th. I read every review on here, deciding to ignore the negatives, and just book, and I am so glad I did! Such a relaxing stay! It was perfect for our family vacation for our 3 and 6 year old boys, and I would also stay here if we were traveling without the kids. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is amazing, the rooms clean and relaxing, the food delicious, and the location perfect. We agonized over whether to stay in La Jolla, Coronado Island, or the Mission Bay area, and feel we made a great choice. The water ferry back and forth from Sea World was fun and convenient. We could go to the park for an hour, or the whole day, through an easy back gate into the park. (makes you feel like part of the staff ) We loved watching the boats in the bay, and the sea lions frolicking in the water, and on the docks, from our 15th floor balcony. We've been home for days and still miss the sound of their barking. We also had the perfect view of the nightly Sea World fireworks. The weather was pretty cool (mid 60's) that week, but coming from 100 degree Dallas, TX heat, we didn't mind so much, and it didn't stop our boys from having a BLAST on the water slides. We only wish the slides opened earlier, since my husband and the boys would have loved to do that while mom primped and got ready for the day, before breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, one of our favorite parts of every day was the delicious, relaxing breakfast buffet. Located in the Red Marlin restaurant, sitting over the water in the marina, with beautiful views from every table, it was the perfect start to every day of theme parks, and sight seeing. The staff were infectiously friendly and attentive, and the food was really delicious. Lots of healthy choices, along with yummy pastries and treats, since it is vacation after all. We highly recommend making this part of your stay package...very worth it. We filled up so well, that it allowed us keep our lunches light. The restaurant at the pool, Swim, was also delicious. Definitely take advantage of that. The boys loved sitting by the beautiful aquarium, and the fish tacos are delish. So are the veggie sandwich, and quesadillas. Also, the smores kit you can purchase through the concierge to use at the firepits at night is a must. So fun. I have to end with this example of how wonderful the staff at this hotel is. On our last full day at the hotel, our three year old woke up with a stomach virus. He was extremely ill. We called the front desk mid morning, to request some new linens. A security guard and maid came to our room, to dispose of and change all the linens. They were so sweet to our little boy, and I was impressed with the thoroughness in which they cleaned the room. Very reassuring. We left for a walk that evening when he was feeling better, and returned to our room to find a basket FULL of goodies, and several bottled waters and sodas, and a sweet hand-written card from Keith, the security guard, addressing our son by name, telling him he hoped he felt better, with a gift certificate to purchase a movie through the hotel. It was so thoughtful, and special. I realize I sound like Suzy Sunshine, but I truly can't think of any negatives about this hotel, aside from the price of parking and the hours the slides are open. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: abdspd2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2010 with my husband, and 2 kids. I was surprised at how spacious the regular rooms are. The bathroom was also large, and we did not feel cramped. We had a nice balcony overlooking the pool. We couldn't have asked for better customer service, as well as great housekeeping service. The hotel is right on the harbor, and about a mile walk to the beach. We would definitely stay here again. The only negative would be that there are not alot of conveinent restaurants close by. The Hotel restaurant is good, but somewhat pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMegs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hyatt Mission Bay. I was apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed on the 12th floor of the Tower Building and had a view of the marina. The room was clean and tidy. The bathroom was updated and was simple but clean. The view was great and the housekeepers were pleasant and helpful. I heard from others we met there that the rooms that have an "odor" as listed in previous postings are in the Bay I and Bay II buildings. The Tower building was fine. We ate dinner one night at the Red Marlin restaurant.The meal was pricey but the food and service were excellent. The Sea World water taxi was great. It cost $5.00 per person R/T and was great to avoid waiting in line at the gates and the parking lot. The pools were nice however I was disappointed that all of the waterslides close at 6:00pm. It was way to early in my opinion. The weather was unseasonably chilly while we were there ( low 60's) so the pool temp. could have been turned up a bit. We spent more time in the hot tub than the pool. My only negatives for the hotel are signing out pool towels with a 25.00 per towel deposit. For a hotel of this caliber, we shouldn't need to sign out towels. If ther has been a problem with missing towels, then provide more staff to monitor. Don't make it into a YMCA towel system. This was an issue because my kids went down to the pool first while I got changed and couldn't receive a towel until I came down with the pool cards for our room. Also, Einstein Bagels stops serving at 12:00 noon which really limited your food choices to the expensive pool bar or the expensive Red Marlin restaurant. Also, it is advertised that the beach is within walking distance. It is not! You need to drive to MIssion Beach. I'm a walker , but it is too far to go when you are carrying things with your family. I found this to be very misleading on the hotel website. $25.00 for parking was also ridiculous in my opinion. Too many extra fees considering the price you pay for the room.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rdbd22
Reviews.Content: There were 11 of us. 5 adults, 2 teenagers, 1 tween, an 8, 5, & 1 year old. First the positive: Housekeeping. They were beyond sweet & helpful to all of us. Red Marlin. The food was great. The waiters were nice. The waterslides. (when they were open). Kids LOVED them. The water taxi to Sea World. ALL the rest of it is negative: Our rooms were so old & ugly. We were in the same building as the the lobby. Stains everywhere. Really old looking. Mini coolers instead of refrigerators. No light in the closet The service was very poor. There was always a line for the concierge and the front desk. They weren't even very helpful. They ran out of towels at the pool. Towels that you had to "pay" for and then get credit back. The pools were freezing. It was overcast and in the 60's all week. They knew that so why not heat at least one of the pools. The first day the waiter didn't tell us there was a kid's menu at the pool so we ended up getting all of them adult meals. Everything costs extra. Parking $25 a day. Wifi. (seriously?) Pool towels (ridiculous!) The absolute worst was when my one year old shut the adjoining door & was locked in one of the rooms by himself with the chain on the front door. We called the front desk to send someone up with a tool to break the chain and they couldn't be more casual about it. After 3 phone calls to them & 25 minutes later, WE finally broke it open. We couldn't have been more clear that he was only ONE and by himself. They couldn't care less. We were right above the front desk. It wasn't like they were far. When someone finally arrived we asked them if that has ever happened before and they replied that it happens all the time. So why did it take so long to respond or just bring a tool? That was the last straw. We handed them the chain, checked out of all our rooms, and moved on.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel perfect for famalies with children. The pool area is the best with great service and waterslides for the children. Very well maintained hotel with upgraded rooms and amenities. Incredible hotel staff all around. Perfect location right across from Sea World. Red Marlin Restaurant was great. Amazing pool side drinks and appetizers. I would highly recommend this hotel and will sure to return next summer.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing hotel visit I've had in years! You'll LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: debbyem
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly beautiful - definitely a "resort" feeling. At this price, this hotel truly exceeds expectations! It's location (right on the marina) is peaceful and offers tremendous views. My 2 yr old granddaughter particularly loved that we could sit on our balcony and watch the sea lions playing in the marina. The rooms are comfy, quiet and clean. Without exception, the staff at this hotel went out of their way to make us comfortable. Not once did we even walk by a hotel employee without having them greet us and ask if they could help us in any way. The Red Marlin restaurant has decent food and excellent service. And, the pool side restaurant - don't bother getting out of your comfy lounge chair - they'll come to you, and with a smile! The kids loved the water slides at the pool. Their room service was absolutely wonderful - way above what I'm used to in this price range. And, if you stay here, you MUST visit their spa for an absolutely heavenly massage!! We travel a lot, but this was, by far, the most relaxing trip we've had in years, largely because of this hotel. Service is apparently very important at this hotel. We certainly felt like every single employee there was interested in making sure we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Convenient Location, Nice Views from Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunkissedskin
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed here during San Diego's week of unheard of weather for July. It was 65 and cloudy but that's not to blame on the hotel, I will still rate them accurately. We found the hotel to be very good for what we needed. Here are some things I wish I knew LOCATION: if you're looking to see the San Diego area it is a great location to do so. You will have to drive everywhere but that is expected. Most sites (Coronado, Gas Lamp, La Jolla) were within a 15-20 minute drive. The hotel is situated on a Marina and you can walk around and view the boats/etc. PARKING: expensive for what seemed to be plenty of parking availability. It was $20/day to self-park, $25 to valet. I would recommend the self-parking as none of the parking lots were too far away to walk yourself. BEACHES: It is situated on a Marina so you cannot swin in the ocean there but Pacific Beach is the closet beach (10 minute drive). I would recommend a longer drive to Coronado Beach- much nicer. POOL: Due to the aforementioned weather we did not get to take advantage of the pool. It looked great for kids, not so great for a young couple looking to enjoy a romantic swim. There are 3 waterslides but as this hotel is situated next to Sea World it is infested with kids TOWELS: upon check-in you can ask for towel cards (as many as you like) that you will be responsible for returning when checking out. Basically if you lose the card or the towel you pay $25. The towels are better than the typical pool towel but not worth 25 bucks. ROOMS: There are two different rooms types to pay attention to when booking. The Bay rooms are small one story rooms that basically have a bed and bathroom, not much room for anything else. They have decks but no view of the ocean. With the hotel being situated on Mission Bay I would recommend upgrading to an ocean view in the tower (2nd room type). These rooms are spacious and have a breathtaking view of the Marina or Ocean. We chose the ocean and were on the 10th floor which enabled us to see for miles. It's worth it. We also stayed in a corner Junior Suite which was incredibly nice but probably bigger than what we needed. FOOD: We only ate at the "Swim Lounge" which is fine for chips and dip or a sandwhich but not much else. It is also a lot smaller than the pictures lead you to believe. SERVICE: Other than checking in and speaking with the concierge a few times on the phone we never had to deal with the hotel staff. Check-in was easy and the concierge was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice staff, difficult to book though!”
Reviews.Author: Thyan
Reviews.Content: We bid on a silent auction for a trip to San Diego and part of the package was a 4 night stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay Hotel. We paid quite a bit of money for this trip, so I was a but dismayed how difficult it was to book this trip. It seems they have very few rooms set aside for this type of travel. We were given room vouchers and it took many phone calls to finally make a reservation. The room we were initially given was not satisfactory and I was downstairs in the lobby to check on a room change immediately! They were doing work on the side of the building involving gardening and all I could hear was the sound of heavy equipment. We were moved to the tower building on the 4th floor facing the pool. While a bit loud, it was decorated much nicer and was a much larger room. Beds very comfortable. Staff very helpful- we never left the parking area without offers of maps and directions. Only sour note, we were over charged at the bar. We were charged for 3 drinks each when we only had 2. The bar area had lava rocks and a fire each night that was very cozy. It was nice to sit outdoors and sip on a glass of wine by the fire pit. It gets quite cool in September in San Diego. I really love this hotel. You have to have a car to get into San Diego, but the feel of the hotel is really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...not up to Hyatt Standards...”
Reviews.Author: qualitymattersny
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here and read the reviews before coming... I thought can't be that bad... I was wrong! I never post to sites like this but felt compelled to warn other travellers. I am a Hyatt Goldpass Member - I travel a lot for business and stay at Hyatt's First and Marriots second. I prefer Hyatt -- the quality and cost have always matched and surprised me -- NOT THIS TIME... I would call this an ala carte Hyatt. 1) Parking $20 self parking - $25 - Valet 2) Internet - 9.95 a day 3) Need to print something -- Business Center $6.95 for 15 min. 4) Pool Towel - $20 dollar per pool card returned at the end of the trip when you turn in your pool card The rooms are outdated -- the need a new renovations project team. The first room we were "upgraded to" what on the 3rd floor facing the pool and right next to the noisiest ice machine ever made. The airconditioning didn't work and neither did the lights in the "living/office" area. The morning we awoke to the seagulls morning feeding ritual because the were nesting on the roof of the Pool Lounge. We complained and I also told them as a gold passport member I always get the uppper floors and pay for it so using my "points" gets me a lower quality room. I got to the 15th floor... but wait my profile also states not to be near the elevator -- who wants to hear that all night -- so they moved us again - to room 1101 -- a Jr Suite -- that looks nothing like the other suite. There are stains on the floor and the furniture is filthy -- my feet are black just from walking on the carpet. Honestly I am not that picky for $250 a night (or $350 if I didn't ask) I expect better -- I stay at Hyatt Places for $120 a night and they are immaculate...and all these "ala carte" items are included. Now the view from the room is nice but even on the 11th floor you hear the traffic but that is prefferable to the loud music played at the pool until 11pm on Friday night and the obnoxius guests that don't have the decency to respect other guests. There is no coffee bar in the lobby - so fill up in your room - with the paper cups.. yes paper cups..again for the room rate? Really? The staff is definetly what saves this place and I think they are well aware of the issues with the hotel -- so the sqeaky wheel gets some action - don't be afraid to complain. Would I stay here again -- NOPE!! In fact will be shopping around while here to find another hotel for the next trip. Location -- great if your a tourist and want to go to Sea World - we have a view of the fireworks everynight which is thrilling for my 6 year old. Other than that there is nothing around this hotel - better off staying in Hotel Circle if you are being a tourist. We lived hear for 12 yrs so thought is would be fun to stay at the beach -- which is not near the hotel -- you need your car or be prepared to walk about 20 minutes. Not one of Hyatt's better property's -- very disappointed. SO BIG HINTS -- TOWER ROOMS, MARINA SIDE, COMPLAIN AND MAKE THE MOST OF IT I will post pictures once I take them all...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Rooms, Friendly Staff, Deceitful Management”
Reviews.Author: CalAlumTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights during the week last week for a conference. We were provided with a ground floor room with a patio. I liked the room which was situated in a Hawaiiana-like garden. The only problem was that there was a speaker playing music until about 8 p.m. or so every day. The hotel is situated close enough to Ocean and Imperial Beaches, each of which have their own type of charm. Ocean Beach is like a mini Venice Beach (California) and Imperial Beach reminds me of the Jersey shore. The only problem I had was that management staff tended to lie about things such as room availability, whether furniture was going to be produced, etc. One annoying thing was that wait staff took your plate away whether or not you were finished with it. Tips: If you want to hassle with three elevators for a bunch of rooms in the tower, do it for the views. If you don't want to hassle with the elevators and don't mind a damp smell in your room, but want a larger room, go with the ground floor rooms. Highlights: The pools and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the pool, but drive offsite for meals”
Reviews.Author: princess_teri
Reviews.Content: I think other reviewers are harsh. I wouldn't not stay here, nor would i not recommend it to others. You just have to know its strengths and weaknesses. Manchester Grand Hyatt has many dining choices within walking distance, but crummy pool...here, a great pool and only a few dining choices. In fact one of the better pools in S.D. esp downtown. Plus boat/bike/kayak rentals to get you out on the bay. We played in the pool, rode bikes, rented a power boat, ate at Red Marlin, The Mission, and Five Guys burgers, and had a great time! Pros: - Small but very enjoyable pool with 3 slides, beach entry. Our 7 yr old loved it. - Nice renovation in lobby and tower rooms – upscale contemporary vibe - Nice grounds - Red Marlin had pretty good food and great service - Views from Tower are great. - Watersports rentals just down the way (the one closest to the hotel is a total ripoff BTW, keep walking). Renting a power boat was the highlight of our trip. - Close to Mission Bay restaurants/nightlife (unlike Hilton San Diego resort) - Staff is great, econcierge is responsive over email. - Get the Costco discount coupons. - Great location for 4th of july fireworks. Bay view rooms can see Paradise Point & Mission Bay Yacht Club fireworks; Marina view rooms can see Downtown & Sea World fireworks. Cons: - Due to the pool, Hotel is totally overrun by kids. - Wind from the ocean can be strong at the pool - Only 2 restaurants – Red Marlin and Swim. Need more choices. Of course can always drive off site. - Parking seemed limited, hopefully valet could have taken us if self parking was full.

Reviews.Title: “What I read is true........stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: jskjmseattle_wa
Reviews.Content: this is a "dated" (very) hotel out on mission bay in san diego. it is an isolated hotel. there is nothing for a family here. the staff is all very kind, but they need to be. i booked a waterview suite, only to be told there were none available when i checked in. i was "upgraded" to connecting rooms.....not even on regency level. our rooms still were so-so. they were not very clean and there were cigarette burn marks on our outdoor chairs. in addition, they nail you with extras: parking? ($20 for self park and a long walk.....$25 with valet), internet ($10) come on !!!!!!, mini fridges that state they don't keep medicines or dairy products safe (what gives?!) there is no place close (walking distance) to eat or shop, so beware. i would recommend some other place for the money. i am trying to be nice......i will reserve final judgement until tomorrow. there is supposed to be an "exclusive" water taxi service to seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: blueyes21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights - June 25 - June 27, 2010 and wished we had more time to enjoy at the hotel. We were in town for a wedding and had to make it a quick trip due to work obligations back home but this hotel was great - the pool was beautiful, kinda noisy with kids running around but why wouldn't you bring your kids to a pool with 3 water slides! We had lunch at Red Marlin and it was good - a little over priced but stunnin views of the marina and the service was great. We stayed in one of the bay view rooms which, based on other peoples' comments, i wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. the room was a little older but had been updated. It was clean and while we did face the parking lot, the water was just beyond that. everyone from the pool server to the concierge and front desk were friednly and very accomodating. We would stay there again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Nice San Diego homebase for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Ölli
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend from Monday, June 28th to Thursday, July 1st in the Hyatt Mission Bay. We had a nice time there, it was a good homebase to explore the San Diego area. Basically, you will get everything to expect from an upscale chain hotel like the Hyatt - and maybe a little bit more as well in positive aspects as in not-so-positive aspects. We had a waterfront suite; which seems to be their premium room type (living room & bedroom, separate building, attached to the marina). So the 'ups' first: Loads of space, nicely 'redecorated' as a former reviewer wrote. We experienced a good service, all the staff where friendly and helpful. Location is almost walking distance to SeaWorld and Mission Beach. To say it clear: I would recommend this hotel as long as you get a good rate on it and probably return myself. I haven't seen the other rooms but the little extra money for the waterfront suite seemed well-invested. There are some minor issues I would like to share with you that actually keep me from giving this hotel a higher ranking: * Noise: The hotel is in the airport flight path, so you have frequent noise due to coming and leaving planes. That itself is not really disturbing. But with marina & promenade next door und many party people around it simply adds up. Just be prepared on that, it is nothing the hotel can do anything about. * Parking: Parking on the hotel grounds (we are talking about self parking) will cost some money (20$ a day). That is a little downturn for me personally since it is not a city hotel. Even with that money taken, the parking lot before the suite building was almost always crowded. * Buildings: The buildings itself and some of the basic furniture itself are rather old. Even though beeing redecorated, you can see the time gone by in the rooms and furniture. * No complimentary internet (but a reasonable price in the rooms) Finally, the balcony of our suite was quite small and had no chairs on it. That's not so nice at all. On the higher floors of the Tower you might actually have a better view view, a bigger balcony and some equipment. All in all these minor issues did not spoil our vacation in any way. We had a good time at the Hyatt and I would return for another San Diego pitstop!

Reviews.Title: “Finally......a Hyatt that gets Customer Service Right”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this hotel last year when they were in the midst of their renovation but decided to come back after the renovation was complete due to a points offer for GoldPassport members. My previous experience was okay with just middling service from the staff and nicely redecorated rooms that were comfortable but not spectacular. Both times I received a "partial" ocean view or "Marina" view I think is what they call it. As others have said the pool area is nice but definitely meant for families and kids. There is a nice bar area near the pool and a highly rated restaurant (Red Marlin) on the grounds but I never took advantage of them due to the price. If you feel up to walking, Mission Beach is about a 20-30 minute walk west of the hotel (or 5 minute drive) where you'll find plenty of restaurants and nightlife (parking is difficult there so I usually walk---besides, you've already paid $20). There is also a seafood restaurant next door that has more reasonable prices but is also more "divey" looking. Rooms are comfortable with the Hyatt Grand Bed but beware if you're a light sleeper with a marina-facing room as on both occasions I was able to hear the seals barking even at night. My biggest surprise here though was the massive improvement in customer service. I'm not sure if they got a new GM or just better training but I was very impressed with the friendliness, smiles and genuine willingness to help provided by the staff. At check-in, I chatted with a nice young lady who genuinely seemed to be happy to be working there. If you've ever stayed at the Hyatt in Irvine or Orange County, you'll see a marked difference in the staff (especially among the sour/dour Irvine staff). Even when passing by maint. or housekeeping staff, they acknowledge you and smile and sometimes joke with you making you feel at home and relaxed. I only wish that Hyatt would transfer this to most of their other properties as this is what customer service should be for this level of a hotel. Let's just hope that this Hyatt can maintain it going forward........

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: norrismd
Reviews.Content: The good- the staff could not be friendlier. Lots of smiles and when our phones didn't work we had help almost immediately. Yes our phones didn't work. Nor did the lamps or the light in the alcove. There were no soaps, shampoo, conditioner, in the bathroom when we arrived. When we arrived we were told that we would receive a call on our cell phone as soon as the room is ready, that never happened. Great pool for kids and you can watch a movie at night while you are in the pool if you can stand the constant wind. Food was expensive but you expect that at a resort. There is no other places to go unless you want to drive. If it wasn't for the great staff I probably would down grade the review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Hyatt Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: Glendale_Sarah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very positive experience staying at this hotel. Here are the details and some advice Advice: consider booking from the hotel's website. We did, and found the cheapest rate of all the sites we checked. The other benefit of doing so (rather than booking on Expedia or whatever) was that we were able to SELECT, rather than request a room type (like you do on Expedia). In this way, we selected a high floor tower room with an ocean view. When we arrived at the hotel, they didn't have a room that fit what we selected so it's my understanding that because of this we were upgraded to the Hyatt Gold Passport floor (or whatever it's called) which is the highest floor other than the penthouse floor. My other tip only applies to Costco members. If you are a Costco member you can get Hyatt gift certificates. You can buy cards in increments of $100.00, but you'll only pay $80.00. We used these certificates to pay most of our bill (for the hotel and food, etc.) saving us about 20%. If you get to the Hyatt and realize you've forgotten to do this, there's a Costco about 4 miles away. FYI: Please call to double check that they'll take the credit in case they've changed their policy! I don't want any mad Trip Advisor readers coming after me. On to the review Check In: Check in went smoothly (we were excited to be upgraded) Room: Our room was in good condition and had a fabulous view. The toilet gurgled occasionally throughout the night. Other than that, no issues. Staff: Wow! The customer service at this hotel was very nice. Everyone was very friendly and polite. I even got a book recommendation from the waitress at the pool who saw the novel I was reading and had some ideas for me. I also thought they handled the issue of not having the room we reserved ready really well. Good job Hyatt! Noise: Our room was really quiet; we couldn't hear anyone else in adjoining rooms. Resort Grounds/Pool: The grounds and pool were generally in good condition and very aesthetically pleasing. Even though the hotel was pretty full, we didn't have problems getting chairs by the pool. The hot tub was kind of dirty looking and bubbled ominously. We did not go in. Food: Wow. My husband and I both travel a fair amount (him moreso than me for business) and both of us though the SWIM bar (that's the pool food) was pretty good. We had dinner at the Red Marlin restaurant and it was absolutely fabulous, but pricey. As hotel restaurants go, this is one worth checking out. That being said, teir wine list was really polarizing: some good stuff but really pricey and some stuff which was inexpensive but pretty yuck. Other amenities, etc. The firepits outside were nice. I thought it was sweet that they brought around free popsicles at the pool (although I would have loved ice water dispensers or the distribution of iced water like they have at some Ritz Carlton properties. Sigh.) Some people have commented that this place nickles and dimes you on parking, pool towel charges (which are refundable, btw, so I don't get the problem) and other things. I priced around before booking and the Hyatt is just about even (and in some cases cheaper) than places like the Mariott and the Hilton (the Hilton is $25.00 to self park) which is just down the way. I think the prices seem reasonable _for a resort_. All in all, we had a good visit. I think we'd feel good about coming back, but might also try another spot just to see what's out there.

Reviews.Title: “It's 11:30 PM, I'm laying here in bed and...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTracy33
Reviews.Content: It's 11:30 PM, I'm laying here in bed and can't sleep because of all the screaming people outside. I even have earplugs in! We usually stay at the Catamaran, but thought we would splurge and stay st the Hyatt. What a mistake! When we got here we just wanted to hang out by the pool, but it was over crowded, bad.music, (in my opinion) and a lot of screaming kids. I love kids, but this place is like a nursery school pool. I guess it's a good place to come if you want to be with your kids, and a lot of other kids too. The pool service was good, and so were the drinks. There's not really anything in close walking distance, so we had to get our car out of valet to go have dinner. We ate at World Famous, which is always great food, and you can't beat the location. It's also right across the street from the Catamaran. When we got back to our room, I saw about 4 bugs in the bathroom. I don't mind bugs when I'm camping, but prefer not to have them in what should be a nice hotel room. We watched a movie, which drowned out the loud partying adults and kids, but now it's time to sleep, and it's still really loud. At least the people who work here are nice, but there was a line to check in, and when ever I call the front desk there's a long hold time. I think it's a staffing problem. We will never stay here again. We miss the Catamaran!

Reviews.Title: “I Do Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: luvallhawaii
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency - Mission Bay for 4 nights. I was attending a conference being held at the hotel so it seemed like a good choice. It wasn't. First of all, this hotel boasts about a multi million dollar renovation. If this hotel had a multi million dollar renovation, they grossly overpaid. This is an old hotel and overall it looks like an old hotel that got a paint job. A lot about this hotel reminded me of a 1960's roadside motel. I believe that this hotel remodeled the guest rooms with a paint job, new bedding and new carpet but they need a lot more than that. The room looks okay at first glance and I liked the white bed linens with the green accents. All the other furniture looked old. The kicker was the rooms stink. Literally, they stink. My room smelled so musty and mildewy that I was worried everything I had would absorb the odor. I opened the windows, but since there are no screens, I then had to contend with bugs. I went to another conference attendee's room in another building and that room stunk as well. I heard the same comment from several people. Honestly, I have stayed in a lot of hotels and have never experienced a hotel room stinky like this. The bathroom was fine with a very long granite vanity and overall the room was clean. I stayed in Bay I (same building as the lobby) on the second floor. Rooms on the second floor of Bay I and Bay II do not have outdoor space. That is unless you call the open atrium area outside your door useful outdoor space. It's not. There is a real lack of attention to detail which when all those details are added up, it gives the feel of shabbiness. An example was that there was a wire was coming directly into the room through a hole in the wall for the heater/air conditioner and it was very visible since it was a few feet up the wall. The doors to the room had been painted inside and out, but it looked like they slapped paint over them and they looked shoddy. The walls of hotel are paper thin. Every sound traveled through the walls. I could hear everything in the room next door including the TV, the hairdryer and even talking and they weren't being loud. The hotel landscaping is quite lush and pretty. However, there is so much that as you try and navigate the pathways, it's hard to know where you are going sometimes. Note that the location of this hotel is not ideal unless you have a car as there is very little nearby and the choices at the hotel are limited. I found that the staff was very friendly and I had positive experiences with each person I came in contact with. I was impressed with the staff, however due to the overall condition of the hotel, I would not stay here again. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pick Another hotel on Mission Bay!”
Reviews.Author: camsmom2
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I and our 3 kids decided to go to San Diego over Memorial Day weekend and go to sea world. Wanted something on Mission Bay close to Sea World. We Have stayed at Hyatts before and loved them but this one was a HUGE diappointment!! 1st it took us 40 mins to check in (an there wasn't even a wait I walked right up to the counter), the room was not at all what I expected for the price and it being a newly remodeled Suite. The couch was so dirty no one wanted to sit on it, The lamp shades where stained and shower curtin had yellow stains on it, the windows were dirty as was the shower. The picture on there website not what we stayed in. We were suppose to have turn down service and extra linen for our stay that didn't happen and I had to call 3 times to get blankets. $20.00 for parking WOW!!! and there is a $25.00 chg for each pool towel (This will be credit back at the end of your stay if you turn back to the frint desk each pool/towel card). With our stay we rec'd 2 free breakfest for each nights stay @ the Marlin Rest. Food was really Good but the service not so great when I gave the waiter the letter for 2 free breakfest he said that I will need to go the the front desk when I check out and they will take it off my bill!! That should not be my job. I did call the front desk and they said the sever should have taken it off but they will do it, well they must have said something to the waiter cause the next day we got the same waiter and the service was slow and he couldn't care a bit for helping us everyone else came first, I also heard the waiter talking to the mgr. telling him I called the front desk the day before and complained, so I walked over and explained to him why I called. how rude he was!! I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends. They say they did a $65 milion dollar renovation more like a make over and cutting alot of corners and putting in cheap stuff. Housekeeping Mgr should take a closer look at how the rooms are and are NOT being cleaned. Also No Disney or cartoon Channel!

Reviews.Title: “Overall experience good but had to fight for it”
Reviews.Author: Viktor65
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk explained the towel card policy ($25 deposit per pool towel) by letting us know that everyone steals the towels. Seemed hostile. We originally had a "Bayview" room, it was more like a no tell motel than a Hyatt. No balcony on the motel side. I went to see about changing rooms to the tower and had to wait behind two other groups trying to change their rooms to the tower. I did switch but it was a king bed for our family of four ( extra 30 bucks for the upgrade, extra 20 bucks for the rollaway), luckily our kids are small and were happy with the couch buffered with ottomans. This was a much better room, well worth switching. Yeah, what is it about all the wind at the pool? The pool is great though, on a hot summer day it would be fantastic. The clerk forgot to give us towel cards though so we had to beg for them at the pool. It is way more convinient to self-park here, the bell hop made the suggestion to us, "You know, with your room here it would be closer to self-park, save yourself X " Well, no room is nearer the lobby than the parking lot, does everyone get this routine? and then we all tip the bell hop extra and have to tip the valets to retrive our cars. The kayak rentals and Einstein's bagels right outside our room were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent get away”
Reviews.Author: Kristina_S_0509
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. The hotel and its staff where excellent. When making your reservation request a room in the tower and a high floor, the views are spectacular. The spa was great, to cold for the pool, but from what I could see the kids loved the slides. When booking and using your debit card be aware that there will be a $75.00 hold on funds, this is for any incidentals. We where told upfront so there where no suprise charges. We would definitely stay again. The Red Marlin a bit over priced but the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: my4kidsMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the Hyatt for 6 nights but upon arrival immediately changed our reservations for only 2 nights. The amenities were nice, the pool and restaurant and the marina. What was disappointing were the rooms. We had a suite which appeared to be pictured as light and airy on the web site. When we arrived the room where the pull out was located was dark. I felt like we were in a motel. The lamp shade wasw flithy and the bed skirt had stains on it. The renovation was more of a makeover. They also charged 20.00 to self park which seemed ridiculous and no free wireless internet. There were pleny of parking spaces there and it was unnecessary to charge extra. We have been to many Hyatts and were very disappointed. It was not the same Hyatt quality that we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Not very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: gabbers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first weekend in May at the Hyatt with our 19 month-old toddler. We were there to visit SeaWorld and Old Town. First the things I liked about our stay. The hotel is super close to SeaWorld which gave us more time to enjoy the park. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The room was clean and nicely decorated and we were always able to find a parking spot close to our room. I didn't like that we had to pay an extra parking fee of $20 ($25 if you want to valet, plus tips). The suite itself was pricey, but having to pay more for parking was ridiculous. You also have to pay for internet access. Any cheap motel will throw in free internet access, so I don't see why the Hyatt would charge for this basic service. There was also no Disney channel. As any Mom will tell you, some sort of kids channel is a must. It comes up on the channel guide, but when you go to it it takes you to the Speed channel. Our TV didn't work properly and when the person came to fix it they said they had switched to Speed from Disney a few months back. Even he couldn't understand the logic behind this change. We'd gotten the suite hoping that we could sleep our daughter in the front living room in a crib, however we were right next to an outside corridor that had noisy pedestrain traffic until late into the night. The bedrrom itself was not noisy. It is on the flightpath for the airport, but it wasn't too disruptive. Overall, the hotel is very nice and the staff is great. I don't think it's worth the pricey per night fee especially when basic things like parking and internet access are extra.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sea World and”
Reviews.Author: nbm5b
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due its proximity to the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina (where I was attending a conference) and Sea World (where my kids would be with a family member most of the day). I am glad I chose the location. They enjoyed the pool, as well, which is heated and has 3 slides. Unfortunately, it was quite cool so they only were able to enjoy it one afternoon - just too cold and breezy! Our room was more like a 3-star hotel's in the tower; however, we had a great view of the fireworks every night from Sea World. The kids loved the smores (very expensive if you buy it from the concierge--$8 if I recall--but it was their spring break and I was working - so had to let them have some fun!). Our rate included free, wired Internet and breakfast at the Red Marlin (buffet). I was annoyed however at having to pay $20 to self park (valet was $25). In some locations I like valet - but most of the time I prefer the ability to just get my rental and go - and not have to plan to call for the car. Paying this much for parking really annoyed me, especially when it was this much for self-parking! Although the hotel's been remodeled - it is more like a 3 1/2 star hotel in my opinion. However, the room and bathroom were comfortable and clean but I didn't like the toiletries at all. Service was fine and congenial. I'd stay here again if I had a conference again at the Sheraton - and had my kids with me - or if we were in town for a Sea World trip...location in that respect was great. However, had my conference been downtown proper - I would have opted for the Omni next to the baseball stadium....I stayed there last yr for a different conference and loved the view, location, food.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good for families”
Reviews.Author: Beatledude64
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the hotel, we got a deal for only one night which came with free internet and two free breakfasts. The room was very clean, and since there are three of us, we called the front desk for a roll-away bed, but they said they don't allow roll-away beds due to fire codes. Every hotel I have stayed at has had a roll away bed, and I've seen hotel rooms that are bigger and smaller. We asked for a suite upgrade but they weren't available, so I had to sleep on the floor. I personally think they use that fire code excuse so families of three or more have to upgrade, but it doesn't work out when they are sold out of suites, but I think they should cater to families more than couples because it's very close to SeaWorld so I would think mostly families would be staying there. Anyway, the pool area was great. They had two water slides and a small one for little kids. The Red Marlin restaurant was very good but very overpriced, and it seemed like mostly everything was overpriced, but that might be for all Hyatts. Overall, it's a great place to go for rich couples, but if you have a family, I suggest another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Hyatt Mission Bay but have some reservations about recommending”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay over Spring Break (also during the Earthquake). Overall this is a decent hotel but it has flaws. Very noisy and you can hear planes taking off as of 6:30 am no matter where you are in the hotel. The staff is great and very accomodating. We were initially booked into the suites but beware they do not have any furniture on the balconies so while you have an outside space you have no where to sit. We were moved to the tower where views are great (and there is balcony furniture) but this is an old building and noticed several flaws including a shaky banister- concerning when travelling with a 8 and 9 yr old. During the earthquake the building swayed a little and given that this is an older property may have been concerned if quake had been centered in the area. Restaurant staff are great and very accomodating. Pool area was always crowded and very windy even when rest of area was calm (i.e. no wind). Rooms are nicely decorated but overall building is old and below the surface the buildings age is very evident. Would receommend to a friend but with a lot of caution.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: YShimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Spring Break with my family. Everyone loved the room size, fabulous view, pools and waterslides. The staff at this hotel was outstanding. Everyone we encountered was friendly, courteous and helpful. Room service food was delicious and as room service prices go, quite reasonable, given the freshness and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, Incredible Food”
Reviews.Author: mandlinsocal
Reviews.Content: This is an older Hyatt but it's been kept up fairly well. The room was what you'd expect from Hyatt. Clean and comfortable with all the basics you need for a good night's stay. We were high up in the tower. Room service breakfast was way overpriced for what it was but sitting on the balcony and enjoying the view was nice. The hotel's location is convenient and close to plenty of fun places and the adjacent buildings that house the restaurants have a fun island style with a great marina view. I recommend eating at the The Red Marlin. With its romantic vibe and marina views it's the perfect place for a romantic date or special occasion. As far as steaks go, the Blue Cheese Filet Mignon they serve is the best I've ever had. The Ahi is also excellent but if you're a meat eater definitely go for the Filet, the Ahi just doesn't compare. The food is so good that I make it a point to have dinner there every time I'm in San Diego - regardless of where I'm staying. The Hyatt in Mission Bay remains a reliable favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful loud, jazzy music that one cannot escape”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotripster
Reviews.Content: Not happy that they gave us a second story room just above the lobby in the two story building, overlooking the parking lot and the highway out front, when obviously the hotel wasn't anywhere near full. But my biggest complaint is the dreadful, hip, jazzy, way-too-loud music they pipe in throughout the hotel grounds. It played all day, all night, right outside our window, so loud it kept me awake (along with the valet parking guys stationed just below our room, laughing and talking). Poolside, the music was even louder, verging on totally annoying. The hotel grounds and gardens are lovely, pool is awesome, location is nice, and our room was updated and clean. Overall, a nice resort, if they would have given us a decent room and turned off that miserable music.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: MalorieL4
Reviews.Content: I love this place it had the best fresh fruit there....

Reviews.Title: “Its A Tough One To Call?”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Carlos
Reviews.Content: Although I personally don’t have any complaints about this hotel I can see why some have written average reviews. The hotel itself is decorated to a very nice standard, in fact I was so impressed when I checked in that I commented on it to the lady behind reception and she noted that it had a complete refurbishment 18 months or so ago. The room it self was very nice after all the décor was only 18 months old so we had flat screen TV’s and a sofa in the room as well as recliners and table out on the balcony which had amazing views over the bay and out over the ocean (sunsets were particularly nice). With all this in mind I kind of feel bad for adding anything negative however I have noticed from some of the reviews that people have mention: Noise – After a 6 hour drive from Las Vegas we arrived at around 11pm and were very tired and looking forward to a nights sleep. After we walked into our room we started to unwind and then realised that our room backed onto the elevator shaft and so every time someone got in the lift the noise from the mechanics would be coming through the wall. I went down and told them about it and we were promptly moved so no really complaints but I can empathise with people that have experienced this. Charges – I noticed some people complained about the charges that the hotel adds I had no need to wireless internet etc. So again I feel a little bad for mentioning it but on our first day we went to explore the hotel and found that they have some very nice gazebos that you can sit on in front of a fire by the pool area, after mentioning to the receptionist how nice they were she told us that they were available to hire by the hour, which seemed absurd. We off course just laughed it off and didn’t both but I wondered if they were going to charge for the sun loungers while we were there? Pool – And finally some people have mentioned pool noise, again I don’t really have any need to complain because we were on a high floor but the pool area gets very busy and noisy and so I can imagine if you are on a lower floor this could become disturbing. Overall this hotel was nice and the staff were very friendly and extremely accommodating however it appears that it depends on the luck of the draw. We were fortunate enough to have a high room away from the noise, however I can see how you could have a completely different experience to the one we had. If you do go for this hotel, just make sure you on a high floor and away from the lift and you will have a great stay, I’m sure

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: BigD_CA
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Monday night and were placed in a room located in a wing along the pier. The rooms were quiet and the view on the bay was very nice. We were a bit perturbed with the Internet access charge since this should be a given for any hotel these days. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were well-appointed. We stayed in a room that had a TV room and the kids ended up sleeping there so we could have some peace at night. The pool area is stunning, although our kids were let down that the slides weren't open. One small complaint is that the pool towels are more like hand towels, so it was hard to dry off. It was winter so the resort was a bit slower. The concierge was very helpful and got us tickets to LegoLand at a decent price. I don't think we paid for parking, so I'm not sure if that is a change or not, based on the other reviews I've seen. We did order room service one night and the food was very good, although as with all room service food, it was overly pricey. We did receive a $25/day credit for food, which was useful for the Red Marlin restaurant. I really liked the Check-In/Out Kiosks. They were quick and easy to use. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel as a nice place for San Diego-based activities.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Delivers Again”
Reviews.Author: Kingjohn1230
Reviews.Content: We revently celebrated our 19th wedding annivesary at the Hyatt in San Diego. We were given a room with a beautiful view of the bay and the pool area. The recent renovation of the hotel really shows. New carpet, paint and furniture (except the couch) were really enjoyable. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodated all of our requests. The only drawback was the dinner expierience at the hotels's Red Marlin restaurant. It was Valentines Day and we were expecting better food and better service. Nonetheless, we did not let our dining expierience ruin our wonderful time at the Hyatt. We are looking forward to staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, not coming back!”
Reviews.Author: travel4UOnline
Reviews.Content: Charge for wireless connection - ridiculous! - even a smal yogurt shop has free wifi Charge for parking - $20 p $25 per nite Charge for a freakn water - $4.95 per bottle --- If you use debit card, they will deduct $75 per day for incidental in your account, and will charge the money back to your account if not use after 2-3 days! Good thing tho - if you print your boarding pass at the business office is FREE We stayed for 2 nites (pre-paid) and requested the rate for an additional Sunday nite stay. ---- $204. Room is fair - cabinets are outdated...bathrooms are small and old. Water pressure is a joke! Sat nite - a lounge bar - loud. Not coming back again! rather stay in a Holiday Inn Good side tho --- view is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Great Area, Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: The_travel_junkies
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. When we first arrived we were checked in to a room that faced the street. The neighbours becide us were very loud. It was already close to midnight when we arrived and all we wanted to do was go to sleep. We dragged all of our suitcases back to the lobby and asked to be moved. We were then placed in a nice room facing in to the courtyard. It was very quiet after that. The rooms were a little more dated than I had expected from Hyatt, but all the amenities were there. The grounds more than made up for the room. The pool was amazing, the resteraunts had great food and fantastic service. The little coffee/breakfast shop by the pier was great! We took the boat over to Sea World, and there was no waiting or line ups. Our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer. We will definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect set up for us”
Reviews.Author: neik4
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our two kids, ages 12 & 9 and were in room 720 & 718 which were adjoining. 720 was over-sized with a separate alcove for the bed and a room with a couch/desk. Room 718 was a normal room with 2 queen beds and a bathroom. It was perfect for us. We all had our own space. Each room had its own balcony overlooking the pool. Unfort while we were there it was pretty cold but our kids still swam in the pool and the slides. The slides were only open 10-4 which was tight as we wanted to get going and check out the sites in San Diego. The hotel offered a "s'mores" box for $8 which was fun to do over the open fire pits they have in the courtyard area. If it had been a bit warmer, we would've spent tons more time out there. We ate one meal at the Red Marlin restaurant, which had great food and was accommodating to our picky eating kids. We also got some breakfast from the Einsteins bagel place which was packed and ran out of orange juice (not sure it was normally that crowded.) Each room had a fridge which we used to store some drinks/snacks that we bought from an outside store. The view was great - although it was a bit loud sometimes. We travel with sound machines so the kids were fine, but if they were younger and we didn't have them, the noise from the pool might be distracting. My husband used the fitness facility and thought it was fine, although it was crowded and he had to wait to use a machine. oh... and we experienced a small earthquake while in our room. the whole place wobbled a bit. It was fine, but made me look up the hotel policy on earthquakes - which they had.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a waterfront suite. This room usually goes for $300 per night, we were able to get it for $129 per night. You do pay for parking, $20 self park or $25 valet. Most California hotels charge for parking. There were also extra resort service charges...ranging from 18 cents to over $2 per day...not sure what those were for. The rooms have been recently refurbished. Average, clean. Suites are sparse. Would have been nice to have chairs on the balcony. I'd rank housekeeping as poor. Did the very least possible. Finally left a note the third day on what I wanted them to do. They still didn't do everything. Details must have gotten lost in translation. The hotel is centrally located. Easy to get around. My daughter loved the pool and jacuzzi. Parking is tight, though we noticed some spaces are definitely larger than others. Walls are thin. Two nights and days in a row the baby next to us screamed for hours upon hours. Our last night we had the baby screaming on one side of us and the tv blaring on the other side of us. I realize this is not the resorts fault. People need to be more considerate of others. I would not stay at this hotel again if I didn't get a really good rate. Disappointed for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Tammy_and_Brent
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay (Wed-Sat). We had read in Fodor's Budget Travel magazine (I think) that the Hyatt has a new program this year with random rewards such as room upgrades or ripping up your dinner bill, etc. We were upgraded from a standard room to a room with a sofa and balcony. We had pre-paid for our room at 99/night + tax. And we got a 20% off coupon for dinner at the Red Marlin, which we could use during the weeknights. We were happy with our dinner and the service was professional and friendly. We grabbed bagels from Einstein's Bagel shop in the morning. The potato bagel is a great change from your standard bagels. And for a more informal, and cheaper meal, we had dinner once at the Dana Hotel across the street one night. We'd love to stay here again and will tell friends and family about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loudest hotel I've ever stayed... it was torture!”
Reviews.Author: sunta
Reviews.Content: As I am writing this review I am sitting in my TENTH FLOOR room, listening to the blaring announcer and pounding loud music from the GROUND FLOOR at 10:30pm at night, totally unable to sleep because of the noise. This is after two days of being tortured with blaring music being piped in all throughout the hotel grounds, in the pool areas, in the cabanas, the lobbies, the hallways, and all the common areas. And not just one kind of music, but three kinds of music being played at the same time, and overlapping. Now, we return from our exhausting day out (because the hotel is so stressful and not peaceful at all, we purposely stayed out all day) to find a holiday party in the tent on the ground floor, and the DJ blaring music at a million decibles. My husband and I are both extremely exhausted and this vacation is total torture. This is #1 WORST hotel I have ever stayed at in 40 states and several European trips also. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Pools with Firepits and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingtheWorld1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed with our two young children over the Thanksgiving weekend and had a lovely time. The property is nicely maintained with pretty gardens and a great location right on the marina in San Diego Mission Bay, very near to Sea World too. 3 pools and a large jacuzzi whirlpool, all outdoors. Best feature: 3 waterslides which kids flipped for. Just be sure to inquire before booking the schedule of when the waterslides are open because they are only open when a lifeguard is on duty. A drawback is the expensive limited restaurant options on the property, but thankfully there is an Einstein's very closeby right on the marina. Quaint. Great for morning coffee. The beds were super comfy with the softest sheets as one would expect at a Hyatt. The only complaint was that our in-room coffee maker was broken and it's ridiculous that I saw a pot of coffee costs $14 from room service. Hmmm...seriously? All in all, a lovely stay and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable, very nice pool area”
Reviews.Author: Pukkel
Reviews.Content: We're a family with young children (7 and 10) and stayed here for 5 nights in the first week of June. It was somewhat of a hassle to get a good deal on this hotel, as both Hotwire and Expedia had much better deals on their web sites that the best available rates on the Hyatt site and the Hyatt phone rep was not willing to accomodate our best rate request, despite us being Hyatt members and despite their best rate guarantee. We really did want to stay here because of the pool for the kids, and a 2nd call with another Hyatt rep solved the problem. She not only matched Expedia's offer, but knocked a further 20% off that rate! With the 5th night for free, we ended paying an average of 79$ per night for a deluxe room with ocean view on the 12th floor. Try to beat that! With the favorable US$ exchange rate (for us Europeans) it was almost like staying for free. And we sure were glad to have chosen this hotel. Very nice refurbished room in the main high rise building with stunning view of Mission Bay and Pacific Ocean. Room was very clean, good quality beds. Very friendly and helpful staff. The pool area with double water slides is fantastic for kids. Our's certainly enjoyed it and we didn't hear any of the other kids around complaining. Dinner in the Red Marlin restaurant is expensive, but service and food are great and you can enjoy nice views of the bay. We got our breakfast wraps and cappucino's from Einstein Bros on the pier just outside the hotel (but it also belongs to the Hyatt), which is good quality but also expensive. Any item in the hotel store, either souvenirs or a small bag of gummy bears, is ridiculously expensive, so you might want to do some shopping on the way there if you can. Parking is also fairly expensive at 20$ a night, given the fact that there's so much space around the hotel. Be aware that night parking on the street is not allowed. Sea World is a 5 minute drive, Mission Bay 10 minutes, downtown SD 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Remodeling Claims, Floodlight Shining Into Bedroom”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: As a Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond member, I am loyal to the brand and try to stay at as many Hyatt properties as possible. That being said, I realize that a number of their hotels are in need of renovation. I take that into account when booking. The website of this particular property states "$65 million renovation completed" etc. This is absolutely not the case and, in my opinion, is false and misleading. Upon check in, we were told that the Regency Club was being "remodeled" (I guess that "completed" only referred to certain parts of the property). We were "upgraded" to a "suite" which was a room with a see through curtain divider between the "sleeping" and living areas. The "new" sofa was filthy and stained. The bathroom was so tiny that you had difficulty closing the door, the shower head was for people 5 ft 8 and under, the paint was cracked around the windows and the blinds in the "sleeping" area did not fit the windows. I could go on but it is as though they ran out of funds during the "remodel". I have placed the word sleeping in quotes because, unless you are legally blind, that will be impossible. Inexplicably the blackout shades were only in the living area. The "sleeping" area had nothing but the ill fitting blinds and it was as though the spotlights on the grounds were aimed at those windows. You could almost read at 3 am without turning the lights on. Inexcusable. I ended up moving to the stained "new" couch and barely slept three hours. In the morning the response to our complaint was an offer of an $84 room credit or about 20 percent of the amount we spent on our one night stay. A follow up email to the GM received no response. If you do stay at this place, be sure to get a bargain rate and not get one of these corner "suites". Certainly not a property that knows how to service Hyatt's best customers so I can't imagine how they treat the Priceline crowd.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Deenusser
Reviews.Content: We obtained our room via Hotwire.com for $86. per night. If you've used Hotwire before, you know that you don't find out exactly where you are staying until you pay for your room. We were pleasantly surprised after we arrived at the Hyatt with the location and the grounds. We did go ahead and pay an extra $25. per night to obtain a room in the tower. We ended up on the 15th floor over the ocean. The views are to die for. We loved the location of this hotel. We spent both days exploring Mission Beach, Mission Bay and Pacific Beach. We really enjoyed all of these areas and had a good time investigating and getting to know them. We dined at the Red Marlin restaurant which is located on the hotel grounds for dinner twice. We enjoyed both dinners. Service was good, and views are great too. Our king size bed was very comfortable with down pillows and comforter. The bathroom is pretty small, but adequate. We would go back to the Hyatt in a heartbeat. Go! You'll enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jasanders
Reviews.Content: We took a grandmother-daughter-grand daughter trip to San Diego in May, 2009, and stayed at the Hyatt Mission Bay. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, clean, family friendly, quiet rooms and the staff was friendly and very accommodating. My mother needed a wheel chair and they facilitated renting one from a local medical equipment store. The pools were well laid-out and spacious. We stayed in a room about mid-way up in the tower, facing Mission Bay. The views were breath-taking and we could clearly see the bay, and the ocean in a distance. It is easy access to and from the hotel, to the beach and local attracions. The single draw-back is that it cost $20/day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay -very central but not downtown”
Reviews.Author: ACEinSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights. The room was nice and spacious enough for a family of 4. We stayed on the 8th floor of the tower. The staff is always nice and helpful. Our stay included breakfast at the Red Marlin (on-site restaurant) which was great. Breakfast is enought to keep you until lunch and the weekdend brunch can hold you until dinner. The waterslides and heated pool were perfect for the kids and the SWIM bar/restaurant close enough to the pool so you can have a drink or a bite to eat while you watch the kids. Lifeguard on duty from 10-5. LOCATION: The Hyatt is the perfect location if you plan to go to SeaWorld. We walked with young kids and they were fine. Ask for the shortcut....You need a car to get around if you stay in Mission Bay. We thought the hotel was central and allowed us to get to La Jolla and Carlsbad without having to go through downtown traffic. The drive to downtown is easy and staff will provide maps and directions. Parking downtown was never an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: Extremely good hotel. Facilities can not be faulted. Service was very good too. Close to Seaworld - 20 minute walk. (A shame that there is no shuttle service to and from the park all year round). Takes about 20 minutes to walk to the town. No shuttle service to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was disgustingly moldy”
Reviews.Author: ElephantFriend
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel thinking the hotel's water taxi would be a great mode of transport to Sea World. Little did we know that the serivce is not available after Labor day. Worse yet, the room was so old, dirty, and the bathroom had poorly applied calk that was encrusted with mold. The heater in our room clanged so loudly the last nite that we had to turn it off to goto sleep. Upon bringing up the heater issue during checkout, the only thing the front desk worker said was we will get an engineer to look at it. That's great, but it won't do me any good. You can tell when a hotel values their guests. This will be my last visit to any hotels with the Hyatt name.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and facilities, not the best value”
Reviews.Author: Diamond_D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights as part of a conference at the hotel. My room in the tower was spacious, inviting, and clean, with a nice view and surprisingly nice balcony with chairs and table. The waterfront suite that a colleague was put in was actually not as nice. Their couches were dirty, the bathroom had no fan, and the balcony was too tiny to use. The Red Marlin restaurant is outrageously expensive, but the food was quite nice.
