If you need something to eat and don't have a car, there is a little grill type place in a fishing supply store down the marina a ways that was actually pretty good and cheap (keep going past the "fish and chips" restuarant, do no go to that one). Otherwise, head across the bay to Mission Beach and find something there (but don't trust the concierge's recommendations if you're really picky). The pools and hot tub are nice, and towels are always available. It's nice to be out of the city if you have a car, but of course they charge you $20 a day to park! Aside from pool towels, it seems like they charge you for everything they possibly can, I definitely got the "nickel and dime" feel. Would I stay here again? Sure, just wouldn't be my first choice. If you can get a good price and want to be out of the city, this is a nice place, but don't expect a 4 or 5 star luxury resort. Otherwise, you might want to stay somewhere downtown and be closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “I Moved Four Times”
Reviews.Author: WorldSeenItAll
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, the area around the hotel appears to be suffering from the economic downturn. IT's very quiet in the marina, No place to eat outside the hotel to speak of...A crappy Fish and Chips place and a sandwich place that serves the marina and an Einsteins Bagels. Hotel is OK, nice garden and fountain. Very California. First room was over the Restaurant vents that whistled, second room was a security issue and obviously had not been rented for a long time, third room triggered my allegies and was dark and noisy, finally a room on a lower floor on the pool. If I hadn't been the cause, I would have ended up in a crappy room. (and I am a gold club member. I also told them I would pay MORE MONEY for a better room but no offer was made. THe tower is fine. The poolside is updated. The other side is not, old locks, etc. The "garden units" Bayview I and II suck and construction is cheap, the units are dark. I'm happy with my location now. This place is a little shop worn, I wander why it is still a Hyatt, but then I remembered the "bombshelter" Hyatt in SFO Embarcadero! Does it sound like I travel? OOOOh yeah! Tough to go from the Electra Palace Hotel in Athens, Greece to this place the next week but it's ok. Just be in the tower on the Poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: onebrightmoon
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel...convenient location and nice amenities like spa, fitness center, etc..I was there for a conference so did not see much of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A true memory maker (one my family and i won't soon forget!)”
Reviews.Author: Franksalvador
Reviews.Content: My vacation began in LAX picking up the family at the airport (after a long flight from Vienna) Our plan was to head down to San Dieo and take in all the great attractions the city has. We could have rented a car, however that would have been a mistake. The Amtrak surfliner was definitely the right choice, 3 hours and 110.00 dollars later we were in San Diego. The kids loved the train, upgrade to business class it's worth it. After a brief taxi ride we were greeted by the very friendly and welcoming staff of the Hyatt. From check in to check out the entire staff went out of thier way to make my family and i feel comfortable and welcome. The hotel recently underwent renovation, the pool was fantastic, again just a great place for families to meet. At night we would dine at the Red Marlin and afterwards roast marshmellows in one of the two firepits. Several times during our stay we just walked over to Seaworld, it's that close. Another great option for a family is to rent a small boat and crruise around the bay. The one negative: the hotel does not have a washer dryer, you must send everything out. Lucklly we found a (coin operated) washer and dryer below the (Stayfit) work out center. Here is an example of their service "After casually mentioning to my wife that my bags might be overweight (50lbs) for the flight home, the bellman went out of his way to find a scale and weigh each bag." It was a gesture that exceeded my expectations"

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, some maitenance problems in room, but location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: tomnshar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with family for a birthday celebration. We stayed in one of the suites overlooking the marina. This is actually the 2nd time I've stayed here, and got the same room both times! The rooms are spacious and well apointed. The problems I did encounter were things like: the "pocket" doors were extremely difficult to close, they definitely needed to be replaced, the room states that is has a refrigerator,but when we attempted to use the refrigerator it did not work. Everything we put in it was warm. The maitenance dept. said that was because it was actually a "cooler" and the minute you put anything in it, it would suck the cold air out and become unusable. Okay. It was replaced by a real refrigerator within a 1/2 hour. We also encountered some problems with the air conditioning system but another call to the maitenance dept. fixed that. The other thing that was kind of annoying was that instead of the usual policy about towels, you know, they won't replace them unless you put them on the floor, etc. Well, here they will not replace them unless you call down to the front desk and request that they be replaced. It's kind of in fine print so you don't really realize this until your dirty towel that you put on the floor is placed back on the hook for you to use again! I will say that they were extremely responsive to all of our concerns, and took care of everything immediately. The location is the best in San Diego. We went everywhere and it was all within 10 to 15 minutes. Downtown, Old Town, Point Loma, Pacific Beach, etc. I'm looking forward to my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - not near anything but really nice pool.”
Reviews.Author: audrey2580
Reviews.Content: Pros: great pool, on the water, refurbed rooms Cons: over charged me multiple times for breakfast, front desk leaves much to be desired, not anywhere near downtown

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: PogleSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel 4 hours ahead of our check in time and our room wasn't ready, so the receptionist took a mobile number she would try to hurry up the room and notify us when it was ready. We went and had some lunch, then went back a little while later. The room still wasn't ready, so she upgraded us to a suite. We were celebrating out anniversary on the trip, so she arranged for a bottle of champagne to be sent to our room. All the staff were freindly and helpful and the room was wonderful. There are three pools, cabanas (for hire) and fire pits lit at night, where people were toasting marshmallos and making smores. The location is great, walking distance to Sea World and fifteen minutes drive to downtown San Diego and the zoo. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service, Nice Suite and Great Pool for Young Children”
Reviews.Author: outandaboutwithkids
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband and 2 young children, ages 1 and 4. My husband says that the customer service at this hotel was better than he has ever experienced - and he travels around the U.S. frequently for business. He was there for a 3 day conference, with us joining him on his last day. They upgraded him for 2 nights to a suite to accommodate me and our 2 kids. Truly terrific customer service. The front desk and concierge staff were courteous, professional and kind. Our 4 year old loved the pool with 3 water slides. It is also 2 minutes drive from Sea World. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “waterslides at pool were great for kids”
Reviews.Author: travelain
Reviews.Content: Many of the rooms have connecting balconies. With young children, this was a concern for us. Loved the pool. Good location. Wow...has mission beach changed for the better!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure where all the money for upgrades went? Maybe the pool area?”
Reviews.Author: jetlady
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Priceline- I will never use Priceline again, booked a room for 4 people and they reserved a room with one king size bed, but Thanks to the hotel and a lot of phone calls we were able to get a room with two Queen beds. But that is where it ended. Everyday we had to ask for towels and wash clothes. Toilet clogged everyday had to call maintainence. Refridgerator did not work, they had to work on that. TV reception poor at best, wanted to watch Monday night football, bought a six pack of beer only to find out the only place I could watch the game was in the swim bar- needless to say they didn't like me bringing my own beer. Not sure where the heated pools are located? The hot tub was hot and refreshing, but the pool was to cold to get into. Furniture on the balcony was stained. Red Marlin restaurants apparently has menus for marina or returning guests that we did not get to see. The positives- the guys getting us cabs were always friendly and gave us plenty of good tips on where to go or not go. The pool and cabana areas are really nice, clean and resort looking. We were charged $20 a night for parking but we did not have a car, they removed it from the bill with no problems. Found all staff we came in contact with were friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Uncontrolled party on the floor kept us awake all night”
Reviews.Author: worksalot7
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have been better were it not for the all night drunken party that occurred on our floor. Every 20 minutes a door would slam and loud voices would be outside our door in the hall - all night long! Several calls were made between our two rooms to security to no avail. The hotel did ultimately comp the rooms for that night but the experience really put a damper on what should have been an enjoyable family vacation. The hotel was very expensive and allowing such a ruckus to go on all night was a big disappointment. The positives of this hotel was the pool and pool service. The kids loved the two water slides and the poolside food service was a redeeming quality. The on-site restaurant was expensive but convenient. There are no good alternatives for dinner unless you have a car - there are no other restaurants worth going to close by. The other big positive of this hotel is that it is within walking distance to Seaworld. A pedestrian path will take you all the way and it is about a 10-15 minute walk. There is also a water taxi available if you buy your Seaworld passes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected from a high priced Hyatt hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgettraveler8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Mission Bay and were very disappointed in the quality of the room, including upkeep. We payed quite a lot for the room and it was not worth the money at all. We have stayed at many Hyatts in the past and this was the first time we were confronted with blinds with slats missing (so the room was well lit all night), the smell of cleaning fluid (and/or possibly bug spray), and very visible stains on the furniture. There were no screens on any of the windows or doors, and some flying insects did join us as a result. There was a sign near the fridge stating that there were 2 bottles of water in the fridge (such was not the case) and that if we used them there would be a charge of $4.99 each. Pretty pricey indeed. The first two rooms we were given had the definite feel of a budget motel and smelled terrible, and after complaining to the manager, we were given a different room. The third, while the best of the three, still would not be considered anywhere close to luxurious. The hotel is located near a busy street, so if you leave your windows open, it is noisy. Internet is not included in the room rate - which, given the room rate - is completely unacceptable. The room was a good size. As mentioned, we tried 3 rooms and, while the third had the mildest version, all had the same smell and ALL had stained furniture. Views were nice. We were not on the executive floor, so perhaps that is better. I note that some of the good reviews for this hotel were by people who stayed on the Regency floor. We chose to not eat at the hotel, and did not really use many of the amenities, so we cannot comment on that aspect. Again, for the price, it was terrible. Just not at all what I would expect from a very high priced Hyatt. I would not stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to friends. I am sure you can find a better deal out there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our recent stay”
Reviews.Author: dannysmom
Reviews.Content: We had a small family gathering over the Labor Day weekend at the Hyatt and it was very enjoyable. We had two rooms on the Regency Club level and two rooms on a lower floor. I would recommend the Club level if only because the views are amazing and the noise from the pool isn't so intrusive. The hotel was packed for the holiday weekend and the pool area was insane on Saturday and Sunday, but the hotel had extra security and the kids didn't mind the crowds at all. Our rooms were clean and very comfortable and the hotel staff was very accomodating. I should mention our issues: we had no paper or pen to jot down a note, no bathrobes as in other rooms, and no "do not disturb" sign for our door. Parking is a big issue. A large parking lot on the far side of the hotel has been taken over by a tent. As an earlier reviewer mentioned, if you get back to the hotel after a certain period, there is no self parking available and you must use the valet. We had an amazing dinner at the Red Marlin when we ordered off the menu. Try the seared sea scallops. Most other nights we had the buffet dinner which had enough selection for everyone in our group. There is a wild mushroom sauce that should be bottled! Our only problem is that it would be nice to have more of a restaurant selection.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation site!”
Reviews.Author: vparize
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before I booked this hotel. A few of them made me a little nervous, but our experience was wonderful!! It was a great location. We loved the taxi-boat and private entrance to SeaWorld. It was so close to Belmont Park and multiple beaches. We got a great deal on an ocean-front suite. The view was great. The balcony was small, but we were able to sit out there and watch sea lions catching fish. Very fun for all of us! I had read that the pool was small, cold, and windy. That was not our experience. Because we went mid-week and stayed when some school districts had already gone back to school, the pool area was not crowed at all. The pools (three of them) were a great temperature (and I don't like cold!) They were great for children of all swimming levels and the slides are a lot of fun! We got lucky with the wind, too. No problem. We also had no problems with noise levels (it was quiet by the suites) or airplanes overhead (only a few and no big deal). We ordered pizza for the kids one night and my husband and I opted for the room service. Room service is always pricey, but the food was really good! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to check-in early and they even gave us a courtesy late check-out! Great over-all experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice location: be prepared to be nickled and dimed for everything”
Reviews.Author: shilpiandken
Reviews.Content: We switched hotels (see my review of the Catamaran Resort Hotel) since my husband and son had trouble sleeping in the terribly uncomfortable rooms at the Catamaran. The Hyatt is standard and we wanted to be near Seaworld and the beaches so we stayed here for most of our trip. What we liked: 1. The rooms (standard Hyatt, clean, quiet rooms with central temp control and cotton sheets and comfy beds) 2. The location 3. The slide pool for kids What we didn't like: 1. Expensive, mostly unavailable parking ($20 per day: we'd be back at the hotel by 8.00 pm and the parking lot was full) 2. Expensive meals (The breakfast buffet is $20 pp for a very simple buffet - we had a coupon as a part of our package so it didn't hurt as much) 3. The noisy lobby (great for young couples or teenagers: if you want to get away, this is not your hotel - be prepared for loud music) 4. The water drains very slowly from the tub so be prepared to stand in disgusting bath water while you're showering (this seems to be a problem with all Hyatts though) 5. No free internet: I mean, c'mon!!! But overall, since the rooms were nice and we had a good time at the pool in the evening after we came back from the beach, it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Sad that this great hotel hires "just anyone".”
Reviews.Author: swanygirl21
Reviews.Content: We've staying at Hyatt's before,,there lovely and usually sell themselves...but our last stay,,,while sleeping,,another family barged into our room,,in the middle of the night. (double booked??) no idea how this could happen... A call the the hotel manager,,Brandon?? never even gave a call back. The rest of our stay,,we took our passports, jewlery,,,,where ever we went due to the fact we felt our security for personal property was lost. Quit honestly I was more upset that our situation was never even addressed,,until 2 wks after our stay....not while we were there...ON VACATION. Hyatt,,,maybe sould screen their employee's a bit better....maybe stopping ~> "double booking", "lack of good customer service"..and the time it took for me to share my story.

Reviews.Title: “Kids will love it”
Reviews.Author: 3BoysTraveling
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at this hotel with our three boys 4, 3, 1. They all loved it which means we loved it. The reviews were all true to a point but we will definitely be going back. When we arrived my wife said this is not a four star place. We've stayed at a few Ritz Carleton's, Hilton's, and a few four and five star places in Cancun so that is our reference point. By the end of the trip she said the place won her over so if you are willing to accept a few faults and you have kids, go. If you are a couple, I don't recommend it. Arrival: The lobby area is kind of blah with a newer feel. The reps behind the desk were nice as long as you were. I noticed a couple next to us having difficulty, being Irate and getting attitude back... normally I would expect more patience from the staff. But for me, I asked FOR A ROOM FACING SEA WORLD IN THE TOWER. This is a must. Reading the other reviews it seems like people hated the low rise buildings (Bay I & II). From our Balcony, (room 1603) you could easily see the fireworks at Sea World each night. I got the room and was pleased. Room was clean and well laid out. We fit two cribs in nicely into the room and never felt squeezed in. The halls were clean, the elevators although a little slow always worked well and we never heard them from our room. We never had the room cleaned, we were there for three days and just asked for new towels and shampoo which they gladly gave to us. Parking is a Rip and the spaces in the east lot are tiny. Go to the west lot (other side of the hotel) and the spaces are much larger. We normally ate at a restaurant on Sports Arena Blvd... There were many there... In & Out; Papa Johns, Chile's, Olive Garden, and all the fast food joints. On the other side of the bay just across the bridge is a great park with a bay beach. Good sand for sandcastles with minimal waves. If you like the waves, a few hundred feet down the same road (w. mission bay rd) and you hit the Pacific Ocean. Kids stuff... Our four year old loved all the water slides (you have to be at least 42"). Our three year old loved the kiddie slide and out non walking toddler loved the slanted beach like pool where he could crawl down. For some reason the kiddie slide pool was colder than all the other pools, couldn't figure this one out. Each night you can roast marshmallows and make smores by the fire. They also had movies or other activities for kids through the day. Like I said, very kid friendly. The Water taxi is awesome. The tickets at the concierge are $3.00 per person but you can go and come back from SeaWorld as often as you like. Next time we go our plan is to go in the morning, come back for lunch and pool time, then go back in the evening for the night shows and fireworks. The breakfast if you have it included is ok. Definitely not one of those Vegas ones but enough to where you will have a decent breakfast if you can get it included. All in all, if our kids had a bad time, I would be negative about the amount of money we paid for the hotel but the smiles on their faces makes the money we paid seem less important.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Unwind”
Reviews.Author: SouthernTrvlr
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulously landscaped and has wonderful views. Your kids will love it! I don't have kids, and I enjoyed the fact that the kids that I saw were having a great time. We had a room on a top floor and the views towards La Jolla were beautiful. There is a constant stream of watercraft coming in and going out of the Mission Bay. We saw seals playing in the water. (my friend saw a dolphin, but I didn't) I was still on East coast time and woke up early for the 3 days we were there and loved walking down the causeway. There is a small but well appointed fitness center that has a great view of the marina. There is an Einstein's Bagel shop (and provision store) above the marina that is a great place to sit and read. There is a ramp there down to the docks where you can rent equipment or just see the seals and folks getting ready to go fishing for the day. The hotel is busy, with weddings in the garden area each day we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Rule!”
Reviews.Author: Helene W
Reviews.Content: Rooms in the Tower building are spacious and beautiful. There was plenty of room for our king size bed, our 7 year old's high end rollaway (complimentary), a sofa, and chairs. The bathroom is very nice but only had a shower (no tub). We had a breakfast package and the buffet was good but modest (no omelette station or waffles made to order). We overlooked the pool which is open until 11 pm and could be noisy. The otherside of the building views the Seaworld fireworks which you could also see from the parking lot. This hotel is made for children of all ages. There are 2 substantial water slides for kids 42" and taller and a small one for the shorter set. My daughter must have gone the waterslide over 50 times in our 3 day stay and loved it every time. There are barely 100 chairs by the pool and many are wooden without cushions, certainly not enough when the hotel was full. The hotel is on the bay and it was very windy while we were there resulting in a hot tub full of children and toddlers (some eating their $5 snowcones that they sell at the pool...snowcones in a hot tub..really parents). The hotel also had a water taxi to Seaworld ($3 roundtrip for adults and children 3 and up) which ran once an hour and left you at a private entrance and you walked right in. The hotel was in a better location than we thought from looking at the map and was 3 minutes to Mission Beach, 10 minutes to Old Town (for Mexican), 15 minutes to the zoo and downtown (and the airport) and 25 minutes to Coronado (beautiful beach town) and La Jolla (had dinner outside at George's over looking the sunset on the beach...great food, reasonably priced upstairs and they will make kid friendly food although they do not have a kid menu). It is true that the parking spaces are narrow, you can hear planes taking off and landing, the music outside the pool could be loud at night and the fact that this upgraded hotel did not go wireless resulting in a $10/day internet charge was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for family with children or a romatic stay”
Reviews.Author: BradfordB
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I were very very impressed with the Hyatt. This hotel has evolved over the years, now fully remodeled,it is top drawer, no remnants of the 70' or 80 old "Islandia" days. This property features two huge water slides for children, 1 small for the very young..even a small campfire at night near the pool for roasting marsh mellows. I am a Certified Meeting Professional by trade....so, if you want higer end and the budget, and the kids (or no kids), it would be hard to to beat this venue for over all service, food & beverage, accommodations - all fresh, clean and operational. Keep an eye on the electronic card keys though..I had to get help 4 times maybe just my luck.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly....very noisy”
Reviews.Author: thepoloman33
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay in the VIP suites at the Hyatt Mission Bay. The suites overlook the marina and provide a nice view. There was ample room for my wife and I and our 2 daughters ages 5 and 1. The grounds are very nice and the staff was helpful. The pool area was fantastic (even though we hit a foggy week) with the water slides being very popular. Seaworld is right next door and the hotel offers a water taxi to the back entrance of the park. They also offered discounts to the two parks we visited: Seaworld and the San Diego Zoo. The fitness center looked brand new and I was impressed with what it had to offer....that covers the pros... We did not realize that this hotel falls right in line with the take off path of the San Diego airport. So each and every airplane taking off can be heard...and it's loud. Anyone attempting to nap during the day should bring ear plugs. Fortunately, the take-offs seem to die off around 10pm and start up around 6am. The rooms are by no means quiet. For whatever reason, the hallway outside the VIP suites has tile flooring so any rolling suit cases or carts for room service meals can be heard barreling down the hall. This could easily be corrected by carpeting over the tile. Also, the walls are thin so unless you are hearing impaired, you'll hear every door shut and every toilet flush. San Diego is a nice area and we may visit again, but we won't stay at the Hyatt Mission Bay. It's just too loud.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT PLACE-NEEDS A LITTLE WORK”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: This property just underwent a multi million dollar facelift. I booked a VIP Suite for 6 days with my 3 kids. Room was fairly nice, but not out of this world. I would expect a pull out couch for a suite of this size. View was AMAZING of entire bay. Rooms nicely decorated. If you plan on room service, you need to make sure you check their schedule...they are NOT a 24 hour room service facility. Food was just ok. Red Marlin restaurant on property quite good. Pool was stated as "heated" but could use an little increase in the temp as it was a bit nippy still and very crowded. Good place for families, but if you are looking for a romantic getaway look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another place to stay in Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Hyatt. We are locals, had stayed here a couple years back prior to the renovations and wanted to see how the new improvements looked. For those of you considering this hotel, I would recommend you look elsewhere Upon arrival we were given a room in the Bayfront II building, close to the pool. Upon entering the room, we were struck with a very strong odor coming from the bathroom. My husband said it smelled like a men’s room. A very dirty men’s room. I tried a couple of different room sprays, and even bought some scented oils and candles. When nothing worked, I went to speak with someone at the front desk who promised to send housekeeping out right away. After waiting for some time, attempting to air out the room, we finally got tired of waiting and went to dinner, hoping that it would be cleaned when we returned. If anything, the smell was stronger when we got back. There is no way that someone responsible for cleaning that room wouldn’t have noticed the stench. Finally the next day I complained again to the front desk and asked to be moved. When we were eventually moved, we did get a nice room in the tower. A few days after our return I sent a message to management and have yet to receive a response. Aside from the ridiculous $20 daily self-parking fee, the hotel really gouges you. There is a charge for poolside activities that other resorts offer for free. The hotel towels are tiny and limited – we had two of each, when there were three of us that checked in. The bath mat was miniscule and not thick enough to sop up the water that seeped out of the shower, and the couch in the room smelled of body odor. On the surface, it’s a very attractive resort. The grounds are pretty, the restaurant has a beautiful view, and there are some fun cabanas outside of the pool area next to some fire pits. However, the seats in the cabanas are all stained and smelly, the restaurant food was marginal (the kids buffet was almost inedible), service was non-existent and for some reason the outdoor speakers continued to play music very late into the night making it hard to sleep. Dining choices? Forget about it. The poolside menu is not at all geared to kids, even thought the pool, with the 3 water slides, is meant to be a family environment. And if you are looking for a late lunch, you’ll have to leave the grounds. The bagel shop stops serving lunch very early (it’s also quite a distance from the hotel lobby area) and the restaurant does not offer lunch items past the usual lunch hour. On top of everything else, this location is constantly windy. It was so cold that we ended up leaving the pool after about an hour. Next time, we’ll stay at the Mission Bay Hilton nearby instead. Better location, friendly service, clean rooms, a relaxing ambience and the food choices were far better too. All for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Likely my last time staying”
Reviews.Author: googlymoogly014
Reviews.Content: My family travels to San Diego regularly to visit family. My sister had her wedding at this Hyatt two years ago, and we were all surprised to arrive in the middle of the renovations. We took the kids to the resort across the street to swim, the restaurant was gone, our room had JUST been readied and had no fridge. Some wedding guests in the tower had to go to other floors to showers. Skip ahead two years...I take my children out to visit with family. I had booked a room through the website, which I subsequently determined was NONREFUNDABLE, mistake on my part. I had reserved a 2 Queen room. When we checked in, we were assigned a room in the Bay II building. I have stayed at this hotel probably five times and didn't even know it was there. When we checked in, there was no balcony or patio. Again, I didn't even think they had rooms like that! When I went to the front desk to inquire, I was told that was a STANDARD Queen/Queen room. The rooms below me, with patios, were all King rooms (sure, makes perfect sense, give more space to the parties with fewer guests!). A dirty swim diaper was still in the trash can--my kids are 7 & 9, so it did NOT belong to me! I had forgotten the ridiculous charges for parking. "Self-parking" of $20/day was more than my subsequent stay at the Hyatt Orange County's VALET parking. The pool at the Hyatt Mission Bay was extremely crowded, and in the spa, I met some people who were locals and just mooching off the hotel for the afternoon. Then I was awakened at 4:45 by a drunk guest downstairs arguing with someone on her cell phone. After half an hour, I finally went out of the room, down the stairs and around to her patio to ask her to quiet down. (If I had had a balcony, I wouldn't have had to leave my room!) Almost immediately upon returning to my room the birds started making noise--this is a Polynesian style building with an open roof, and bird feathers litter the hallway, as they sit there in the morning and caw! We were busy with other activities, so ultimately I didn't spend a lot of time in my room. However, I had a bad taste in my mouth from check-in on, so I chose not to eat at the hotel & give them as few of my vacation dollars as possible. I did buy Sea World tickets from them, so we could take the water taxi/shuttle service, but the wording on the website made it seem as if it was a complimentary service if you bought the tickets from them; however, it was an additional $5 per adult (children free). I was charged for water I didn't drink upon reviewing my bill (we had bought the same bottles they provide at the hotel, so someone got confused by the fact there were FOUR bottles in the Fridge instead of two empty ones?) . There were many more negatives than positives with this stay, so next time we head to San Diego, I will be staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hillstfr
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The hotel was excellent and the location seemed perfect. The only downside I would say was that the maid service was a little off. We had one day when the room wasn't turned when we went out for the day. We called down and it was turned quickly. Other than that the hotel was great, the restaurant was lovely and the location was perfect. I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “SCARRED FOR LIFE”
Reviews.Author: DinoOC
Reviews.Content: Our suite room got broken into! MANY valuable things got stolen such as a Louis Vuitton purse, wallet containing all the goodies such as credit and debit card, car and house keys, and very valuable journal! Security and the Managers were dissapponting as they did not keep their words and were not prompt in handling the situation. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: pursuitofluxury
Reviews.Content: Carpet dirty, curtains dirty, management has zero concern for customer satisfaction. Hotel is so overpriced, no where near a four star hotel, or a Hyatt brand for that matter. Prices at the restaurant are outrageous. Location is great, but there are other much nicer hotels/ better amenities in the immediate area. Avoid this hotel, unless you get an absolutely great price $140 or less.

Reviews.Title: “Give me a break and sub-standard parking.”
Reviews.Author: GasPumper
Reviews.Content: Hotel, rooms and location was fine. Toward the back of the parking lot they have squeezed every inch of parking space so that most mid-size cars cannot easily fit. What happens is that people start taking two spaces and riding over the lines and it creates a situation where people park right on top of others. Lighten up Hyatt and create a few less spaces. $20.00 extra dollars a night and cramed in like fish in a pan makes you look alittle desperate and create some angry parkers. Thanks for the paint chips numb nuts. Also, I like my staff with a little less San Diego attitude. The gay waiter and the Red Marlin was great but most of the staff was either hung over or pissy. All in all we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Angie55
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby (1 year) and I stayed here for two nights in July. We were given a gorgeous over sized room by surprise - and the room had not been made up when we entered. The staff member who was with us showing us the room made a call downstairs, and we were then taken to the room directly across the hall which was even better. It had gorgeous views of the bay, a separate bedroom - it was wonderful. I had no complaints about the room, but my husband was upset that the refrigerator did not get very cold. We needed to keep the baby's milk cold, so the maintenance staff brought up another fridge for us to use that was much colder. The bathroom sink's drain was a bit clogged, and the maintenance had it working in less than two minutes... These things irritated my husband, but were not a big deal to me because they were taken care of IMMEDIATELY upon request. The hotel pools were wonderful - not too crowded. They were a bit cool, but that was nice during the warm days. The hotel grounds were amazing - SUCH a wonderful hotel, especially for the price. I would LOVE to stay here again. If ever we are back in the area, this will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: jammbrown1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights July 13-17. We had a great time. We had a tower room with a view of the bay. (The opposite side of the pool) It was great we watched the fire works from Sea World on our balcony and did not have the hot afternoon sun. We ate breakfasts at the Red Marlin and it was delicous. I recommend the buffet. What a great way to start the day. The service was great. Pool was good as was the slides for the kids. There is a little fish place right down from the hotel we walked to which was excellent. Luckily we waited for a table outside as the inside leaves some to be desired. So go early! We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MOdon69478
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived, I had asked to stay in the Tower (based on previous reviews read here) as they were the most recently renovated rooms. I was told all the rooms had been renovated and that at the price I had, I could only have a room in either Bay I or Bay II. When I got to the room they assigned me, I found that it smelled very musty and there was mold on the bathroom tub. I advised the front desk of my displeasure and they gave me a room in the Tower. While this room was surely an improvement, it had a broken toilet that took their maintenance staff (2) days to fix. Aside from the above, the hotel itself is not laid out in a very efficient manner. The on-site restaurant is way over priced, compared to other restaurants in the area. If the weather and beach weren't so beautiful, this hotel would have definitely ruined by trip.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a family oriented hotel - probably not the place for a romantic getaway especially at this price point”
Reviews.Author: regular_traveller13
Reviews.Content: While it is strangely not clear from the hotel's website or from the Tripadvisor scores, this struck me as a very family oriented hotel - which makes sense, given it's proximity to Sea World. I just wasn't prepared for the full-on day-care kids camp that I encountered. If I did have children, I might choose this place, but have no idea how I'd afford it with kids. My partner and I arrived to find a diaper-smelling crib in our room. I called room service to have it removed, but gave up after 5+ minutes on hold. To be fair this was 4th of July weekend and the place was inundated. The bulk of the hotel services/programs seem to be directed at families. There are so many kid-directed activities I think this place should be called the "Hyatt Mission to Cater to Kids Bay". I have nothing against children, just would've liked a few more things that catered to adults - especially when paying these kind of room rates. But I guess technically a "kids camp" is something that caters to certain adults . . . parents. One other thing that I'll mention is that this hotel is not really near a "beach". Despite the "beach icon" that hotwire and some other vendors display. It is definitely on the ocean, but there is no swimming beach, It is smack in the middle of a marina. I thought we might be able to get away from the hotel pool and check out a real ocean beach, but that is not possible given the boat traffic and the fact that there is no sandy entry into the ocean. That said, there is a very good bargain to be had in the $5 round trip per person water taxi to sea world. This puts you right into the middle of the park and runs every hour and twice hourly on weekends. Red Marlin was a nice restaurant in a beautiful location - but you'll likely not have the wallet for eating there nightly. Room service was very expensive - $19 for French Toast. The bagel/coffee shop is a great option but note that it closes at 2pm. Just continue to walk another block or so away from the hotel and you'll encounter a couple of small hamburger/hot dog joints and a fresh seafood restaurant that are extremely reasonable and cater to folks in the Marina. Other than Sea World and the marina businesses (boat/jet-ski rentals and fishing charters) there is not very much nearby and the $20 day parking is steep. Overall this is a very beautiful property just consider the location carefully (getting to downtown or gaslight district is a haul) and make sure you can handle the heavy kid factor. I have nothing against kids - I just was expecting a bit more of a romantic setting, not sharing the hot tub at 10:30pm at night with a bunch of teenagers drinking beer and throwing foam in each others faces. I guess I also assumed the $239 nightly rate I paid (Hotwire) would keep most of the families priced out - but I assume they must've found some cheaper rate or just are not feeling this recession like the rest of us. The soundproofing in the rooms (I was in one of the "Bay" buildings) is also pretty much non-existent - noise carries quite a bit and Hyatt is playing loud music at the pool bar and some kind of club music all along the walkways, with speakers perhaps only 8 feet from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnoot
Reviews.Content: Expected a lot more from on waterfront marina suite. The room was noisy from the airport, annoying seagulls, and loud parking lot. Did not sleep a wink. Low quality carpet and furniture. I can't even believe this hotel is rated 4 stars. Terrible terrible experience. Red Marlin was overpriced for the quality. Will never go back. The only thing my son liked was the water slides.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice property”
Reviews.Author: tlf82lab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights while visiting San Diego. Our room was very spacious with a bay view. The pool area was fantastic and it was also nice to have a bagel/coffee shop on the property, although it was pretty pricey. We were very happy with our decision to stay at the Hyatt due to its central location to everything. We were able to go to La Jolla for dinner and were really close to Mission/Pacific Beach as well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: kellytherascal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay in San Diego while visiting Southern California. We only stayed one night, but enjoyed the stay. The positives of the hotel include the location. It has beautiful views, and is close to seaworld, which is where we spent most of our time in San Diego. The pool area is stunning. There are several pools, and lots of loungers to lay out and enjoy the beautiful Southern California weather. The room itself was well decorated, and I loved the front patio. We sat and ate our ordered breakfast and enjoyed relaxing. The bed was very comfy, and it was roomy with a couch. The downsides are that there is no breakfast included, and the front room where we stayed looked right over a huge line of taxis that were sitting waiting for business so it was a bit noisy. If you got a room on the side or back, instead of the front busy road it would be a lot more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lasvegasmama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and in a great location for Seaworld. I was disappointed when I checked in and found out I wasn't eligable for a Tower room, because I went through Hotwire. But Hotwire doesn't tell you when you book the room though them that you won't get the tower room. Our room was facing a parking lot, and part of the marina. The hotel was quite and clean, great pools for the kids. The bagel shop was convenient for breakfast, but the rest. on premises is rather expensive, and to eat in another place you need a car, because the hotel is somewhat isolated from anything else. the hotel staff was corgel, but not aggressively helpful. Overall its a great place to stay if you are going to the amusement parks in the area, with small children, but bring snacks!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, "shifty" service”
Reviews.Author: 610vacation
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times throughout their renovation period. I have also stayed there since. Every time I check in, they try to give me one of their "crappy" rooms in the building separated from the main tower. These rooms are not so nice (and were not renovated). I will be staying there again in two weeks, can't wait to see what they try to give me this time. I always have to push them for a decent room. Oh, did I mention that I am a Hyatt Platinum member ? So much for their interest in THAT program. Other Hyatts are much more eager to please, these desk employees don't really care too much about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiGe
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, we stayed in the suites section overlooking the marina. It's not really near anything other than Sea World, it's pretty private. Beautiful grounds, very good service, we found the front desk and conceirge to be very helpful. It's a very nice hotel overlooking the bay and being away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MAMA_TRAVELER9
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a memorial weekend trip (may 2009) to this hotel. If you stay in the tower you will have a good experience. Unfortunately they gave us the two-story "Bay" buildings. My room with 2 queen beds was very small. They give me 3 towels for all 3 days I stay here! The worst part is that my room faces the pool and has 2 large speakers in front of it. All the rooms in the "bay" building has speakers surrounding them. We can't sleep at night because the hotel blasts music through these speakers. When I complained to the hotel, they said they will turn it down but never did. The pool is nice but they put too much clorine in it one morning. My kids' eyes turned bright red and all our bathing suits were BLEACHED! The best part about this hotel is its location to Sea World. The Red Marlin restaruant is good but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation, great Hyatt by the water, but $24 cab ride to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Others_on_Lost
Reviews.Content: Great renovation: room was elegantly furnished, modern. Floor to ceiling window separated room from balcony. I was on 11th floor overlooking marina. Bathroom was spotless and modern, with thoughtful touches like a soapdish with slots to drain the water, but with a bowl to collect the drained water. You could hear the sea lions on the barge from the room. The downstairs pool area and cabana area is full of palm trees and other great landscaping. The service staff was very nice; he let me check in early (10 am on a Sunday morning). The downside is the $24 (including tip) cab ride to the convention center; be prepared to pay that, or share cabs, or take public transportation (the #9 bus on the main road outside the hotel takes you to the Old Town transit center, from where you can take the trolley to downtown).

Reviews.Title: “Great sevice, nice views”
Reviews.Author: pepsipeople
Reviews.Content: We got a great price through Hotwire and then upgraded to a marina view. We were able to view the fireworks from Seaworld, which the kids enjoyed. Staff very helpful and polite. The pool is nice with the waterslides for the kids and poolside service for the adults. Beds were very comfy and lots ammenities provide, big soft towlels. Nice sized fridge. The wi-fi connection was horrible with bad speed even after a service call by a very prompt maintence guy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Plan, Can the Noise”
Reviews.Author: danielbeez
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the great Priceline rate of $63 a night. A steal, really. It's a nice hotel. The staff was decent, not great. The pool area is very nice. The grounds are well-kept. There is a pricey restaurant, but also an Einstein Bros (with limited hours) on the grounds. You have to walk outside to get anywhere, including the gym (which is small but nice, but has a yucky locker room), which isn't so pleasant when it's chilly. Overall, I'd give this hotel 5 stars, but for the fact that they insist on piping in loud music to the pool area, which you have to listen to if you sit by the pool, if you're just walking to your room in the tower, or eating at the poolside cafe (open on weekends this time of year). In a world of ubiquitous Ipods, why the noise pollution? If I want to listen to loud music, I can bring my own, thanks! (BTW, I had a room overlooking the pool, the windows were great--I couldn't hear the loud music at all from inside the room). One more hotel quirk: no coffee maker in the room. I'm not a coffee drinker, but this may bother some people, you have to walk to Einstein Bros and pay $4 instead.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: originalvalleygirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I live in L.A. area, wanted to visit San Diego. Found a good deal on a four night stay. I have to say "wow": loved the room, the service, the views. The room service meals were awesome altho limited menu. The view of the marina, bay and ocean was beautiful day and night. The entire staff we dealt with was helpful, friendly, enthusiastic. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start but overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: mamabearSouthBay_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother in law, children (5 and 3) and I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. Because of the ages of the children our connecting rooms were "confirmed" by the hotel prior to arrival. But when we checked in no connecting rooms on the club levels (well worth it by the way) were available. After talking to managment about the problem and agreeing to stay in non-connecting rooms for 1 night, they moved us to 2 beautiful corner connecting rooms with gorgeous views of the marina and Sea World fireworks. They also lowered our room rates for the entire stay. Overall the rooms were clean and spacious. Almost all rooms have views... but if you have children request a room on the marina side so you can enjoy views of the fireworks at Sea World. The pools and the firepit were a hit with many children. My daughter loved the water slides and roasting marshmellows over the firepit. The restaurant Red Marlin far exceeded my expectation! Final thought, if price is not an issue, you should book a room with club room access. It's well worth it and the staff (especially Joyce) is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues”
Reviews.Author: EuroDiva
Reviews.Content: PROS: Nice, spacious clean rooms. Nice view of harbor from Tower. Large bathroom sink. Comfortable beds. CONS: Expensive add-ons (internet, newspaper), slow internet, indifferent front desk and gift shop personnel, location not convenient for dining, shopping. Wish I stayed elsewhere. It wasn't worth $180 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but in the sticks!”
Reviews.Author: Skytrucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our concluding tour of California. On arrival at 16.00 the room was not ready but was not too much of an issue as we only had to wait 20-30 minutes. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and the room clean, spacious with a wonderful view of mission bay from our balcony.Beautiful sunsets in the evening. The elevator / lift was like a theme park ride at universal studios! We got to our level 5 room within seconds. Ok for guests wanting to just remain within the hotel grounds and enjoy the good hotel pool / bar / restaurant but will need to hire a car to explore the 'Pacific beach' and downtown areas. We did take advantage of the local bus service. A one way ticket $2.25 or a day pass can be purchased for $5.00 per person. Note. No change given by driver. Sea World is located within walking distance ( 10mins), the zoo is 20 mins by car.

Reviews.Title: “Regency Club is more like Day Care for kids!”
Reviews.Author: AussieAmerican
Reviews.Content: Dates 13-14 April, My Huband and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Mission Beach and were very surprised indeed at the incredible Balcony View and helpfull Bell Man, Steve! He went out of his way to help us get everything we wanted. . We have College kids of our own, that were not with us and dont mind Children but we think that the hotel needs to reconsider its allocation of rooms on the Regency Club Floors. We were on floor 16, and the 16 & 17 are Regency Club floors. We had a heard of Elephant like Children above us who seemed to rearrage furniture until midnight! I cant understand how parents can let the kids be like this but when we saw the amount of unsupervised kids in the Club Room / hot tubs etc we could understand all the noise. And also the hot tub was a lovely shade of green with snotty nosed kids in it. YUK! Suggestion to Hyatt. Have adults only on floor 17 and Adults and kids on floor 16, as when you pay extra for Regency you expect peace, not being kept up by loud banging above! We did complain but it still continued on until midnight and resumed at 5am. Not very relaxing for us, and we have stayed religiuously with Hyatts and enjoy the upgrade option. We prefer Hyatt La Jolla for their food and pool and Regency Club has better Breakfast but it has no views at all. One other thing. We also had problems getting on the computer as there was always young children alone on them playing games! I had to ask them to get off for a short time so I could print our boarding passes as they would stay there for hours! I would not recommend for couples to go here!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for families, not for couples”
Reviews.Author: RandynLori
Reviews.Content: This is one of three hotels in San Diego that we stayed in on an April '09 visit. The first night our room wasn't too clean...there were potato chip crumbs all over the deck and long black hairs on the bathroom floor. It was pretty yucky to say the least! To top that off, we were on the fourth floor on the pool side and listened to screaming teenagers in the pool until after 11 p.m. We talked to the front desk staff and they upgraded us to a far superior room on the opposite side and it was much better. Another problem was the non-guests who would sneak in at night to use the pools and hot tub. Some were pretty scuzzy and it was obviously just something they did on a regular basis. This is a large, generic, plain vanilla chain hotel and we won't return, but it looked like it would be a fun place for families with older kids.

Reviews.Title: “New, Stylish, Relaxing and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TDBBerlin
Reviews.Content: Hotel: "old" from outside, brand new and very stylish inside Room: All new, stylish, great beds, modern bathroom, quiet Balcony: a bit dirty, but ok Pool area: 3 pools, free towels, great sunbeds, very nice garden Red Marlin Restaurant: wonderful breakfast overlooking marina (food available all day) Parking: yes but expensive (20 USD per night) Location: not at the beach but close to major San Diego attractions, beaches and not far from Interstate (8 and 5) all directions

Reviews.Title: “Recent rennovations are very nice”
Reviews.Author: bagjag27
Reviews.Content: Very family friendly and 1/2 mile walking distance to Mission Beach. Nice pool area with waterslide for the kids. Very nice fitness center plus very close to running paths including the beach boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: goodmanonradio
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We booked through a travel agent and got an unbelievable rate, plus one night free. We were warmly greeted by the staff our entire stay. Anything we called to ask for was delivered promptly. The rooms are comfortable. Ours had a sectional couch which is so much better than one chair. I would suggest getting a discount rate, I'm not sure if I would have been completely satisfied for the rates advertised on the website. The Hyatt Mission Bay is a beautiful hotel and is set near the beach and other waterways. Here's the biggest problem with this location.....getting around. We chose to not rent a car while in town. A city bus does pick up very near the hotel. From there you can get to the city's trolley station. By the end of the week, we were pretty good at using the public transportation. You are a little distance from most attractions at the Hyatt. Overall, ours was a very pleasant stay at the Hyatt Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “S'mores By the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Bblgirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt and checked in. We were given an upgrade to the Marina view suites. We checked out our nice clean (newly decorated) room. The room had a living area, large bathroom and a nice separate bedroom. The balcony looks out over the marina which is a spectacular view. The room was more than perfect. We walked over to the Red Marlin restaurant and had a very good dinner. The service was exceptional and the fish dishes were of good quality. We took a ride up to the Regency Club hospitality suite. We enjoyed a nice after dinner drink and another spectacular view overlooking Mission Bay. We spent two nights at this hotel. We appreciated the quality service and the nice greetings from the hotel staff. The pools and the water slides are fun for the younger crowd. The concierge will provide ( for a minimal charge) a S'mores package. This was a very nice touch for the children and adults... Imagine sitting out by the bay roasting marshmallows, next to a warm fire pit in the pool area. I really enjoyed this hotel. San Diego is a wonderful city and IS very tourist friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAFF - made this a wonderful experience for our family!”
Reviews.Author: travmo6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay after alot of discussion about San Diego hotels & doing a very careful "rate/location/value" analysis. Clearly, some of the reviews were complimentary, while others less so. Quite frankly, we weren't sure what to expect. We arrived at the hotel after midnight (our time) to find our family of six had been placed in the wrong room by Hyatt.com. The bellman called the front desk immediately. With many apologies the gentleman at the front desk found us a wonderfully spacious "Corner King Suite" which attached to a double/double room. We were also bumped up to the "Regency Club" level -- which meant we had a few extra goodies to munch on in the morning and fresh-brewed coffee waiting for us! (Actually, we found the afternoon cookies in the lounge amazing, too!) It was a wonderful stay - great waterslides (although the air temp was much cooler than the warm 85 degree water temp), delightful & friendly staff, a handy mini fridge in each room, flat screen tvs, cordless phones -- really all the comforts of home! We returned to this hotel again for a second two-night stay at the conclusion of vacation to CA. Again, the hotel upgraded us on our last night at the hotel to a wonderful room with a GORGEOUS sunset view of the ocean! Just the perfect place to relax after a day at SeaWorld or spending the day at the beach. Overall, we were VERY impressed with our stay. We couldn't have asked for more in the way of professionalism & courtesy from the entire staff of this hotel -- especially from Tina (at the front desk) who gave us a wonderful room after a second "glitch" in the room assignment. Her friendly attitude & delightful smile made us feel so genuinely cared about! Without a doubt, this hotel is a wonderful place to land when you have a two parents & four kids who need a relaxing, beautiful, welcoming place to relax in San Diego. We would definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Not Quite Up to Itself”
Reviews.Author: Overlandparkers
Reviews.Content: First off, since I couldn't find anywhere else to place this: Do not use Hotels.com! I asked and reasked about the cancellation policies and wrote it all down in capital letters during my initial reservation call. When I called to cancel within my time frame they wound up trying to charge me anyway and it took awhile to get it reversed. Our family of 4 wound up staying at the Hyatt Mission Bay because they offerred a family rate: adjacent rooms, 2nd room 1/2 off, ocean view (Tower). Though the staff is extremely professional as one would expect from the Hyatt, this resort is just not up to its Hyatt-snuff. We've previously been extremely happy at the Cypress Gardens and Tamaya Hyatt resorts. The rooms at Mission Bay are nicely done, though the balcony furniture had a cigarette hole in them and looked dirty, chairs outdated, and glass dirty. The main issue for us at this resort are the pools and grounds/cabansas in the center of the tower and suites. There's a. no shelter from the wind on the pool level, and b. no shelter from the noise coming from that area. Complicating that issue, the hours on these areas are not curbed so there's a feeling that you're at a much cheaper hotel than a nice resort, possibly to keep families and kids happy, but losing the higher level resort appeal. There were also no kids' camps or care available, contrary to the family theme. The biking and kayaking available are only until 4 p.m. fyi, which is disappointing. There is no worthwhile beach nearby though the marina and it's quiet activity beautiful. The Red Marlin restaurant is excellent --service, and atmosphere; food is good/very good (depending); prices are high. Einstein's bagel shop is a nice addition. The fitness center location in very inconvenient and small though it looks state of the art and large, online. It's in a building near the marina so unaccessible from the Tower; you must walk outside a ways. If there are more than a few people in there it feels crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Too many calls for service required”
Reviews.Author: Shoe1
Reviews.Content: Great location to access Mission Beach, La Jolla, Fashion Valley Mall and Sea World, however, housekeeping would not provide new drinking glasses, towels or coffee maker without constant calls. Good parking, excellent fitness center and meal at Red Marlin actually quite enjoyable. Need to heat all 3 pools.

Reviews.Title: “They turned a sow's ear into a silk purse”
Reviews.Author: JohnInSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently completed renovated. From what I've seen of old photos of the hotel and the rooms, I would not wanted to have stayed here. However, I spent 3 nights here in September of 2008 and I didn't want to leave even though I was moving into my brand new townhouse about 3 miles away. We were given a corner large room on a high floor with a view overlooking the bay. The room was spotlessly clean and complete with mini fridge, coffee maker, wine glasses, wine opener, fluffy robes, nice towels and the usual great Portico bath products - always a treat. Hyatt did it right when they chose these products. I spent every early evening sitting out in the balcony on the very high quality comfy and expensive looking outdoor furniture overlooking the water with glass of wine in hand. The pool area is great and they really did a great job with the renovation. It's like a little mini Hawaii right there complete the tiki torches, fire pits and very cool outdoor sitting canopies. One pool even has a sandy area that is sloped like your are walking from the beach into the water. The water slides are FUN even for adults. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants so I cannot comment about then. I now live in San Diego and I'm trying to figure out a way to convince them to sell me a summer pass to the pool area :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Work Trip”
Reviews.Author: cadet1821
Reviews.Content: Work required me to spend two days in San Diego and I stayed with the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay. The purpose of my trip was to have two busy days where I would literally be working from sunrise to sunset. I did not expect to have a relaxing trip. Then I arrived at the Hyatt Mission Bay. The resort had everything I needed to unwind after my two stressful days. The view from my balcony was amazing. The refrigerator in my room made it easy for me to store snacks for my late evenings. Besides the room, the staff was extremely helpful as well. It was nice returning in the evening to smiling, welcoming faces. Whether it was at the Einsteins at 6 am or the front desk at 11 pm, I was always greeted. I look forward to coming back to San Diego for vacation and staying with the Hyatt Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “An Ultimate San Diego Vacation”
Reviews.Author: h0teljunky
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in I fell in love with the Hyatt. The front desk staff was friendly and made sure we were well taken care of. I was surprised to find the chic decor at an older beach hotel. The lobby was very tastefully decorated. We paid the $35 upgrade fee to a high tower view room. Our room was located on the 15th floor of the tower on the ocean side (There is either Ocean or Marina view.) The room was very clean and had a view to die for. During our stay we learned that all of the guestrooms just got new carpet earlier in the month. This explained why the room even smelled new. From the balcony we watched the sunset with a bottle of wine we bought at their provisional store. It seemed the Hyatt was the tallest building in all of Mission Bay. Looking strait down at the pools and waterslides reminded me just how high we were. We didn't have the oppotunity to swim in the pools as it was a little too chilly for my liking. However, the entire pool deck was great! 3 pools. 3 waterslides. a jacuzzi. Plenty of seating. A fun pool bar called SWIM with great plantain chips for something different to snack on. and a firepit where kids enjoyed roasting marshmallows once the sun went down. We ate at the restaurant Red Marlin for a late dinner. I had the seared Ahi and my husband had the pork chop. They were both just dynomite. The restaurant sat over the marina and was warm and cozy inside with a center chefs table and fire pit. The restaurant was true fine dinning and far better than any other "hotel restaurant," I have ever experienced. Every employee we encountered through our stay was attentive and checked in to make sure we were having a good time. A few other highlights: Einstien Bagels right on the marina, a state of the art fitness center with brand new equipment the hung over the water, water sport rentals right on the dock, and a small but beautiful spa (that I will certainly take advantage of next time I am there.) We are already planning a trip back down to San Diego this summer. I have stayed at other hotels in the same area and never had an experience where I so blown away with the room, the view, the service, and the food! Hyatt Mission Bay is what a great San Diego getaway should be!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for family trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: madeagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights during the Presidents Day week. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel and the kids thoroughly enjoyed the pools and slides. The largest of the three wasn't heated ("broken heater"...yeah right) but didnt really matter. The hot tub was great when it worked. It lost heat for two days and then lost bubbles and it was the hotels' loss that the Pool Bar only opened at 5pm during the week, lack of forward thinking by the management probably, as there were plenty looking for drinks in the afternoon. There are plenty of places to eat within a short drive. Infact everything seemed to be within a short drive. The Mission was our favorite breakfast, HUGE portions though so don't over order. All in all a good choice. Really don't understand why it features so low in the SD rankings. Of course that $20 pn car parking charge is ridiculous and annoying but suppose they need the headline room price as low as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, but it could be better”
Reviews.Author: Thecircus
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is great. They are attentive, polite, and really know their jobs. Concierge could not have been more right with every suggestion on where to eat or things to do. The suite we were in was large, and very comfortable with really comfy beds. The sofas in the sitting room could need an upgrade, as they seem a tad beaten, but they were not terrible. The problem with the hotel is it seems caught between being a business hotel or family hotel, and is not doing either well. The suite had no table, no area to conduct a meeting, and no place to eat. As a frequent business traveler the suite did not appear it would be a good place to conduct a meeting or entertain. No coffee maker or microwave in the room made it family unfriendly. There was very little room to store clothing – 4 smallish drawers and a closet was not enough to keep us from living out of the suitcase. Plus if you are going to cater to kids – get nickelodeon on the TV. And please, keep the pool slides open longer – Seaworld closes at 4pm – a pool open to 6pm would have helped the wind down process. Also, having a lower end restaurant option like a burger joint pub would be an excellent upgrade. Finally, $20 to park a night in an open lot is not exactly high class in my book – you don’t need the money that badly and it just leaves a sour taste in your mouth when you checkout. Even with its problems, I would likely stay here again for its comfort, location, and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benjiCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mission Bay Hyatt for three nights in late January. We had a lovely room overlooking the ocean..the view was spectacular! The fitness room was also lovely...overlooking the harbor. We found there seemed to be an excess of staff in the reception area..not quite sure what they were all doing. There was a charge of $10.00 for internet service which seemed excessive. Nevertheless, we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, friendly staff but...”
Reviews.Author: KaptainKool
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to San Diego, two business and one vacation. this busness trip was for four nights. This is a very nice hotel with beautiful flowers and plants in the courtyard. Great location. one mile from Mission beach. we asked for a "room with a view" and were given the seventh floor with a westerly view overlooking mission bay. We watched the trademarked southern California sunset every evening from our balcony. Even in January the weather was pleasant (high 60's). the room was clean, large with a sofa and a flat screen television. Here's the kicker...absolutely no dresser to store your clothes. the only drawers were in the nightstand. The closet hanger rod was three feet off the ground in a very small closet. the clothes i hung up also laid on the ground. I actually lived out of my suitcase. with clothes packed for five days i could hang some but for my wife and i it was very inconvenient and led to very wrinkled clothes. the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. the only thing keeping this review from being excellent was the clothing problem.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: 1969usmc1988
Reviews.Content: They went over and above the call of duty believe me. I was in town for my oldests graduation and I had just flown in from Bangkok where I was helping out a bit the the disaster in Burma (aka Mayanmar) Without a word the desk offerend me a top floor upgrade. I didnt' say a thing about being a Jarhead but when I threw my military ID up on the counter for ID verification I was upgraded to a two room sweet right on the bay. I was then Lauded for my service to both my country and my family. (Bangkok and San Diego are quite a flight away from each other) The royal treatment didnt' stop there and the staff truly made me feel like a king. This establishment is a must stop for Military...and yes...flash the ID....unashamedly!!! Youve earned it! Semper Fi

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 617Lancaster
Reviews.Content: I Was on a 15 day trip from Vegas to Seattle, I found the hotel to be smart clean and friendly, I stayed for 2 nights and would certainly be happy to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Old School but Still a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: Balad
Reviews.Content: This is the oldest of the three full service Hyatt properties in San Diego; however, it is still the best all around. Great location, great views, great staff and clean rooms. The grounds are beautiful and best of all, there is a store on site if you forget some clothing articles. This is definitely the place to stay when you play on Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but.....”
Reviews.Author: lizziepf
Reviews.Content: We chose this property for the convenience. Our family member was staying there with an out of town group and we wanted to have a mini family reunion. The staff was very friendly. The room was another matter. We were given a room in an older part of the hotel. It has been advertised that there has been a recent renovation. This room was missed. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. The bathroom, though dated, was clean and supplied well. The carpet in the room was very badly stained. We had a king room which included sectional sofa seating. It was comfortable but musty and stained. The A/C had a constant drone which was annoying when trying to sleep. Also, the vent was inadequate to control the whole room temperature. As long as you sat on the sofa you were comfortable, but the bed was further back in the room and the temperature in that area was not controlled. It was sort of like having a room A/C unit for a very specific area. The second night, the guests (elephants) upstairs were evidently restless. There was much pacing and drawer slamming and furniture moving until about 2:30 AM. The room had an IPOD docking station which included an alarm clock. It was not evident to me how to dim the LED so the room was well lit like a night light until I figured out to get a couple of washcloths to put over it. The room included a refrigerator which was supposed to be the wet bar. There was a sign indicating that it was stocked with supplies and that the water was $4.95. The refrigerator contained only one can of Pepsi. I do not typically use the overpriced items. In this case, my concern it that I would be charged for the missing items. I had a glass of tap water on the bedside stand and when the housekeeper cleaned the room, the glass was put on a coaster rather than replacing the glass with a clean one. I thought that to be odd. Maybe it was for water conservation. Added to our room rate was a $20 parking fee per night. If you wanted Valet, it was $25. We knew about this in advance and chose the $20 option. When we returned from our day of touring, all the self parking was full due to some event taking place in the massive tent that has been raised in the parking lot. (Overflow?) We used the valet service and including the tips, spent a total of $51 to park for two nights. But, as I said, that was not a hidden charge. I never found an ice machine. There was no indication of one on the hotel map. Our family member was staying in a different building and said that there was one down the hall from the room. I tried to call the front desk but was put on hold and decided it was not that important. The food options are rather limited unless you have a car (we did). Within walking distance is an Einsteins which is a Starbucks kind of business but not Starbucks quality. They offered bagels and breakfast sandwiches that did not look very appealing. We chose to go to the hotel restaurant for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was $21.95 per person. It seemed to be the best deal on the menu. The food was attractively presented and there was a wide variety. They did serve Starbucks coffee though. The view of the bay was very nice. The wait staff was very attentive. I tried to use the in room check out on the TV. The site was either down or under construction. I am not totally sure. Mixed messages and I was unable to start over even though I turned off the TV. It kept defaulting to where I left off. i mentioned some of these issues upon checkout at the front desk. I received a friendly smile. We have stayed at Hyatt properties in the past. This one is not one of their crown jewel properties.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanside Upper Rooms Have Great view”
Reviews.Author: Arch53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a standard room through Priceline @ $87 per night. When we arrived we knew we would be in the Tower and asked about an upper floor. Apparently, the lower floors 1-4 are for the lower price bracket--the room size is exactly the same only the view is different. We opted for a $35 per night upgrade to get on the 15th floor. We choose the ocean side rather than the marina side to get a better view. The room was not ready and since it took much longer than expected to get it ready we were given a complimentary upgrade to the 16th floor--a concierge club floor that included a continental breakfast (pretty good) and evening snacks (no great shakes, soft drinks and a some passable snacks- booze was not free as at other Hyatt hotel Regency club floors). It was really a nice gesture to give us this additional upgrade and indicative of the overall friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The room was small but the view was terrific. Pick the Ocean/Mission Bay side if you are on an upper floor, the sunsets were great. There is a small porch sitting area you can enjoy the view from. The bedding was the usual high Hyatt quality. The pool area was great with two tame but decent water slides. One tip, parking is $22 . My daughter lives in the Crown Point area of San Diego, only a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. There is very safe and free on-street parking in the Crown Point area so I did not pay the parking fee.The street parking in the immediate vicinity of the hotel prohibits on-street parking from 2 a.m. to 4 a.m. effectively eliminating that as an option. As a practical matter there really does not seem to be any policing of the hotel parking lot area so even if you did not pay the fee and get the paper tag for your dashboard, you probably can still park in the hotel lot anyway (because of a late return to the hotel on the last night we used the hotel parking lot and suffered no ill effects). But the Crown Point area is probably your best bet for free parking if you don't mind the walk to get your car in the morning and leaving it in the evening; it's actually a very pretty walk.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this was a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nicmacco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my son/husband because I am looking to book a conference in the San Diego area next year. The group rate offered for this property is more than reasonable. WIth these new refurbishments, I would say this is a quality hotel. The rooms, grounds, restaurants, pools, were very impressive! They have an Einsteins bagels and great, fully loaded market. She did give us one of the best views in the house, which added to the ambiance. Sorry to say it was too cold to use the water slides and pools, though we gave it a try. They also have little fire pits where families can make some smores. Plus, the conference facilities were wonderful. I think this would make a great event location if groups are looking to stay at a reasonably priced property, in a great location and also keep their spouses/families happy if they want to tag along. Honestly, I am shocked this place doesn't get higher reviews. Also, I appreciate having a fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, not sure 4 star”
Reviews.Author: ann K
