They had just finished some of the renovations when I was there, and were ironing out some kinks, but none were significant. They had just opened the restaurant on the water (name escapes me right now), and the breakfast was absolutely to die for. So were the views. The pool area was very compact, but also very children-focused. The waterslide wasn't working when we were there, but looks to be quite nice. The staff was extremely helpful with all of our requests, even down to recommended jogging paths, and I was very satisfied with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of Hyatt name -- outside is nice, but rooms are not”
Reviews.Author: AmishLou
Reviews.Content: Anyone staying here needs to know that there are two sections to this hotel. One is the "towers" with balconies overlooking the pool and/or the bay. The other section, where we were assigned (and probably most Priceline/Hotwire guests are) was the 70's motel-style sections, with outside entrances to the room. The cement floor outside our room was badly stained, as though people had gotten sick there. Our skepticism grew as we opened the door to our room to find filthy carpeting and bad mildew stains in the bathroom. I went back to the front desk to express my disappointment and asked for a room change. They said they were 100% booked and could not switch my room until the next day (it was after midnight when we arrived). Then the next day they apologized that there was no other rooms available either. Hard to believe...could it be because I was a Hotwire guest who paid $124/night? The room was bare bones -- not even an alarm clock!! Had to pay for internet. Upon complaining they gave me a free breakfast coupon for their restaurant and when we went there the next day found it was only for two. Had to pay for the children which made our total with tax & tip come to $40!! That was for a very mediocre-buffet. The grounds are nice but the beach is not easily accessible. Hotwire calls this "oceanfront" which it most definitely is not. The pool are was extremely crowded and the waterslides have limited hours. I have stayed in a lot of Best Westerns that are much nicer. Hyatt should remove their name from this property. By the way, it is the same hotel as the Hyatt Islandia. Even though their website claims it just underwent a huge remodeling project, the money was apparently only put into the pool and ground and probably new bedding...the carpets and bathrooms have obviously not been updated in a LONG time. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Please note that someone staying in towers might have much better reviews so if you are assigned here please make sure you call to request towers!! BUT...the last night of our stay we were at the Hilton Torrey Pines, which was absolutely INCREDIBLE. Read my review on that for a completely different experience...that place is everything a resort should be!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!!”
Reviews.Author: BenP
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 2 day stay post a San Diego cruise and we were not impressed with a number of things. First the Pros the Staff was excellent from the lobby to the floors. It has a great view from the upper floors. The pool area is great but, it all stops there. It is really overpriced. You have to rent a car as the location is far from restaurants. They have a pool area bar that serves sandwiches and other bar food. There also is a semi-attached full service restaurant that is REALLY spendy, i.e. a 20 0z steak for $72.00. We had a car and went to the Dana which is accross the street and down the street and had a N.Y. for $20.00. The walls of the tower are thin as paper. We heard our neighbor talking in normal tones about everything. (I wont go there) The self closing doors slam at all hours of the night. There is no coffee machine forcing us to go to the pool bar for a overpriced cup. We had to leave early in the morning to catch an early flight and you couldn't buy a cup at that hour. I won't go on but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Updated and Upgraded !”
Reviews.Author: cjt1971
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which has recently gone through some major renovations which have vastly improved not only the rooms, but also the service. Hospitality rooms offered happy hour munchies for free, but an honor system self-serve bar. 24-hour computers with internet access (a bit slow, but available), and daily paper. The new "chill-out" section outside the lobby replaced the old koi pond, but kids will love the expanded pool with slide and play areas. The poolside bar offered a late night menu with excellent ropa vieha (sp?) sandwiches and good drinks. However, this is the same Hyatt breakfast menu we had experienced in Kauai and the "eggs in a pot" and "sticky-bun french toast" cannot be beat. Have room service delivered now that they put the comfy contemporary chairs and table on the balcony. It's a great way to watch the kayakers/boaters/crews in the bay while you wake up. The rooms on the corners of the hotel are the best since the bedroom has it's own little alcove unlike the other rooms. Try to get one of these and you'll feel like it's truly a suite even though it's not separated by a wall. Excellent customer service sets this hotel apart and no matter if you're on the west side watching the ocean or on the east side watching the harbor and fireworks from Sea World Saturday nights, this hotel will exceed your expectations! We checked out the penthouse during a party, and it's amazing, but the kitchen does need updating. (no kitchen in most rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: smellwhatimcooking
Reviews.Content: I have never been more disappointed in my life with a Hyatt! Upon check-in (6:30pm) my suite wasn’t quite available after twenty short minutes we were given the key to our worst nightmare. We opened the door to a musty, dim, and filthy suite. I promptly turned around and walked the 300 yards (Yes 300) back to the front desk and asked for a different room that didn’t look like a scene from CSI. I was given access to two other suites; the carpets were soaking wet and not able to be occupied without hip waders. Without any other choices we stayed in the ‘suite’ the first night, I never took off my shoes until bed. The next night we were given two adjoining rooms with the same carpet problem but at least they were cleaner. My purpose of the trip was to sight see during the morning and early afternoon and return to swim with my kids in the evening. The pool with the slides was closed down 2 of the 3 days we were there and so was the hot tub. The hotel staff tried but at $339.00 a night I could have spent a lot of nights at a Motel 6 with better accommodations. I stayed at many hotels and have never felt the need to warn people about anyone of them until now. The hotel staff really tried to help but I think their hands are tied. If Hyatt offered my family a free stay at the hotel to accommodate us I would honestly have to pass.

Reviews.Title: “More pro than con”
Reviews.Author: SBHappy
Reviews.Content: The pros: GREAT location between downtown and La Jolla, making it easy to get to most attractions. - newly renovated - great pool area - nice spot surrounded by water and marina. The cons: the front desk staff is not at all friendly or welcoming - found long, black hair in multiple areas of the shower - pillowcase was dirty - stains on carpet. Overall, we would stay there again when we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dwschwartz
Reviews.Content: March 31, 2008 I was really excited to find this hotel and my kids were wowed by the pictures of the pool area. Today, two days into my three day stay, i cannot wait to leave. The good: 1. Nice enough rooms. Clean and adequate to hold two adults and two kids, 8 and 11. 2. Friendly and attentive staff The bad: 1. The heater for the pool with the 100' water slide is broken. The water is probably 50-degrees. Some kids are braving the cold to go down the slide, but not spending any time in the water, because it's too darn cold. 2. One of the water slides is broken. 3. The hot tub is out of order. The water is green. 4. No in room wifi. 5. There are two restaurants, one is a bare bones and only sells bagels and danishes in the AM. The other is very fancy. Breakfast for 4 was $70. This hotel needs a middle of the road, family restaurant. 6. The hotel is situated in a way that there is a tremendous wind that whips through the pool area. It's been plenty sunny in San Diego today, but COLD by the pool because of the wind. Is it a surprise that we won't be back?

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Suites”
Reviews.Author: adamgator
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hyatt the weekend of the terrible fires ravaging San Diego County and other areas of Southern California. We’d already pricelined it and figured that our air quality in Los Angeles is bad enough, might as well go down to costal San Diego. WE called the Hotel to verify that the room was not needed for evacuees or emergency workers (we’d have gladly donated it if needed), the hotel said they had plenty of rooms. Of course when we arrived, a major power outage in the Mission Bay area was ongoing (including Sea World). There was no way to pull up reservations, set keys, power elevators, etc. The office was trying there best. Pretty understandable given the major disaster covering the entire region. So we skipped freshening up and went into town for dinner. We called a couple hours later and they informed us that they had power. Unsolicited, they upgraded us to a fancy suite and gave us valet parking for the price of regular parking for our inconvenience. The suite was fantastic – balcony over the marina, large bathroom, separate living area with convertible sofa and large flat screen TV – we hooked up our travel DVD player and took advantage. Bed was extremely comfortable – robes in room. Made for a nice relaxing evening and morning. The property was clean and well maintained. The exercise room was under refurbishing so they shuttled us (complimentary) to a fancy health club a few minutes away (no charge for its use). Mission Beach is a nice community and very scenic and relaxing. Pacific Beach across the river is nice at well, but a bit more sketchy. Close proximity to La Jolla for excellent sunsets. The only downside is the parking fee. There’s PLENTY of street parking, but the city has made parking illegal for a few hours in the early, early morning, forcing one to pay 10-14 bucks for parking despite the availability of ample street parking. It’s one thing to do that in an urban area, but here it just seems to be for making $. I’ve stayed at the Dana Hotel across the street which does not charge (not as fancy as our suite at the Hyatt). Oh well, still a nice location. I cannot comment on the standard rooms in the tower section, but again, the suites were very nice. We used priceline and got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Embarrassed To Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyballgame9876
Reviews.Content: First off to explain my resort experience, I vacation at least once a year and always stay at resorts from Orlando, to South Carolina, Tennesee, Wisconsin, Grand Cayman, etc.....This visit to Hyatt Islanda/Mission Bay was an embarrasing resort...actually cant even call this a resort. In the past, RESORTS have been RESORTS/Condos....this was a glorified hotel room with the Hyatt name. First off, these were studio units, which was not what I booked or told I was getting for another couple and I. Also this was missing many of the regular amenities, all the resorts I have stayed at over the past 10 years always had....There was no dresser to put our clothing and had to live out of a suitcase. There was no kitchen and no laundry facilities in the room or in the area! Those were basic shock factors! Second off, the room was disgusting! Stains all over the carpet and in walking around the room over a 30 minute time frame, left our socks dirty! Wore sandals the rest of the time in the room! The room also had black marks all over the wall as the pictures show. These were on all walls, some small and some big! Our windows also had no screens in them, which is a major child safety hazard. Lastly the internet connection did not exist and upon looking beneath the desk, noticed there was a mess of wires and fire hazard waiting to happen. Plus for a $200 + a night RESORT, they charge $10 a day for internet connection! Anyhow, a shocker and embarrasment as I was the one who took another coupe and their family here with talks about how amazing the places I stay at in the past were! For the price and reputation Hyatt has, you would think they took better care of their RESORT and would be in nicer condition. Guess they limited their profit cost back into all the construction and renovations they just finished with! The area and views are nice, but for the price and quality, I would have been better of staying at an upscale hotel for half the price! I will never stay at this resort again when in San Diego! They talk the resort up posting pics of their amazing rooms, which are slim, and portray that all the rooms are like this! Again, what a shocker and disappointment! See pics which were taken upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!! Nice Renovation”
Reviews.Author: BearMinneapolis_mN
Reviews.Content: I can see where people would have been upset during renovations but we found the Hotel to be quite nice. Our view was fantastic, and the rooms were quite nice. My family enjoyed the rooms, and thought the beds were very comfortable. The noise level at times from above was annoying but we liked the hotel overall. The people were very friendly and helped with accomodations. I would agree with other reviewers that the $18.00 self park was excessive. Overall we had a very nice experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kids couldn't get enough of the pool + waterslides!”
Reviews.Author: 4inSoCal
Reviews.Content: The renovations are nice. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfy. The balcony overlooking the pool area and the Bay was beautiful.... the rollercoaster at Belmont Park was in the distance.... kids thought that was cool too. The Pool area was phenomenal! The kids had an absolute blast! Hot tub was not working when we first got there but 2 of the pools were warm so it was just fine. Plenty of fluffy navy blue towels. lots of families there over Spring break but it was fairly quiet. The one negative that could keep us from returning was that the planes flying overhead were quite loud... up until around 11pm and then picked back up around 6am. If it doesn't bother you then the place is fantastic. We have a 2 year old who likes a cup of milk close to bedtime and their little shop was out of milk. The girl mentioned room service or going to the Swim Bar/Lounge and we figured it might be cheaper and faster to just go to Swim. Well when the waitress came back to me with a plastic cup of milk and a bill for $4+tax I swallowed hard and handed her a five dollar bill. I can buy a gallon of organic milk for that! YIKES! When I mentioned it to the girl in the shop she apologized and said if we needed milk for the rest of our stay she would direct us to a Longs Pharmacy to get a fair price since their shipment wasn't coming in till friday! We know for next time to bring those boxed milks for the kiddos. Our little one got sick overnight and we had to check out early. The front desk apologized and charged us for the one night and gave us no trouble for cutting our trip short. All the staff we encountered were very nice and friendly. It was fun while it lasted and for the pool area alone we may just have to come back (our 6 year old was already asking if we could this summer).... maybe a room lower down wouldn't be as noisy with the planes??? We were up on the 15th floor! Overall aside from the airplanes we were quite happy with the Hyatt Mission Bay!

Reviews.Title: “The Longer I Stayed, The More I Liked the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay!”
Reviews.Author: 04sox
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the previous reviews for this hotel, I was very nervous about what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised at what a nice place the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay is! Each day I spent there, I liked the place more and more! Check-in was flawless - there were parking attendants and bellhops at the ready immediately upon our arrival. Inside the lobby, there were 3 desk attendants who were assisting with check-ins and other guest requests. Initially I was disappointed to find that our room was located in "The Suites" building, which is a small, 3-story, motel-like building located to the side of the main hotel. My concerns were put aside the second I stepped into the room. The door opened to a spacious living room area, that was tastefully decorated and included a large, flat-screened t.v. and a sectional couch with a pull-out bed. Separating the living area and the sleeping area was a hallway containing a mini-refrigerator, a dresser, a closet with double sliding mirrored doors and a large, very clean bathroom. I am pretty certain that some of the reviews I read indicated that the bathrooms had showers only, no bathtubs. That was not the case with the room I had. It had a bathtub/shower combination. The sleeping area had 2 queen sized beds, with plenty of pillows and crisp linens. The beds were firm and comfortable. There was a t.v. on the desk, along with internet hook-up (which was a paid service - $10/24 hr., I think). The nightstand had an I-Home that doubled as a radio-alarm clock. There was also a chair and ottoman in the bedroom. There were sliding glass doors which led to a small deck overlooking the marina. The glass doors allowed for plenty of light to enter the room, but were easily darkened with curtains when necessary. Overall, the room was clean, secure and quiet. The loudest and most common noise was the sound of luggage wheels on the walkways. That noise was apparent from the living room, but I don't recall having heard it from the bedroom at all. There were occasional noises from the marina, but nothing to complain about. The pool area was fantastic! The outdoor temps were in the low 60s during my stay, but the pools were heated to a nice temperature and when I got chilly, I sat in the hot tub to warm up. The water slides are an excellent addition to the pool! The slides are attended by a hotel employee / lifeguard at all times - the slides were closed occasionally for breaks and closed for the night at dusk. The 2 big water slides open into a medium-sized pool that had a walk-out ramp at the end opposite the slides - this was the coldest of the 3 pools, but the water slides were such a distraction that I barely noticed how much cooler the water was in this pool compared to the other 2. There was a smaller water slide which opened into the smallest of the 3 pools - this pool was warmer than the other slide pool. The largest pool did not have water slides and it was a bit deeper and a bit warmer than the other 2 pools. The hot tub was roomy and a nice break from the cool outside air. I found the pool towels to be plentiful (and warm!) and restocked every day. There also appeared to be waitress service on the pool deck. I didn't use this service, but it appeared as if orders placed at Swim Lounge were delivered poolside if requested. I did not eat at Swim Lounge, so I can not comment on the service there. I did, however, eat at Red Marlin - 3 times! The service and food at Red Marlin were excellent! It was pricey, as expected at a nice hotel restaurant, but the presentation and flavor of the food made it worth the cost. I would place Red Marlin in a fine dining category. Having said that, it was very accommodating toward my young daughter. There was a children's menu and my daughter was treated like a princess by everyone at the restaurant. All of the food I had there was excellent and, overall, it was a very nice place to dine. The hotel staff appeared to try very hard to make for a pleasant stay. Every time I was in the lobby, the desk was staffed by 3 or 4 attendants, including a concierge. The concierge was very helpful in making local recommendations, making reservations, and providing driving directions. I utilized this service numerous times during my stay. The cleaning staff was also very pleasant and meticulous. Because self-parking was so convenient to where my room was located, I did not use the valet service. The only "issue" I had during my entire stay was trying to find the exercise facility. It was listed in the hotel directory as being on the 2nd floor of the tower. It was actually located right off of the marina, behind "The Suites." It was not fun running from building to building in the driving rain - at 5:30 in the morning - trying to locate this facility. The facility itself is typical of a hotel exercise room - a few treadmills, a stationary bike, some weight machines - but with a beautiful view of the marina and harbor. In closing, this hotel is conveniently and beautifully located. It was very easy to drive anywhere I needed to go. I would definitely stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Still working out the Bugs at the Bay”
Reviews.Author: SilverStar-7
Reviews.Content: Reserved king room with view. Checked in to 2 story tower in a room w/2 queens with a view of the tent that is used for events. That night the crew at 1130pm were banging the metal poles to take stuff down. Heat was a choice between a banging noise when it turned on and off every 10 minutes or be cold. Water the next morning was hot for first shower and freezing cold for second. Second day both showers were cold. Third day it was intermit. hot/cold. Rooms are large but carpet was soiled. Beds are placed close to window and wall so you really can't get out of bed easily. Location is great. You are close to major attractions. Nice walk around the marina and the park next to the hotel has paths for running. The pools are now open and great for all ages. There is a water slide and hot tub. Staff was very friendly and Andrew gave very good recommendations for local cafes. They also have free internet in the lobby so you can log on and check in for your flights if you don't want to pay for internet service. Parking is also pricey and very limited. You can park across the street at the parking garage which was easy. Suggest that you request the tower rooms. Hopefully they are less problematic and less wear and tear.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Fav”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this property and I probably won't choose to return. Overall it was adequate, but there were some issues that I consider to be important when finding lodging. First, let me say that I was in one of the Bay wings (two story wings beside the tower). I'm not sure what the tower rooms are like and this review only reflects my experience with a room in the wings. The room has been somewhat recently renovated. It's too bad, though, that the carpet was a bit stained in my room (1916). It is also unfortunate that when they updated these rooms (and I think they did a pretty bang-up job on the overall renovation) that they didn't remove the popcorn texture from the ceilings. It makes it look dated. Overall positives: Great furnishings as part of the renovation, including LCD TV; comfy bed; lots of light from slider; interesting room design. Issues: Noise was a big issue for me here and I'm generally not a light sleeper. I heard TVs on both sides of my room very clearly. I also had a "heavy walker" above me and I was pretty amazed at how clearly I could hear that walking back and forth. Mission Bay is close to the flight path for SAN, too, so there was some aircraft noise. An additional noise source was the heating system. This, clearly, was not updated in the renovations. It looked ancient and made a big ker-bang every time it shut off. It jolted me awake a couple times. The location is great only if you have transportation of your own. I did ... and found the location to be fine. The noise issues, alone, would probably steer me away from this property. If you're a light sleeper, take note!

Reviews.Title: “Great Suprise”
Reviews.Author: ericu33
Reviews.Content: Was a bit skeptical after reading some of the reviews here, but..... We had a great time! Happened to arrive when they were having their Grand Re-Opening from renovations they made. We were invited to join in the celebration that night, which included entertainers, free food booths, and an open bar. I couldn't believe how great it was. We also were upgraded to a large room with a king bed with and outstanding view of the bay. Everything was clean and comfortable. We were astounded at the quality and service we received for the price we paid. We return in a heartbeat. Eric eustation@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Relaxing stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: socalev1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay Spa and Marina. Our room was on the 11th floor of the tower overlooking the Marina. There is some noise from the marina - it's a marina - there's gonna be boat noise! But what a fabulous view! The hotel has just completed a $65M renovation. The room was beautiful with a small balcony. Plenty of privacy to sit and enjoy the view. Large room, nice comfortable bed with great linens and pillows. Wonderful flat screen TV. The pools area is lush and tropical. There are a couple of water slides and the kids (and some adults) seemed to enjoy them very much. Very much enjoyed the Blueberry Mojito at Swim. Also enjoyed watching the fish in the aquaium. There is a new signature waterfront Restaurant, Red Marlin. Sit anywhere and receive a great view. Food was great too! Very good, friendly, attentive service. I especially enjoy walking around the marina in the morning. So relaxing. The valet is pricey (but I've paid more). They were very attentive and very willing to give directions. We already have plans to return in June!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Return”
Reviews.Author: Maui1Minnesota
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in for 1 night. There was no one to assist us at check in, no one offering to help, and in fact the computer at the front desk offered a very disappointing self-service check in, similar to what you would find in an airport. We used it and checked into our room, which appeared to be one that was very old, very sub-standard, and had aparently been bought by the Hyatt and simply 'added' into this 'resort.' It looked like it had been previously a privately owned highway motel that the Hyatt bought, threw on new countertops to cover up the old ones, put on a new bedspread and tried to make it look 'modern'....it was a sorely failed effort in our opinion. We were disappointed in many areas. The room was dirty, old, musty, and had no elevator access, although no one offered to tell us this or warn us, or even help us. For 2 tired travelers carrying 3 suitcases this was at real inconvenience and a true disapointment. To add to our disappointment, as we arrived with luggage in tow, the valet standing right outside the front entrance looked us in the eye as we struggled to move 3 pieces of luggage up the flight of front steps as we entered the building, and didn't move to even open the lobby door--as he stood 2 feet away from us. ?? The staff all seemed to be consistently the same in this unfriendly, unhelpful way, with the exception of 1 young door man who was nice enough to recomment a good Mexican restaurant. The trek (again, without offer of help or assistance with anything--including luggage--from anyone there) to our room was confusing with no offer for help or direction, water dripped onto our heads off the (unfinished?) 'patio' ceiling, and appeared to be a construction scene, until we realized that that's actually just the condition of the hotel. It's not modern, not warm, not convenient, not very clean. It was 2 floors and had that very old motel-ish look and quality. We are not sure of the condition of the tower portion of the hotel, as we were in this older 2-story section. Our 'bay' view offered us the lovely sight of a maintenance building, a crane, a bobcat lifter, and garbage cans.....oh, and a little slice of the bay beyond all that lovely scenery! Sorely disappointed. The carpet in our room was dirty and stained. The hotel's condition, staff, and ammenities were a deep disappointment to us, and we're not extremely picky travelers. We would not under any circumstances recommend this hotel, especially when you consider we found a room at the nearby Best Western for a much lower price and (unexpectedly) cleaner, nicer and rooms in much better condition. Just awful.

Reviews.Title: “A poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Toofastcat
Reviews.Content: I suppose the moral of this review should be “never stay at a hotel during a major renovation”. But if you don’t know it’s happening, how can you avoid it? The Regency branding is supposed to indicate a luxury resort and setting, but staying at this Hyatt in November 2007, with their renovation running five months late, only the setting part was even mildly luxurious. This hotel comprises both a main high-rise tower and some low-rise marina-side accommodation. At the time we stayed there the main lobby wasn’t built, and the only place for breakfast, apart from expensive room service, was the Swim Cafe, a pool-side snack bar intended to serve pool-users. The choice was absolutely minimal and self-service. The pools themselves were not in use, as their renovation hadn’t quite completed either. Our marina view king room was fine in itself - spacious, light and airy, if a little minimalist on the decor. The view was good with a sunny balcony. Our bathroom lacked a tub, and the shower ran water that was tepid at its warmest. The hotel’s public facilities were just non-existent. There were no lounges or other public spaces available. The hotel was largely occupied by business convention groups, who dominated the place. One group were selling a gothic teen clothing brand, and their delegates ate from a mobile kitchen around the back of the hotel, and were a frequent site coming and going, wearing hoodies, drinking beer in the elevators, and generally acting like extras in a bad teen movie. I’m sure this hotel will be better when it’s renovated, but from the layout and situation I doubt it will ever be great. The location on the marina is nice, and if proximity to Flipper is your overriding factor, then you will be close to Sea World. But the limitations of the architecture will never make for a wonderful hotel, renovated or not. How Hyatt have the nerve to sell rooms in a hotel with so few of the facilities working is beyond me, and sell those rooms at full price too. I felt it was worth only half what we paid given the state of the place, and were thankful we had only a two-night stay pre-paid. There was a time when Hyatt meant certain quality and class in a hotel. That time is clearly in the past.

Reviews.Title: “very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: mickeeAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed to attend a conference and found that there was no restaurant which was mentioned in the confrimation sent by the hotel. Our room, despite being renovated had stains in the carpet, burn marks in the balconey furniture, a large chip in the toilet and the blaconey windows were filthy. On our last day we had to ask for hand towels and were told by house cleaning that they were out. Most staff were friendly tho some were indifferent. The holel in not really close to anything so expect to walk 15 minutes to Mission Bay beach or drive if you plan to go anywhere. Not worth the money, not what one would expect from a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: traveling_girl42
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference at this hotel and I would never stay there again. The staff was impolite. I could not watch a movie on my TV so I called front desk three times and each time they placed me on hold so long that I could not talk to someone. They are currently doing reconstruction so there was only room service and a pool lounge that was open which was insufficient to feed all the people. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, despite upgrades”
Reviews.Author: paulie47
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2008 to attend a weekend professional meeting. My room was not in the tower, but a two story building attached. The staff was excellent and helpful. The room was quiet (I understand construction was going on but I stayed on a Saturday night and nobody was working on Sunday morning.) The bed was new and comfortable, the furniture was good but not great, and there was a flat screen t.v. The room was clean. However despite the $65 million in upgrades, my bathtub did not drain properly after I showered. If two people are sharing the room and each wants to shower this could be a problem. The fit and finish of the bathroom was poor, although I want to stress it was clean. What was puzzling was that in order to use the internet you had to pay a fee -- either for a cable connection or to log in to wireless. Something that is provided free at Starbucks should be likewise free at a hotel that considers itself first class. Paying more than $10 per day to connect is just annoying. Room service ended at 10 p.m., a problem for some of our group that got in late at night. Our meeting room was not signed -- I mean how difficult could it be to put up a sign saying "Palm Room" on the door of the Palm Room? When I checked out using the express machine, my receipt indicate that the food I had ordered was liquor. Obviously, my professional group was not going to reimburse me for drinking my dinner. I had that changed by the front desk, but it took a while. Others have mentioned that this hotel is out of the way. It is if you want easy access to downtown. If you have a car you can drive to downtown, the gaslamp area, etc. fairly easily. If not, a cab ride is going to run you $25 or more. There are virtually no restaurants in walking distance, again a problem if you get in after they close room service. So rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: red_striker
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for a "steal" on priceline. We visited San Diego as part of a Vacation also taking in Las Vegas and Palm Springs. We arrived at San Diego airport mid afternoon after flying with Southwest from Vegas. I was surprised at how small the Airport was. Picked up a rental car and got directions to the hotel which was probably no more than 15 minutes away. Stayed three nights and knew that the pool was out of action. We wanted to visit the Zoo and Seaworld therefore we just wanted somewhere comfortable to sleep - boy were we in for a surprise. We were given a tower room high up with an amazing view over the the coastline. The room had recently been refurbished to a superb standard and the beds were so comfortable it made us decide to change ours when we got back. Ok there isn't much around the hotel and yes you do have to drive everywhere but if you're just visting then this hotel should be fine and while the renovations are going on you will get this hotel at a great price through priceline. ps did not get charged for parking !! Tip - Great Afgan restaurant in University area

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: csdg13044
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for a night and it was great! We went through priceline and only paid $60 for the night. The total was about $74 with tax and such. Our room was ready early it was clean and exactly what we wanted. They had construction going on but it did not bother us at all I never heard it. The front desk was great! They gave us great directions and were very friendly. It was about a 5 minute walk to the ocean! I would defn recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, rental car a must”
Reviews.Author: scoobyincuffs
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt mission Bay for a week long training. The room was lovely and my balcony faced the Pacific and had gorgeous views. Construction is going on, but the grounds are beautiful, with lots of tropical plants and palm trees. The only drawback is that I did not have a rental car, and unless you want to eat at the expensive hotel restaurant or at the marina'a fish and chips shack every meal, you have to walk about a mile and one half to reach another restaurant. Luckily, I made friends with classmates who had cars after the first day. Altogether, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great new room, view was incredible”
Reviews.Author: NWTRNR
Reviews.Content: We knew in advance that the hotel was under construction. Despite the inconvenience of not having all of the facilities open (e.g. pool), our stay was just fine. Our room was brand new with a wonderful bed and bathroom. Flatscreen TV and a balcony with an amazing view of the ocean. We were awakened to sounds of a small calypso band playing at the next door restaurant. It made the morning perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: GreekYineka
Reviews.Content: Although I made my reservation 6 weeks in advance, the hotel could not honor my request for a room in the Tower with a balcony/garden view. Instead, I got room #2001, in a 2-story building that reminded me of a dumpy 1970's apartment building. The room was right next to the "construction pit". I asked for another room but was told that none were available. The next morning, Saturday, at 7:03 a.m I was awakened by the sound of hammering and dragging wood and metal pieces. At 7:23 a.m. the backhoe engine fired up and the vehicle back-up alarm was ringing in my ears. By 8:00 a.m. I was back at the front desk, this time asking for some kind of compensation. The only thing the manager on call could offer me was complimentary $14 parking. I wrote a letter to the general manager requesting a refund but was only offered an upgrade on my next visit. There will NOT be a next visit. My advice, do not stay in this hotel until construction is complete and warn your friends.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Hyatt Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: FridayTravel
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel unless you are a fan of dirty rooms and inconvenience. The room was "recently remodeled" with "brand new carpet" that was heavily soiled by multiple drinks being spilled on it; the housekeeping staff said it was a problem with the carpetting vendor, I would guess it was a problem with Hyatt buying cheap carpet. Their are much better options for your money in San Diego; the ONLY things this hotel is convenient to is Sea World and the marina. If you want to explore the night life or go to many good restaurants you do not want to stay in the Mission Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here”
Reviews.Author: whatever017
Reviews.Content: Fist of all, it was our honeymoon. We had called down there several times to check about the "wildfires". At no time did anyone inform us about the MAJOR reconstruction going on. Just an "everything is fine, come on down". And we did inform them it was our honeymoon on several occassions. The website is a total false advertisement. The only renovations are with the room decor. No pool, No restaurant, No lounge, No nothing. We heard several comments from other people walking around at how horrible it was. Caution tape and 7 foot plywood construction walls up everywhere. The only way we knew anything is from this webiste. Needless to say we checked out immediately. Pretty bad when the hotel staff at the pseudo lobby-valet area says "Yeah we don't blame you one bit". Also why do I have to pay to park when the lot is completely empty? Customer service 1-800 was understanding enough, but didn't really offer us much in the way of any type of compensation. Think twiced about this place. No way is 4 stars or is it remotely close to being done like their website states.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: josiepops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for three nights at the end of our recent California trip. Location The location of the hotel was ok. I expected more of Mission Bay to be accessible on foot but we soon realised that if we wanted to go anywhere from the hotel it was by car. Walking around the harbour from the hotel was nice but there is only so far to walk. The hotel is about 10mins drive from downtown and about 15mins to La Jolla. The Mission Bay beaches are a couple of mins. Check - In Check in was ok - I think the girl was new - although we didn't receive any info about the hotel and the room had no info on what restaurants/bars where on site, info about the spa or general facilities of the hotel. I think the Hyatt could improve in this area as they are really undermarketing themselves Rooms We had room 1011 which had amazing views over the harbour. The rooms itself was huge - the biggest by far that we have ever stayed in. It was newly refurbished and you could tell. The bed (wow) was super comfy and the sofa and furnishings were all top notch. The bathroom as well was amazing. As far as hotel rooms go this is the best one I have ever stayed in. The only note I would make is corporate feel to the place. As soon as you enter the room you are faced with "this costs $10 and this costs $x" making it loose the personal feel. Spa We had a lovely 'couples spa' as an extra treat. The Spa has also been renovated as the facilities were fantastic. The rain fall shower was the most amazing shower I have ever day. Day beds in the relaxation room would have been great but other than that I can't complain. What I can complain about however was the 18% gratuity that I was charged with on my checkout bill. I apparently signed for this but I honest don't remember. It made an extravagent treat feel really expensive. Pool I was also disappointed with the fact that the pool complex which the website before booking said would be fixed in Sept 07 was no-where near finished. This was one of the deciding factors of booking this hotel so I was really fed up to find some of the outdoor space a building site. Luckily our room did not look out on to this and reception took $100 off the bill but it still should not have been incorrect on their website. Tourist stuff We ate at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse which was fantastic. We didn't realise it was quite as upmarkets and pricey as it was (we needed to dress up a bit more) but the rib eye steak was just amazing. We also ate at The Spot in La Jolla which I would def recommend for a good American restaurant/bar and Red Lobster which was great food but a little more 'big chain' than I was expecting. Seaport village is worth a visit as it San Diego Zoo (pandas!) and the Gaslamp Quarter. The Horton Plaza was ok for shopping too. My favourite place without doubt was La Jolla and if we ever visit again I would stay here. It's just what I imagined San Diego to be like.... palm trees, boutiques, restaurants, beach, parks. You MUST visit this place to see the nicest part of San Diego. Overall I would definitely book this hotel just for the rooms alone. Location wise you are in the middle of lots of places - you just have to drive to them all!

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, but think about the geography”
Reviews.Author: PeterPickles
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was clean, well run with friendly staff. The renovations are nearly complete and did not impact on our stay. The issue to be considered when choosing this hotel is geography. The hotel is used for conferences and trade gatherings, and if you are planning to attend such an event the hotel is prefect. If, however, you are visiting San Diego as a tourist then you need to consider the following. The hotel is within walking distance of Sea World (15 minutes) and Belmont Park Amusements and Pacific Beach (25 minutes). It is, however, a fair way out of San Diego city. If you are intending to hire a car, then its location is not too much of an issue. If you are not, however, you will need to catch a bus (No.9) and then the trolloy bus (blue line) to get to San Diego city, which can take 40 minutes. Around the hotel there is also a paucity of restaurants and hardly any shops. Popping out to the local drugstore is a non-starter as there is not one anywhere near. To sum up if at a conference, or looking to spend some time at Sea World or Pacific Beach then this hotel is fine. If you have business in the City of San Diego then there are probably other hotels (including another Hyatt) in the centre which would better serve your purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, except fot the construction”
Reviews.Author: abolanowski
Reviews.Content: We booked a ocean-view king and when we arrived (at 4:30pm) it was "not ready" so we were given the option of a one-BR suite overlooking the marina. The change wasn't a big deal and the room was fine (not in the main building, but rather in the one when the pseudo-lobby is). I agree with what previous posters have said about the parking situation. The valet area was empty but I still had to park across the street in the tiny garage - very irritating. The water pressure in the tub/shower was abysmal, not sure why because it was torrential in the sink. The service was very pleasant and the food from room service was delicious and there was a great variety, but it was EXPENSIVE. $75 for a salad, pasta with shrimp and a kid's meal hot dog. ouch. We ended up eating 3 meals from room service because there is nothing else within walking distance and I hated walking to the garage! The hotel was sooo convenient to Sea World, although in retrospect, the proximity probably didn't matter. It's not like Disney where minutes count. It would have been nice to have the pool finished, but other than that, I'm not sure if the construction actually affected the stay.

Reviews.Title: “How you view your stay will depend a lot on you....”
Reviews.Author: Insideinfo77
Reviews.Content: This is being written as we leave the property. Some would know this place as the former Hyatt Islandia. Right now it's a torn-up mess. If you are interested in a normal hotel stay, this is not the place to come for a while. It's torn up, spread out, inconvenient, and many amenities are either lacking or a pain to use. Think of it more as an apartment near some restaurants and you get the idea. A few examples: If you want to swim, you can be taken 3/4 of a mile by van to a private athletic club. It's neither convenient nor capable of being anything other than an excursion--although they will take and pick you up on demand. No easy independence for anyone in your group. You have to plan to take everything you will need with you. Forget something and ..... The hotel has decided to allocate about 95% of the surface parking for their extra-price valet parking. There are VERY few spots left for anyone who doesn't want to pay that fee, yet 80% of the valet spots are VACANT. There is additional "self-park" across a road. Guest-friendly? You decide. If you stay in the tower you are going to walk a fairly short distance with wooden siding hiding the construction areas on one side because you have to walk around the back to get to the elevators to your room. There has been no noticeable construction noise but we are on the other side of the hotel. It's hard to convey the feeling one gets during the walk, but in summary it's not a good feeling. There isn't a trash can in sight. Period. Not inside, not outside. Not in the hotel hallways, not anywere. If you want to dispose of any litter, well....good luck. They installed new built-in furniture in the room and there is a built-in set of electric plugs on the vertical wall that is part of the desk unit. Unfortunately when they spec'd the placement of the electric/computer plugs, they set the box too low on the wall and many cell phone chargers and other chargers cannot be plugged in because the charger power unit can only be plugged in one direction and there's no room for the charger plug to fit in and be electrified. There is nothing in the room tower but rooms. No lobby, no real service (there is a small gift shop, however). If you want to go to the lobby or desk, you go out the back of the tower, walk around the multi-story tower, walk across the parking lot and in another building. It's more like staying in a really tall motel that's spread out without any cohesiveness. To get to the hotel none (not ONE) of the guiding signs off I-5 /I-8 say anything but "Hyatt Islandia"and that is not where you think you are staying. The current name isn't anywhere, even when you are right next to the hotel. It's confusing and ridiculous. We stopped at the hotel for directions from what we thought was a sister property, only to find out that the signage was all wrong and we were at the hotel. That's inexcusable and an example of inattention to guest needs, poor planning and poor management. There are some good/neutral points: The employees have obviously been trained, trained, trained to be "cheerful" during the renovations. The rooms have some size to them (at least in the tower) and the bathrooms are reasonably sized. The televisions are decent or better. Summary: "usually" we enjoy Hyatts and we've stayed at a lot of them. The overall quality is generally higher than many other mid-market chains. We think this property is only suitable for guests who are "just glad to be here." It's not what we expected and what many would expect. Your mileage may vary. The rates are certainly not reflective of what they are delivering. The value is "not good."

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again..but not yet!”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and painless, however finding our room was another matter. the hotel is virtually a construction zone, so after unsuccesfully trying to find our room, we where finally led by one of the employees to the back end of the hotel , in one of the 2 story units, WHICH IS STILL UNDER CONSTRUCTION. The building looked like it was abandoned. A motel6 would have been nicer. The pool is closed, and a new one is under construction. Afer complaining to the front desk they put us up in the main tower, which for the life of me I don't know why they did not do it in the first place. The room was on the 6th floor with a nice view of the bay, however right below, is a construction zone. Luckily for us it was a weekend so it was quiet. Beware if you plan to stay there on weekdays. On the bright side, the rooms are very nicely decorated, beds are comfortable and the bathroom is large. The bar downstairs has a nice feel to it and the drinks and service is exceptional. Overall the hyatt looks promising for the near future, but for now I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: MaMaCee
Reviews.Content: Although still under construction, the weekend was quiet. We stayed in an ocean view upper floor room and the view and sunset were really beautiful. The Blue Ray dining was great for both breakfast and dinner. Sandro, our server, was awesome! In fact everyone was great. We really enjoyed our dinner, especially the salad with the praline pecans and dried cranberries. Their steak was very good also. The outdoor terrace was wonderful for breakfast. Nice view and barking sea lions to entertain us as we ate. The rooms were renovated and modern. Our small v-shaped patio was had very comfortable chairs and we enjoyed sitting there many times. The location is easy to get to from the airport, very close to Sea World and very convenient to drive to La Jolla. The pool is not finished but looks like it will be very nice when finished. We miss it already and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this stylish hotel even during its transition”
Reviews.Author: xxuviolkd
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a reunion. We had a junior suite. We requested a king, but got a full, but MAN was it comfortable! Our room was very clean, hip and sophisticated, which was fortunate since we hosted two impromptu parties. Bellman and valet exceeded our expectations. It was disappointing that we arrived during the 3rd quarter of the OU/Texas game and were told there wasn't a TV in the lounge; but we watched the game in our suite on TWO plasmas, and the right team one. ;) I would definitely stay here again for the right occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but won't return”
Reviews.Author: ALSB
Reviews.Content: We staying in the Marina Suite this past weekend. The renovations are very nice. Here's a quick list of pro's & con's: PRO- close to SeaWorld & PB (by car), two parks close by for those with kids (by car), nicely renovated rooms, very friendly staff CON - rooms on the marina are noisy (boats launch around 5 am!), rooms aren't dark enough at night (had to cover windows with blankets, blinds weren't enough), front living rooms (facing parking lot) are loud due to car parking and hallway noise, not walking distance to anything other than the Dana Point hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have all be rennovated”
Reviews.Author: ace678
Reviews.Content: The rennovation work on the rooms was complete when we arrived in late August, though they are still working on the lobby and the pool area. We had an excellent tower room with a great view of the Sea World fireworks. The staff was helpful and friendly in every way and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cruisinkitkat
Reviews.Content: First let me say, this hotel is great. We booked via Priceline and when I first read the reviews, I was a little hesitate and the fact it was under construction made me more nervous. Needless to say I had no reason to be worried. I called an hour after booking and requested an oceanview room. They said they would try and get me that room. We checked in at 3:30 pm and again requested a ocean view room, not only did they get us the room they upgraded us to a suite with an ocean view. The hotel is undergoing construction but it never bothered us. The pool and restuarants are not in use right now, but you can use the pool acroos at the Dana Inn and it was great. The room was all new. From bedding to bathroom. We had a little living room, a desk and a bedroom that was separated by a curtain. We had two 32" flat screen TV's. The bathroom was nice. The staff was great and always helpful. I would stay here again and plan to book again when their new pool opens. We had a nice size balcony with nice furniture. Don't let the reviews scare you, this is a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Musty rooms, will not return”
Reviews.Author: Applejax
Reviews.Content: The room had a nice view of the water but when we purchased on Hotwire the description sounded like it was right on the ocean. It was more like a harbor view but we couldn't see much because it was overcast during our stay. The room had really old carpet that made my socks dirty. Everything just felt dank and musty including the old bedding and the air. There was also not much lighting so it was dark in the room. There had been some updates to the bathroom which made that area pretty clean but it was not well-ventilated. The room itself was oversized, with a large table and wetbar (shown in picture). The layout would have potential for entertaining if the decor were upgraded. The worst part of our stay was the parking. The lot would fill up quickly so we often had to park in an overflow garage across the street. Even there, it was difficult to find an available spot. We booked this room last minute for Labor Day weekend so we did not have many options. If we return to San Diego we will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT UNDER CONSTRUCTION”
Reviews.Author: lovecali31
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online through the San Diego Zoo. They had the option to get a ticket for the zoo and book a room through their site which me and my boyfriend did. This website did NOT tell us about the MAJOR construction going on at this hotel!! When we arrived the front desk was stationed in another building. I asked about the pool and the the guy behind the desk told us it was under construction, not that big of a deal, but there were no resturants and the place is pretty much deserted. Felt that i should have recieved a voucher to come back for a free stay for when they actuallyhave a completed hotel. I did let the managment know i was annoyed because noone let me know of the construction and that pretty much the entire place is off limits, and we were upgraded to a very nice room. If not for that, I would have been extremly dissapointed. Soo if you dont mind not having a pool or a resturant or a bar then its a nice place, o and you can use the pool across the street, but its not that nice. I just wish i would have been told about the major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of construction and inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: PGarcia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Islandia for two nights to attend a business meeting. As has been noted by other reviewers, this property is undergoing a major renovation and it is a construction site with all the usual inconveniences -- passageways are blocked off, noise from the work going on, limited amenities. If you don't mnd any of these distractions, you will be OK here. While I am not at all fussy or persnickety about accommodations, I think this hotel would be better off closing entirely until the renovation is complete. I have stayed here before and enjoyed it very much. With the renovation going on, a guest has to contend with a "restaurant" set up in one of the ballrooms, with a limited menu. The lobby is in a temporary location and the buildings with the guest rooms are in various stages of construction. There is no pool at the hotel (unspeakable in San Diego!) and guests have to go to a nearby hotel if they want a swim. My room was in the Tower, and was one of the newly renovated rooms. It was very nicely appointed, with Art Deco style furniture, a flat screen TV, and a balcony (Which I couldn't use during the day because of the noise and dust of the construction), but had no coffeemaker. You should also know that this hotel is out on the Bay, and is a $25 or so cab ride to downtown San Diego, making it one of the more inconvenient places to stay right now if you get cabin fever. Once the renovation is complete, the hotel is supposed to be a luxury resort with $300 per night rooms. I will probably not stay here ever again, in that case. I should also note that the hotel staff performed their duties with great courtesy and professionalism despite all the racket and confusion going on.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: calgrad
Reviews.Content: Let's just say, that I hope everything gets better once the construction is over. The customer service is horrible...the room service is the only department that works. Their restaurant is a converted conference room...they should mention it on their site. The construction is loud and painters were walking down the hallways...one Hyatt employee was placing dabs of paste on the wall. The worst part of all, was that the whole point of staying here was to take the Water Taxi to Sea World. Unless you get the Sea World tickets at their front desk, you can't take the water taxi. So don't buy the tickets on travelocity or through sea world. You have to have the ticket in hand. What's the point of the perk if it's only for the Hyatt's convenience. The room was remodeled...well, not 5 star. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean, but the 32-inch LCD they mention on the site is not high definition unless you order pay channels on their menu. The quality is even worse than regular cable. I would hold off on staying here until the construction is over. Then, it may be a four-star resort. At this point in time, Hyatt is trying to survive construction by making the guests stay in jackhammer zone.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We didn't Cancel Our reservation”
Reviews.Author: smithclan5
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip for our grandchildren to take them to SeaWorld and surrounding attractions. We had made our reservations on the hotel website and were aware of the construction going on. I read the reviews on this website and came extremely close to cancelling our reservation and going to another property. I contacted the hotel directly and asked them about the construction noise and if our room had been renovated. I was informed that our room was located in a part of the property that had been completed and we would not be bothered by the noise. The pool would not be open but, they would shuttle us to another property if we wanted to go swimming. We decided that would be an acceptable option. I did hear complaints from some guests re: being awakened each morning by the construction at 6:00am. My husband is an early riser and says the construction workers didn't show up until 7:00am. We did hear the boats starting up around 6:00am but, that is to be expected as we were right on the marina. The entire staff could not have been more helpful. We had a wonderful room. The grandkids loved the flat screen tv and could see the SeaWorld fireworks each night from the hotel. We had plenty of room for all to enjoy. As we made our reservations on line, we were given a free breakfast for 2 each day of our stay, so the great breakfast buffet was only $29.00 for the 5 of us. (we spent at least $50 per day for hotdogs and chicken strips with drinks for lunch at SeaWorld). We all had great fun meeting other guests on the water taxi trip each day to SeaWorld for only $1 per person round trip. All-in-all, we will always remember this trip and My husband and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not for families”
Reviews.Author: spamdoggy
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel will be very nice once the major renovations they are doing are completed. However, for our family, we were quite disappointed. We had looked forward to spending some relaxing time at the pool upon arrival - - until we realized we would have to cross 4 lanes of traffic to get to the pool. The Hyatt pool was not open, so they have partnered with a very nice hotel across the street to "pool share". Although the Hyatt does offer transportation across the highway to the pool, this scenario did not fit in with our plans. At check-in, we were "upgraded" to a suite. We had reserved a room with 2 queens and the one we got had a king and a pull-out sofa. It was pretty obvious that the room had not been prepared for us - - towels for one (we had three people), one small trash can in the suite), and some of the shampoos,etc were half-used. In addition, the bathroom had no towel racks or tub , but was nicely fitted for travelers needing handicapped access. I will say that the front desk was willing to make accommodations for us (switch rooms, brought more towels promptly as well as bed linens for the rollaway when we asked),but we will not stay here again. This hotel would be fine for the business traveler, but certainly not for a family wanting to use the pool. In addition, there was a general air of stress at the front desk. While waiting to speak with someone at the front desk, another man stormed out as he yelled at the front desk person. Parking was expensive (even self-park) - - the breakfast was $20.00 per person - - we had two free breakfasts, but we had three people.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: LAanni
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay at this hotel! Husband and I needed a last minute one night stay on Memorial day weekend. All I could come up with was this hotel for the price of $239. We had stayed here before and had enjoyed our stay so decided it was worth the splurge. WRONG! Whole hotel is remodeling. Everything is a mess! Check out area is relocated in a very small lobby with only two clerks. There was a LONG line out the door trying to check in so we left and went to go get a bite and had to come back to check in. Room we stayed in had no hot water all evening, no coffee maker and they charge for EVERYTHING - from a water bottle in the fridge ($4.95) to parking (self - $14, valet -$16 per nite) and internet ($9.95 per day). Parking area is small and slots are tight! If i could give this hotel a zero I would!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place--it's a dirty, noisy construction site”
Reviews.Author: david_in_boston
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hyatt Regency Islandia (Mission Bay) in San Diego. I was there for a conference, and the Islandia was one of the hotels used to house convention registrants. This was one of the most disappointing and inconvenient hotel stays I've had in a long, long time. Let me say at the outset that the staff of the Islandia were unfailingly courteous and friendly. No doubt the conditions at the Islandia have been extremely difficult for them. No, this is a prime example of very, very poor management, reflective of a genuine contempt for their guests. The Islandia is basically a construction site with rooms, not a functioning hotel. Let me detail some of the inconveniences: 1. The construction noise -- and it is quite loud -- starts very early in the morning. My room was so noisy that I couldn't even hold a phone conversation. I had to ask to use a courtesy room during the afternoon to do some work. (There are no common areas or rooms because of the construction. No open areas, no nothin'!) 2. I did not bring a laptop, figuring I could access e-mail through the hotel business center or TV Internet. Wrong!!! Of course, whatever business center previously existed is now part of the construction site. The TV Internet did not work in my room or in the courtesy room I used one afternoon. 3. The one small available restaurant on site was so packed in the morning that I had to order room service and spend extra money to do so. Of course, I could've made a L-O-N-G walk to the hotel across the highway, given that I didn't rent a car, but I decided to splurge on room service instead. 4. Guests received a note under their doors informing us that on Tuesday, May 22, there would be NO WATER for most of the day because of "emergency" repairs. 5. The next day we received another letter under our doors, instructing us that locks were being changed and we MUST report to the front desk to get new key cards. 6. The hotel site is dirty and cramped. After checking into a makeshift check-in desk, you walk outside with your bags, following a dirty "red carpet" (Hah--how ironic!) that takes you through part of the construction site, scaffolding and all, to an elevator bank that takes you right to your room. 7. There appears to be absolutely no acknowledgement on the part the hotel management that this is such an inconvenient and unpleasant place to stay. The letters they give to guests, explaining once inconvenience or another, are written in a sort of insulting, insincere "happy speak," as if they were informing us that some minor amenity, such as mints left on your pillow, could not be provided. This is a hotel that obviously is into making a buck in the midst of a gut rehab. Stay away unless you want to be deeply disappointed and pay high rates for less than Motel 6 amenities. I have stayed in plenty of budget hotels during my time and don't expect 5 star service every time. But this is place, at these prices, is an insult.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms top notch”
Reviews.Author: in2xtc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Islandia and had been told upon making reservations that extensive construction was ongoing. We were fortunate enough to be given a renovated Jr Suite in the Tower section. It is true that the hotel has no real lobby and that all public areas on the property are torn up but if you go in knowing that, there should be no real complaints. Check in was smooth, no problems or attitude from the staff. The new Junior Suite is beautiful and very modern. Very comfortable living room area with sectional sofa and chaise, flat screen TV and work desk and chair. Balcony is fairly spacious with rattan furnishings with thick padded cushions. Bedroom area is separated from the living area with a wispy curtain which makes it look very tropical. Bedding was great. At this time, no TV in the bedroom but it appears that there will be a flat screen in there as well. Bathroom had a large shower but no tub. Hopefully they will remember to put in the soapdish in the shower and the robe hook that were missing. Construction noise really wasn't an issue since we were gone all day but it did start around 700am. I don't know when the whole complex will be complete, I would suspect Sept or Oct not summer but it looks as though it will be wonderful resort when all is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting and dirty hotel! Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: CABeachTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Hyatt Islandia in order to attend a one-day seminar. Why did I book at a Hyatt--because it is a Hyatt! I thought I would have a little relaxation and treat myself; however, when I arrived the hotel was under MAJOR construction. The reception area appeared to be "make-shift"; I had to walk down the outside portside area about 200 yards to find a "hole" in the construction fence in order to access the elevator, which was by the service entrance. I went up to the 12th floor and arrived in my room. The room overlooked construction and rows of garbage dumpsters that were overflowing. I wanted to read--the light by the couch did not work. I turned on all of the lights in the room in order to do some written work I had to complete, and looked at the couch. It was FILLED with stains. I opened up the middle drawer of the dresser to put some clothes away, and found a dirty napkin and food in the drawer! My eyes were drawn to the carpet by the bed--it, too, was filled with large stains. That made me take a look at the bedspread (that had been turned down). The bedspread was not only covered in stains, it had large areas of encrusted chunky material embedded in it! I took all sorts of photos with my cell phone camera, stormed down to the manager, and demanded my money back. They were nice, although a bit hesitant--until I showed them the photos. Then they were willing to give me anything I wanted. What I wanted was to never stay in a hotel again. I drove the 2 1/2 hours home, arrived at 3:15 in the morning, and was soooo happy to be away from that filthy place. I have sent a letter and a copy of the photos to the Hyatt Corporation, and the Health Department in San Diego. Even though I prepaid through Priceline, my money was refunded in full; according to Priceline, it was due to the extenuating circumstances" of my visit. I have NEVER experienced anything like this in a hotel before, and there is NO excuse for it.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out Before checking In!”
Reviews.Author: janetwins
Reviews.Content: Under construction to the max! The lobby is like an elevator waiting area. There is no where to sit, people cramped outside and in. Staff tries to be helpful but are short on patience and it shows through even though they try to hide it. A hike accross contruction area to get to the elevator which is in a hallway and sometimes doesn't work. I asked for the stairs- they are worse and aren't appropriate for those without hardhats. The place should close until it's really ready. The room we stayed in was nice- new and spacious with a nice shower- no toilet paper holder- just the roll on the counter. The mattress was excellent- sheets stiff and course. The MOST bad part is the noise- Daytime- starting at dawn- air planes overhead then it progresses to jackhammers all day! They reverburate through the whole place. It's not unlike a teeth chattering experience. I checked out early due to this daytime noise. Also while they hotel does give a 15$ ticket for a cab to the airport- one crooked cabbie told us that it had gone up and was now 18$. No tip- figured he got his on top of the hotel subsidy. To get a shuttle requires 24hrs advance notice. Seems odd- and the only "name brand-fine" hotel in I've ever stayed that didn't accommodate with shuttle service. The restaurant food was poor and crappy coffee. Waitress offered to make a new cup- she had been watching to see if I was actually going to DRINK that crap coffee. All in all- wait till it's done to stay here. Oh yes, there is NO pool at present- one has to take a shuttle accross the street to the other hotel to swim. Not worth the price. And nothing seems to be done to make up for the lack of ammenities and poor hotel atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Its good that I changed my mind!”
Reviews.Author: yzquie
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to book our week long stay in this hotel but opted out. My best friend who made her reservations from Toronto stayed here and she was misled. She only found out about the renovations when she arrived! MAJOR renovations and for the prce per night? It is ridiculous. This hotel should have made their guests' stay more pleasant by offering park tickets or discounts to park tickets and free parking. Since it is being renovated, the lobby looks like a 2 star hotel. We waited forever for our food since the kitchen is not located in the restaurant itself (our waitress even had her shades when she served us since she had to walk to pick up our food), Construction and tractor noises during the day, and NO WATER from 9 to 4 pm (one day). If you want to be relaxed on your vacation don't go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: BirdieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative comments on trip advisor about the Hyatt Islandia we were a little hesitant about staying there. We even considered cancelling our reseration. We're so glad we went. When we called to make reservations, we were told that the hotel was undergoing some extensive renovations: there was only one restaurant open and the pool area was closed. However, the hotel did make arrangements for pool use at two other locations. When we arrived, we were very pleased. Yes, there is construction but it didn't affect our stay at all. We had a BEAUTIFUL room on the 9th floor of the tower. It had just been redone. All new carpeting, furniture, bathroom, towels etc. The view of the water was gorgeous from our patio. The entire staff was pleasant and helpful. If we had one complaint, it would be that you must valet park your car. At $15.00 per day plus tip we think that's too pricey. Hopefully, when the renovations are complete, the hotel will have free self-parking available. We'd stay at the Hyatt Regency Islandia in San Diego in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the building site”
Reviews.Author: GRoss1806
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short break in San Diego at the Hyatt Regency Islandia. Please be aware that the hotel is currently being renovated and I'd suggest that you should avoid it until the work is finished later this summer. We were wakened by the working hammering and banging in the room above us at 07:00. There's no swimming pool, although arrangements have been made to use one at a nearby hotel. I'm sure it will be great when the work is completed, but in the meantime I'd avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “This Would Have Been Great...If It Had Been A Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: Hearing that this is a Hyatt property might have you led to believe that this will meet the high standards of most hotels under that name - but don't be fooled. As soon as you drive up to this decrepit hotel on Mission Bay, you will realize that this is not your typical Hyatt Regency. What gives it away? Could it be the dreary entrance framed by dumpy two story buildings that house the executive offices and (gasp!)guest rooms? Or could it be the dark, archaeic lobby with the employees who look like there are a million other places they would rather be? And things don't improve when you get to you room. If you are lucky enough to be placed in the tower, you will find smelly hallways and doors to the guest rooms with mermaids on them! Once in the guest room, you will want to remove the comforter from the bed while wearing latex gloves. If you can overlook the stained carpeting, you will have a jolly old time. Now, admittedly, this hotel is not dirty. In fact, it looks to be well cared for by housekpeeing and grounds people. But it is so old and 1970's-looking, you will feel dirty. It's like a Holiday Inn from 1971 that has never been renovated. Not only is this an old hotel WAAAAY past its prime. It is also extremely creepy. The hallways and lobby are deserted and the rooms feel almost haunted. My friend and I were not at all comfortable sleeping here. Eventually, we got so tired we fell asleep. But, that was after a couple hours of laying awake listening to creaking and banging from the boats and flagpoles out by the marina. To add insult to injury, my mom and dad came to San Diego to visit after I had moved there. I told them to request the Hyatt Regency (downtown), but their travel agent put them at this one instead by mistake. I was so embarrassed that this was their introduction to my town. They were appalled by this joint. Don't stay here if you are used to a "normal" Hyatt. With rooms that start at around $289/night, this hotel is a big, big waste of money. In fact, avoid Mission Bay altogether. Stay downtown at a real hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: dmcnamara
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 young sons stayed at the Hyatt Islandia over the Presidents Day Weekend. The grounds seem pretty enough - that is if they weren't covered up in tarps and construction material. The staff was very professional , but I could detect in many of them that they were a bit sheepish about the extensive remodeling. It seemed they were tired of handling complaints. Complaints from my stay included no HOT water (was told by manager to run my tub for 10-15 minuted until it warmed up), no pool (Had to use the one across the street at the Dana Hotel), only valet parking (gets expensive tipping for each in/out), no other restaurant/bar than the small bistro next to the marina, dusty room, rusty bathroom fixtures and old, frayed and dirty bedspreads, bedskirts. I've stayed at many Hyatts (Grands, Regencys, Resorts) over the years and find them to be a top notch chain. This was a very disappointing surprise. With such an extensive renovation in progress, it would behoove them to shut the place down until it's done. If they keep it open during the renovation, then price the rooms accordingly...something along the lines of a 2 STAR hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mitrovich
Reviews.Content: Great location. Took the more expensive bay view at $165 AAA rate. Worth it for a longer stay. Furnishings and accommodations were price appropriate. Super gym equipment in fitness center. Personnel and the overall guest relations were excellent. Felt a little pinched by the $10 charge for interrnet connection and $20 for a pot of coffee. The coffee was good but I'm not sure that good. Then again, maybe I don't get out that much, after all it is California. They tell me a major refurbishment is underway for the rooms and amenities. Suggested booking by July 2007 to get the new rooms at the old rates, else rooms will be more expensive later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Plain yet comfy”
Reviews.Author: silver-riesling
