Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline at an excellent rate. My husband and I got a marina-view tower room on the 6th floor (non-smoking floor). The room wasn't fancy, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was of a good size, and I liked the granite countertop and nice water pressure in the shower. Since our room was right next to the elevators, the noise was quite annoying, but we managed to sleep ok. There is a parking fee of $14 per night ($16 for valet), but we already knew that going in. There were plenty of parking spaces in the hotel's additional parking lot across the street. The area was nice and quiet, surrounded by water in all directions. If you want to avoid a hotel in busy downtown or Hotel Circle area, this will work. They're doing some renovations until next year, but I didn't see or hear anything. I've had limited interactions with the staff, but they were all friendly. All in all, we had a pleasant stay at Hyatt Regency Islandia. We will go back there if we could get a good rate again. But if we have to pay the rack rate, we would probably look for a place a bit more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and in need of renovations”
Reviews.Author: awc825
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego weekly for project work and have stayed in many hotels in the area. The Hyatt Islandia is a tired hotel in need of major renovations and does not really live up to the Hyatt brand. The door feels flimsy, the carpet feels dirty and the bathroom area feels outdated and old (the shower floor has wore stains, for instance). For about the same price, you can stay 5-10 minutes up the I-5 at the much more modern Hyatt La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned and outdated”
Reviews.Author: elizabethh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband nd 3 children aged 13, 14, nd 16 from 25th to 30th July. My husband and I were given room in the tower on about the 3rd floor. It was dirty and outdated and every morning at 9 am noisy building work woke us up. They were replacing the balconies on all floors and all the dust and dirt covered our balcony, which overlooked the pool. The children were put in another building in quite a cramped room for 3. We paid £300 each night for 2 rooms. Thought this was extortionate for such an outdated accomodtion. the hotel, however is in a good location, but you need a car whilst staying there. Would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “outdated”
Reviews.Author: wrhaner
Reviews.Content: For a Hyatt property, it is really outdated. Bathrooms had cracked tile and wallpaper was falling off the wall. Room was ok at best. I will not stay at the property again, for the money you can find much nicer places....

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay by the Bay”
Reviews.Author: clint52
Reviews.Content: It appears there is a wide range of previous reviews and this one will fall onto the positive side. The wife and I decided to have a "weekend-getaway" to San Diego and chose the Hyatt mostly due to it's location to Sea World and a place called MIssion Beach where we were to meet up with a few friends. We had a most delightful time and the Hyatt played a major part. So here are the pluses for us followed by some notes that others might feel could have an impact on their staying here: 1) We checked in at 3PM not realizing the check-in time is 4PM but were still given a room right away by a very polite desk clerk. 2) Our room was just what we asked for(Ocean view with a balcony) and it fit our needs. The size was perfect for us and the bed was sooooo comfortable. We slept very well not only due to the bed but we were perhaps lucky that we had quiet neighbors as we only heard the sounds coming from the Bay area. All in all, we appreciated what we were given. 3) The pool and jacuzzi were very nice. Towels were readily available as was cocktail service. Though we were there on a weekend, we had no trouble finding a lounge chair or room in the jacuzzi. 4) We had breakfast included in our plan. I can't say it was the best ever but having stayed at other Hyatts, it was just what we expected. For the uninitiated, the buffet and service is acceptable, no less, no more. My wife though was pleasantly surprised that the smoked salmon she had the morning she opted out of the buffet was better than expected. 5)The hotel sells Sea World tickets for about $6 less than when you buy at the park itself. But verify with the concierge about specials at Sea World. She pointed out to us that they were having a AAA special and the tickets were even cheaper so I am glad this was pointed out. 6) Overall, this place was just fine and the weekend price we paid of about $235 per night(incl. breakfast) seemed to be in line with what that gets you anywhere on a summer weekend in San Diego. Now some notes that I guess might make this place less-than-perfect for some of you a. No shuttle to Sea World. We were surprised we had to drive considering the location is the reason so many choose to stay here. b. Our room had a shower stall only. For two adults, it was fine but with small children it might be good to verify beforehand. c. Parking lot fills up, especially if there is a special event in one of the halls. Be ready to do some searching for spots unless you like valet. The charge is $14 per night, a little more for valet Also note the spaces are spaced more for compact cars. Be careful entering and backing out of spots, not much room between rows. d. One couple remarked their balcony on the marina side was closed due to some remodeling going on. It did not impact us. e. I see some reviews talking about the hotel being dated. A person we know from there thinks the place may have been around since the late 60's or very early 70's so it seeming dated would not be surprising. Fortunately, everything in our room was clean and in working order so the age of the building had no impact on us. I am sure there are plusher and newer hotels but we were very satisfied and had a relaxing 3-day-2-night stay. .

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated on Hotwire...”
Reviews.Author: anonymousmac
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hotel at a rate of 150 a night on hotwire. I was soon scared of my stay here based on the reviews on this site. We checked in around 4 pm (a couple of days before I had requested a tower room, they had told me since I had purchased the room from a third party, my room preference cannot be guaranteed). At check in, once again, I requested a tower room, they told me that since all their standard rooms had been sold out, they would upgrade me to no charge to a tower room. (The feeling I got here, was that they were unwilling to upgrade me at all costs. They only upgraded me because there were no more rooms, not because I had asked for it in advance. Our first room was on the 11th floor facing the bay (poolside) We got in and the room was a little humid, and felt stuffy. This room was obviously dated, with fixtures that look they were from the 1980s. The room was large, featuring a small sink and generous counter space, (it looked like a place in the room where you would place food when hosting guests) the view of the bay and pool was great but we preferred a room facing the marina (facing seaworld) They upgraded us once again to a room on the 15th floor. This room looked more updated albeit a little smaller. We did not mind at all, what mattered was that this room looked newer. there were fireworks around 10 at night, although short, it was an okay show. Also from our room facing the marina, we could get a view of downtown San Diego and the planes taking off from the airport. There were maintenance problems to the room next to us, apparantly their shower was not draining. Hotel maintenance knocked on our door and asked if they could test out shower, luckily it was now clogged. I was not surprised with this maintanance problem after reading the previous reviews. As others had said also, the walls are very thin. This hotel is DATED, you can tell when you walk through the halls of the guest rooms. If you are looking for a nice hip place to stay, this is not it. Hotwire gave this hotel 3.5 stars, i would say that this hotel is deserving of 3 stars. Nothing from this hotel amazed me, or made it memorable. Service was great, the people are friendly, the grounds are nicely appointed. What ruined the stay was the room. I would ONLY stay here again if it was free, and if i decided to go to sea world. Im not going to say not to stay here, but I will say that it probably shouldn't be your first pick, unless you are going to sea world. Its isn't that bad, but its not the best place for a memorable stay. The only good thing about the room was the view. FYI: Valet Parking $16 (might be worth it, self parking can be difficult)Self Parking $14 Discount tickets for attractions are available at front desk. Wireless internet is 9.99 for 24 hours through T-mobile.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: psjr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four nights at this property. It was a VERY last minute trip for our daughter to visit Sea World. We normally stay at Paradise Point, but they were full. So I booked a corner, 1 bedroom suite on the 11th floor of the tower. When we arrived (the following day from making the reservation) we were informed that we could not open the balcony door due to renovations. I think they could have told me that when I made the reservation. Luckily, the balcony from the other room in the suite was ok, so we took it. Keep in mind that I paid full price of about 365.00 per night for this room. The shower head was not even attached to the wall so it banged and moved around when used. Carpet was dirty. No fridge at the "wet bar". In fact, the only thing wet about this bar was the inside of the cabinet under the sink from a previous leak. The remotes for the televisions did not work. All little things, but not something you would expect from a Hyatt property, or one that you pay $400.00 per night for. (with taxes and parking..another fee that they fail to tell you about.) The veiw is great. Wonderful to watch the Sea World fireworks from the balcony each night. The pool is ok, though somewhat small for the size of the property. Food in Blue Bay was adequate but nothing special. I would not recommend this property for anyone taking last minute trips and paying full price. If you can get it on priceline or somewhere as people have stated for around 100.00 or so it might be ok. All of the staff was friendly, except for the front desk personnel. They need a little dose of charm school.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: mamaziv
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after taking heed of the comments I read right here on trip advisor. lucky! so when i booked through expedia, i expressly requested a room in the tower, as opposed to the two-floor "marina rooms," which according to trip advisor members smell like mildew! the 8th-floor room was adequate, if a little basic. there was no mini-bar (or fridge), nor a safe in the room. there was, however, a coffee machine, which was a life-saver! the view was great, and we got to the seaworld fireworks each night at 9:50pm. there were, indeed, renovations going on on our side of the tower, although this did not actually disturb our stay. maybe because we were out of the hotel for most of our two days there. it's five minutes away from seaworld, which was nice and easy. the pool was a little on the small side, but seemed ok for our kids' needs. they also had a nice fish pond, which the kids enjoyed peering into and watching the big fish inside! the service was courteous and helpful, and they had a computer at the reception desk which we used to do our online early check-in for LAX flights. all in all, an average hotel. as long as you don't pay the high price, i would recommend it, as long as you request a tower room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hyatt Islandia”
Reviews.Author: golfnsail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Islandia the week of July 24th, and the hotel was great. The service was excellent and every request we had was promptly taken care of. The hotel is going through renovation but it's on the outside, it wasn't an issue. Ask for a tower room so you can enjoy the views. We went to the beach in Coronado which is a 15 minutes drive and it was a great clean family beach as compared to the Mission bay beach where you will run into some shady characters. There is a beach within walking distance (over the bridge) but it's on the bay (no waves). Overall I would definitely recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and a motel”
Reviews.Author: ddbhia
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Saturday night when the Comic Con convention was in town. We had booked on Priceline for $160/night so expected the 'Garden view' or motel type rooms. When checking in I asked for an upgrade but was told all rooms were sold out due to the convention. Upon entering our 'garden' room I noticed a strong moldy smell but thought it might be due to the air conditioning not being very cool (It was hot and humid in San Diego). When I took off my shoes, I noticed the carpet was soaked near the doorway. Back to the front desk I went and they found a room on the 15th floor that had had the carpets cleaned that day but we were told the had to be sure the carpets were dry before letting us have the room. After waiting a half-hour (we were tired but willing to wait) we got in the room. The room was nothing fancy, but the view was fabulous and allowed us to overlook a lot of room deficiencies. I would have been very upset had I paid the 'rack-rate' or had we had to stay in the 'garden view' room. The guy in front of me paid $293 and the rack rate on Saturday night was $303. The rooms were average to below average, but we felt fairly satisfied with the rate we paid with the view we had. As mentioned in other posts, they were doing construction on other rooms balconies, but that did not affect us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Old>>>>”
Reviews.Author: jayzam
Reviews.Content: Beware.. this is place is so old and dirty..when you walk on the carpet your socks will be black from the dirt..The rooms are in very bad shape and the mildew smell is overwhelming....

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: DeeChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: UNDER CONSTRUCTION- but they will not tell you that when you make a reservation. This major construction will last for possibly a year. What a dump! This place is like a motel 6 that needs renovation. They tried to give us their worst room (at a rate of $268 per night) which had the balcony closed for construction. After many requests we were switched the next day, but the room had so many problems. There was no furniture on the terrace, the terrace door did not close properly so we stopped using it, many lights were out of bulbs, the shower looked like it had not been updated for 20 years and the drain was crooked and broken, as was the toilet paper holder in the bathroom. Many parts of the room were not in good condition, in particular there were dangerous cracked tiles on the floor that were sticking up. By far the worst part was trying to enjoy swimming in the pool with the very extreme jackhammer noise and the dust above. Management acted like they were doing us a favor by even talking to us, but in fact they knew they have to "stick it" to whoever stays there, because it is obvious that there are major problems they are trying to minimize or deny. I often stay at Hyatt Hotels but will think twice about it after this experience. Most hotels will tell you if there is contruction going on at a hotel-how dare they not mention this major contruction!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sea World Hotel ~”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Sea World 6/23/06-6/25/06 with 3 year old twins. We chose this hotel for it's close location to Sea World and we couldn't have been happier. It was literally 3 minutes from the park. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating. The rooms were okay - not brand new but nice. We stayed in the main hotel - not the high rise rooms. Everything was fine except mid-june the humidity was brutal. It was way to cold for swimming - anything below 80 degrees is too cold for us (we live in Arizona). It was nice to be so close to the park, it made leaving mid afternoon to head back to the hotel for naps not a big ordeal. We chose to have room service for breakfast in order to avoid getting out early and fighting any crowds for breakfast. Food was excellant. Portions were HUGE. The second morning my hubby and I split one breakfast between us. The girls had pancakes which were out of this world. Room service is a little pricey but if you balance not having to leave and drive around the area to find somewhere it's pretty nice. Sea World was GREAT! We arrived as the park opened at 9am - I suggest getting there the earlier the better. All the animals are awake and being fed. You will not have to fight the crowds to see the exhibits. We ate at the ShipWreck Cafe for lunch and dinner. Great food - huge portions. For those with little ones - bring juice boxes - beverages are at least $2.65 and little ones tend not to drink a full size drink. My husband and I both had Cheeseburgers and they were great. Hand made patties - not frozen - with all the fixins. Huge portion of fries. Carrot cake was delicious. Best theme park food I have ever had. They also had salmon, a variety of salads, jumbayla, and chicken. We left the park around noon - came back at around 4pm to see some shows and wait for the fireworks. The Shamu show was great. But as in past reviews do not attempt to sit ANYWHERE in the soak zone. You will get SOAKED. Cold salt water. Not fun. We avoided that area. It's more appropriate for older kids that won't mind getting dumped on. The dolpin show was great. All shows run about 20 minutes so they aren't too long and can keep little one's attention. Lots of hands on exhibits for the kids. Stingrays, dolphins, and starfish. Finally the fireworks... they were a nice end to the day. The only hard part is sticking around to see them. Most of the animals are sleeping or mellowing out after a long day - so it was a little boring for the kids. But we really enjoyed our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: SwissG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Islandia. We didn't expect luxury, but we did expect a nice hotel. That's NOT what we got. The first room they put us in did not have balcony access due to construction so we asked to be moved to another room. This one had a balcony, but there was a horrible smell near the bathroom! Not a smoke smell, but more like urine. Really bad. I left the balcony doors open the entire stay and bought a $5 candle in the hotel gift shop to try and combat the odor. But the worst complaint is the beds! HORRIBLE. The bottom sheet was just a top sheet that was haphazardly tucked in, and the bed pad under the sheets was too small (perhaps for a twin bed), making the bed lumpy. Surely they could better ... at least with a hotel that carries the Hyatt Regency name. Staff was just OK. Some were very friendly. Others couldn't care less and showed it. Room service was outrageously expensive. Food was OK, but not worth the high prices. And beware: they tack on nearly 25 percent extra for service fees, etc. The pool was nice. Lots of chairs, several shaded. I would DEFINITELY advise travelers to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK....”
Reviews.Author: Webco
Reviews.Content: I just took my wife to the Islandia for our 10 year anniversary looking for a nice romantic get away. I booked 3 nights but cancelled the last night because we didn't see any purpose in staying. The hotel has a 17 story tower and a 3 story marina building (all suites). We stayed in a Jr. suite in the tower(14th floor). The view was great and the room was large with a balcony overlooking the marina and windows on the side looking south, down the coast. The room itself was nice enough but a little stark. If you elect to stay in one of the marina suites, be careful....there are two marina building right in front of them, partially or completely blocking the view of some of them. Make sure you get a room on the third floor, either in the middle of the building or at the very ends. We actually had a great time but not really because of the Hotel. It was OK, but I expected better. It's a little run down and in need of a face lift. Actually, they are in the middle of renovating the place, which brings me to my biggest gripe.... When I booked the room, I asked allot of questions about the rooms, their location, which ones had the best view etc. At no time did the guy tell me they were jack hammering and grinding away on both sides of the hotel tower, where our room was. This was a little annoying but we were not in the room much so it wasn't that big of a deal. The pool was nice, although it was a little hard to relax with all the noise. We ate dinner at the Islandia Coastal Grill, which was good, but not fantastic. We got a full breakfast with our room and that was probably the best part about our stay. The service at the Blue Ray restaurant was a little slow on the first day but the food was outstanding. My wife said the pancakes were the best she had ever had. My omelets were real good too. So, like I said, it was just an OK place but we still had a great time. I would suggest waiting 'till the construction is over before staying there though. Make sure you inquire about specials and discounts when you book too. That's how we got the Jr. Suite and free breakfast for only a couple bucks more than a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience at the Islandia”
Reviews.Author: Tassa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amenities (Restaurant, room service, workout facilities, pool) Did not use pool bit it looked nice. Did not use workout room. Ate at the Islandia Coastal Grill, only because it was on-site and we were exhausted from a day at SeaWorld. We were extremely pleasantly surprised and pleased with view, service and food. Food presentation was beautiful, and food itself was very good. Even the kids meals came nicely presented, which just delighted my children. The next morning we ordered room service breakfast (a first for our kids), and the food was just as great. We ordered Eggs Benedict, Ham and Eggs, Sticky Bun french toast, and waffles. Again everything was presented very nicely and tasted great. Hotel Room We stayed in the 9th floor of the tower, with a marina view and 2 queen beds. We were not charged anything extra, even though we were paying a Hotwire price of $109.00. The room was plenty spacious for my family of four (2 kids aged 10 and 7). The beds were comfortable, as well as the pillows. The ceiling was the old acoustic ceiling type material; the wait staff told us they were going to be renovating soon. My only complaint would be the bathroom: fan was very noisy, lighting poor, and showerhead needed upgrading. But adequate for our needs. Room was clean, and did not smell. Yes, decor needs updating, and a more luxurious feel if you are going to pay full rates - - but not "disgusting" by any means. Location We picked the Islandia mainly due to its proximity to SeaWorld, which we were attending for 2 days. Its proximity to the water, I-8 and I-5 made it appealing as well. We also chose the Islandia because we got a good Hotwire price and it was tagged a Customer favorite on that site. Staff From the front desk to the concierge to the restaurant staff, everyone was extremely friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: cosborne
Reviews.Content: I believe they are working on updating this property. There was a construction noise every day in the mid-morning for a couple of hours in the tower. The staff was extremely knowledgable and friendly. A good location and place to stay and it will be even better once the update in complete.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: fattytravlers
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in need of a facelift and is very dated. The rooms had a musty mildew smell, paint was chipping off the walls and the curtains were falling off. Great location and staff was plesant; however, after playing hard all day and wanting a good night sleep - this was not the place. Priceline has this in thier 4 star ranking... at $160 a night it was more line a 2 star. My expectation for the Hyatt standards has changed to a motel 6 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Hotel, but they charge to park there”
Reviews.Author: MomOBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Islandia March 17th 2006 and because we got an amazing rate thru Hotwire, we really liked the hotel. We were not in the newer tower, our room was on the first floor of the 2 or 3 story older building to the side. The staff was very friendly, and was happy to bring us extra pillows. Our frustration was that we hadn't known that there was a $14.00 a night self parking charge, or a $16.00 a night valet parking charge. The room was clean, it had a small table with 2 sturdy wicker type chairs, a small couch and coffee table, a dresser that the tv sat on, the king sized bed and 2 night stands. The room had a small patio area with a table and 2 chairs that you could access thru your door, or you could use a sliding glass door that was pretty much right next to your door. The nice thing about the sliding glass door was that we could open it, and kind of air out the room. It smelled a little old, not bad, just old. The room had vertical blinds in the room and someone had pulled off some of the decorative paper on a few of them. Disapointing visualy, but still an ok room. The bathroom had typical tub/shower combo, sink, and nice smelling hand soap, shampoo, lotion, and shower cap. Also had a vanity outside the bathroom, as well as a coffee maker with a per cup fee. They also offered bottled water in your room for a fee. The grounds were lovely. There is a Koi pond with a cute bridge going over it, and the pool and jacuzzi were great. We took advantage of the 7am opening time and really liked the view of the harbor from the jacuzzi thru the glass walls. You can also walk past the pool to a sandy (hotel made) sun area with lounge chairs by the harbor, or just take in the view of the boats. The hotel offered breakfast in your room that you could order by leaving a hanging card on your door knob, or varying levels of to go breakfast and lunches for the traveler or business person. Would I stay there again? If I could get a really good deal, probably.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was supposed to be”
Reviews.Author: workplay
Reviews.Content: We got our rooms through Priceline after bidding on 4 star hotels. Was very worried based on the other reviews regarding the quality of the rooms. We were checked into one of the lowrise rooms in the oldest section of the hotel. Frankly, most interstate motel/hotels rooms are nicer than this one. I called the front desk and explained that while I did book through Priceline and understood that I was basically captive I did not feel that this was 4 star room. I was told I had been put in a 3 star room (I would not be so generous on even 3 stars for that one) and that she thought, and I have no reason to doubt her, that on Pricline you bid on hotels individually, not the qualtiy of rooms. In any event, we were moved to very large 2 room suites in the towers. While they were large, they were still dated, in need of repair (part of ceiling falling down, one toilet not functional) and not what you expect for what is supposed to be 4 stars. Positives are that the grounds are very nice and everyone on the staff was very very helpful and accomidating. You cannot blame the staff for how the hotel is advertised on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for.......”
Reviews.Author: napatree
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here Feb 7 2006. We were a little unsure based on previous reviews. The things we considered most important were: proximity to the water,beautiful views,etc... We got exactly what we wanted! The view from our balcony,on the 11th floor, of the pool,the bay,and the ocean beyond were awesome. The grounds and nearby parks and beaches were just beautiful. The sunset was unbelievable! In any case WE got what we needed from the Hyatt Islandia. On a practical note,the hotel is dated. Room and bathroom clean but worn. No 300 count sheets or marble baths here! Lobby area was nice,staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you are getting and pay the right price and it's okay”
Reviews.Author: malexf
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and spacious. The decoration is very plain in the rooms and in the halls. The furniture is simple but adequate. The amenities, soap shampoo, etc were good quality. But we missed a body or facial lotion. The grounds were pleasant. We had a nice view of the pool and bay. The weather did not allow us to try out the pool. The exercise room is pretty well equipped for a hotel. The staff was quite pleasant. But this is a 3-star hotel, not a 4-star by a long shoot. We paid $85 a night on Priceline. It was definitely a good deal. But, like other big chain hotels, everything extra costs - local calls $1.00 each, park your own car $14.00 per night, valet car service $16.00 per night, Internet access $10 a day or more depending on the option you choose. We have been spoiled at B&B where these "extras" are often included. All in all if you are looking for just a nice place to sleep and you can get a good deal this is a nice option. I definitely would not spend more than $125 a night here.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights in Dec 2005 and had a fairly good stay. The room was spacious with a great view of the bay and pool. The landscaping and fish/koi pond is beautiful. As mentioned in one of the other reviews the thermostat was not working in our room either, and it was very cold. We called front desk and they sent someone to fix it within a short time. It was OK and I would recommend Islandia but don't expect anything above average. Tip: Since the Seafood place at the Hotel was closed down we had to walk to Mission Beach to find some reasonably priced food. On our third day we found a nice place across the street from the Hotel at one of the other resorts. The food is excellent and prices not too high.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmeezie
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews, I almost changed our reservation. But I am so glad I didn't. We were on the 12th floor of the tower with a marina view. We paid extra for the view and it was worth it to us. We also requested ahead of time to have a high floor. This probably helped with our experience. The room was very clean and didn't seem old or outdated like some other reviewers complained about. We also took advantage of the AAA special package which included a room discount and breakfast every morning. Without this package, it might not have been worth it. We were able to order anything we wanted off the menu and we only paid gratuity. For my husband and I, the restaurant would have run about $40 for breakfast each morning. We ate at the Blue Bay for dinner twice during our stay, the other restaurant wasn't open. It was nice when we didn't feel like driving anywhere. Every staff person we ran into was very friendly and polite. The towers lounge was a nice place to relax and unwind. The only downfall I can see is that it was not near any night life and we had to drive everywhere. This was totally okay with us because we are not big city people and we enjoyed the slower pace and calm atmosphere. Overall, we really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they make it sound”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, location is excellent. We had a car and it seemed that nothing was more than a five to fifteen minute drive. Mission Beach is close (like one mile away) and there are a couple of great restaurants there, namely Nick's on the Beach, and a breakfast place called The Eggery. Both were so good the first time, we quit looking for anything else and ate most every meal at one of the two. But back to the actual hotel. The rooms were nothing special, but clean and comfortable. Good water pressure in the shower, comfortable beds and a balcony with an awesome view of the marina and the bay...you could even see the downtown skyline. We were on the 7th floor of the tower. From what I could see, the tower was the place to be. The marina rooms looked like a Motel 6. The pool was supposedly heated but I didn't get in because it was chilly everyday we were there. Although I saw a few brave souls swimming everyday. The complex was nice. Almost like a resort. There were bunny rabbits all over the place! Service was good. Everyone was very helpful. The fitness room was adequate for what I needed...again nothing special. You have to pay $11 a day for parking so don't be surprised about that. I travel a lot and it's not really all that uncommon. The best thing was the location. It was right on the water...not on the beach, but it was too cold to spend too much time on the beach anyway. For some awesome views drive up Mission Bay Blvd till it turns into La Jolla Blvd and get out anywhere. Breathtaking views of the ocean and the multi-million dollar homes there. Also worth seeing is of course the zoo, although not as impressive as I expected, and the Torrey Pines Reserve was great for hiking. Talk about awesome views. Mission Beach is good for night life and general beach atmosphere. Don't be afriad to get a car. I'm from Oklahoma City, and I was not intimidated by the traffic here, as I am in a lot of other cities I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient unless you're off to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: lahrmike
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference. But took my 12-year old son, who had long wanted to see the zoo complex here. It was an odd venue for a conference. Few meeting rooms and severe inclement weather could have caused problems of running between those that existed. In fact it rained, but just modestly while we were there. My son liked the room. We stayed in a so-called Marina Suite. But between trips to the zoos and another with a colleague of mine to the desert east of San Diego, he didn't really spend much time there. To be honest, beyond walking the marina boardwalk and trapsing about the lobby and giftshop, there wasn't much for him to do. Except for two very nice dinng possibilities a local seafood shack and a breakfast/luncheon joint, nothing was really within walking distance. So, a taxi or car (recommended since on a daily basis they were cheaper) is necessary to get to the hotel and to go anywhere from there. Although you can get a reasonable rate on a car at the hotel and get it delivered. I would be VERY reluctant to call this a 3-star hotel (let alone a 4-star one) when we went, but it was the low season then. The single operating restaurant (the other one was closed for the season, I guess) was nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan_01
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at Hyatt Islandia for 4 nights at the end of November and found it to be a disappointment. When we checked in, we were informed that we had been given an 'upgrade' from the junior suite that we had booked to a marina suite. Initially, we were pleased at this turn of events until we realised that we were walking in the opposite direction from the tower (which apparently, is more modern and well maintained) when being shown to our suite. Our hearts sank. The first thing I noticed about the suite was how dark it was. Anytime we were in it, we had to have all of the lights on all of the time, even though there were numerous windows around the suite. In the bathroom, we could barely see anything at all! It was clear that the suite and indeed the hotel in general, badly needs updating. The decor is dated, the bathroom in particular needs ripping out and replacing and the door to enter the suite was so old, that if you leant against it from the outside, you could nearly force your way in which didn't make it feel very safe. We were also very disappointed to find that the suite had no safe. I would have thought in almost any room of this supposed grading (absolutely not 4*) let alone a suite, a safe would have been a basic amenity. We found it very inconvenient to have to continually make trips to the front desk to use a safety deposit box. The high point of the suite though, was the beautiful view of the marina. We were a bit concerned it might be noisy being so close to it, but it didn't bother us once. The grounds of the hotel were pleasant and well maintained, particularly the area containing the koi pond, which many people have pointed out. In terms of food, we had a very mixed experience at the hotel. We were given vouchers to use for breakfast which could be used either at Blue Bay Bistro or for room service, so we did both. We had one good room service breakfast (corned beef hash) which was nice but ordered pancakes on another day which were literally the most vile thing we have ever tasted. They were burnt and tasted like they'd been made with salt instead of sugar because they had the most awful sour and bitter taste. No matter how much we drowned them in syrup, they were clearly inedible and I couldn't physically swallow a scrap of them. Similarly, we had one good breakfast in Blue Bay Bistro when we ordered from the menu and another that was awful when we chose the buffet. The food had all clearly been sat there for a while. It was soggy and luke warm and for some reason, one of the servers forced a bowl of biscuits and gravy onto me (we don't have that in the UK so I didn't really fancy it for breakfast) which I found bizarre and bewildering. I don't know whether the buffet is always of that quality or whether they took their eye off the ball because it was a Sunday when they have a champagne brunch at Islandia restaurant, but it did no-one any favours. The Islandia restaurant itself (which I understand is only open certain days which I found a bit strange) we enjoyed very much. We were seated at a lovely window table overlooking the marina and found our server to be very polite, kind and helpful. The food was plentiful and of good quality. We found the location of the hotel to be OK, obviously paricularly for SeaWorld but we ended up spending a lot to get taxis to various other places and in hindsight, it may have been better for our particular needs to have stayed in the downtown area instead. Also, the hotel is next to a busy road and I did find that the noise bothered me from time to time. We made use of the concierge's services by booking some attraction tickets and a day excursion with her and we found her to be helpful and pleasant. We were collected at the right times, had no problems with the tickets and found everything ran smoothly. The staff in general, we found to be a mixed bag themselves. Some were very helpful and polite particularly the servers, concierge and bellhops but others, especially on the front desk, seemed to have an attitude. Upon checking out, we were given a bill for 4 nights spent in the suite. We pointed out that it was already paid for and had handed over a voucher saying as much, when we checked in. This turned into an argument for a few minutes as the girl was adament that we hadn't. It actually became quite embarrassing and we started to worry that we were going to have to pay again. She then flounced off, saying she would get a manager and returned a few minutes later, agreeing that we had paid but blamed our travel company (who we have used numerous time and are always impeccable). We didn't receive an apology. All in all, a disappointing stay at a disappointing hotel and if we were to return to San Diego one day, we would not even consider staying at Islandia again unless it had a major overhaul in terms of accomodation and some of their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, 3 stars not 4”
Reviews.Author: Skyscraper
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hyatt Islandia first week of november before a visit to Sea World the next day. I've got this hotel with Priceline, bidded a 4 stars. In fact, this hotel is a 3 stars and not a 4 stars, confirmed by the staff at the hotel. Rooms, especially the bathroom was dirty. Hotel smelled funny, but there was a balcony with beautiful view. This hotel needs an update. See my photos, they are worth a 1000 words.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty terrible”
Reviews.Author: Chrella
Reviews.Content: When you book at a hyatt Regency you assume that you're going to if not a great hotel at least a good hotel, unfortunately this is not the case with the Hyatt Regency Islandia. We were assigned a room behind the reception in a 2 storey building that smelt of mildew & the carpet was damp & in need of a good clean. Reading previous positive reviews it's pretty clear that here it depends on the type of room your given so I would suggest people ask for a specific building or room number. A positive thing about the hotel are the staff; they were extremely friendly & helpful. I will definitely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star at best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a terrible place but hardly 3 or 4 star. Be aware that parking costs an extra 11$ nightly. If you grouse about it perhaps you'll pay less as we did. We were in the seperate units over by the event center. They smelled of mildew. A friend stayed in the tower and reported a similar smell with no prompting from us. The walls and adjoining doors were paper thin and we could hear every movement our neighbors made. As a result we were slaves to thier alarm. It was good that we were there in Fall as the AC wouldn't have made any difference in temperature. Nice ginger soap but we didn't sample the 4$ a quart bottled water. For the name and published prices you can do better just up the street or even in La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Islandia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about staying here after seeing all the iffy reviews. Luckily our stay Oct24-31 2005 was very nice. Loved the location and the view. We were on the 6th floor tower facing the bay. Wonderful sunsets!! Our 2yr old daughter loved the Koi pond and all the bunnies on the grounds. We appreciated the concierge and the bell service-- very helpful with all our questions. Yes the restaurants on the premises were somewhat expensive but the food was good and we had a WONDERFUL brunch on Sunday. The room was clean and quiet. What air conditioner noise were other reviewers talking about?? Very close to Mission Beach and to Sea World. Overall a very nice vacation for our family. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, beautiful, accomodating, comfortable Hotel! Great Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anne D
Reviews.Content: The Islandia did a wonderful job 'saving' our honeymoon stay in San Diego! We left the horrible Tower 23 Hotel after one night and had decided, basically 4 hours after arriving there, that we weren't staying. We drove the coast toward Sea World where we were visiting the next day and saw the Hyatt. We expected them not to have a room available, but explained our predicament of being out-of-town on our Honeymoon and finding our current hotel to be much less fabulous that we were led to believe. The front desk attendant, Cory, said they had a beautiful suite available and even upgraded us to an ocean view! The grounds are absolutely beautiful! There is a koi pond with a bridge next to the very large pool and big jacuzzi. All of these look out over the marina into the bay. We had the sunset from our balcony every night! The concierge was so helpful and pleasant (thanks, Rhonda!). Make sure you stay in the tower, the views are the best and we received a really great rate (thier standard, but less than I would have expected for such a nice hotel). Room service was quick and very accomodating, the Blue Bay restaurant and staff were wonderful and friendly. The food was great too! The main restaurant on the property is only open Wed-Sat(?), but it was ok (we liked the Blue Bay better!) This hotel is also very close to the expressway, but not OBVIOUSLY on top of it. I had no idea how close we were to the entrance to go to downtown and all the attractions we wanted to go to until we started driving. We felt like we were in a secluded, tropical paradise everyday and night we came 'home' after our adventures to Sea World, Gaslamp Quarter for dinner, Coronodo Island, the Midway, the HMS Surprise (both by the Maritime Meuseum in Sandiego), the Sandiego Zoo, etc.... We were basically 15 minutes from anything we wanted to do. The hotel was extremely clean and there weren't a lot of noisy children running around (which appeals to us since we don't have any) My husband and I stayed on the 7th floor in a corner junior suite and we loved it. The room was very well appointed and extremely spacious! Obviously, I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Don't miss the chance to stay here if you're in town. Thank you to all the staff who made our honeymoon perfect without overdoing the whole 'honeymoon thing' (we are kind of discrete people). We will see you next year on our one year anniversary! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Vert nice hotel but it needs a few things”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading other posts I have to agree about the air conditioner noise. I slept out on the balcony every night(11th floor) and it was annoying. I would have liked more breakfast choices. The resturants were very expensive. I don't know how the poster got free breakfast. We spent $20 for a few muffins and a cup of tea in the lobby which is not open every day. A shuttle service to and from the airport would have been great. The property is really nice. We had a marina view and there were sea lioms right outside. That was reaaly cool. The staff was reaaly good and answered our MNAY questions.We chose not to rent a car until the last day when our son graduated from Marine bootcamp and this property is pretty far from everything except Sea World. All things considered, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a 3-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luvaluva3
Reviews.Content: I'm not hard to please, but I do have standards and expectations when I choose a 3.5 or 4-star hotel (as this hotel was rated by expedia and priceline respectively). Sure the lobby was nicely decorated, but the room was disappointingly bare except for the requisite beds, TV, and desk. We had a marina-view tower room and the noise from the air conditioning ground unit was very loud, even when we upgraded from the 3rd floor to the 15th. Bedding was thread-bare, only shampoo provided (no conditioner!), and bathroom floor was sticky in places. Pool was not heated to advertised 78 degrees. Blue Bay restaurant was overpriced and dinner was not all that great. Pros: Staff was very friendly and responsive, and room service breakfast was delicious and well-priced. The marina view was nice and the sea lions made us smile. This hotel is not worth the sticker price of ~$200/night. Good thing we only paid $100/night via priceline.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL PLACE LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! We got everything we requested and even an upgrade. We had a free breakfast every morning(room service). Beautiful view. Customer service was amazing. Very close to sea world. Great restaurant in the resort and wonderful full size pool and jacuzzi. I would recommend this place to anyone going to San Diego they satisfied our every need!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Tyvekmaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fine with us. We were a Priceline customer. ($100 a night) They gave us (My wife and I with two teenagers) a King Bed Suite with two roll out singles. We checked in around 3 PM. We vistited Coronado Beach in the morning and afternoon before checking in. We also spent some time on Mission Beach. The beach is walking distance from the hotel but it was still easier to drive the family there. The pool was nice. I disregarded the sign that said you could not bring your own drinks to the pool. They have a full bar right next to the pool. Overall, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mediocre service, disappointing facility”
Reviews.Author: d-the-man
Reviews.Content: Three circles for a 3-star facility. This Hyatt is in a great location near Sea World and close to Mission Bay/Beach, however, it is not typical of a Hyatt resort in its quality and is better classified as a 3-start resort. As others have said the two low-rise motel-style structures are not even up to 3-start quality. We stayed in one our first night and while they boast upgraded bath rooms (marble, tile, etc.), carpet, bet, etc. - they are constructed of wood and are quite old. You hear everything including your neighbors upstairs, next door, outside, etc. We asked to be moved to the Tower for the rest of our stay and they are better and much quieter, although they are also quite dated with acoustic (popcorn) ceilings, slightly moldy shower grouting, etc. I got the room during Summer-peak for $180/night through Priceline which is a crime. I would not pay more than $100/night for this facility if I had a choice, but the Summer rates go up quite a bit. They were advertising the room for $300/night on Hyatt.com which is absolutely absurd. The hotel staff is just okay - certainly not as accommodating as the typical Hyatt standard. The onsite restaurant (Blue something or other) was quite good and the service was great; I recommend it. Pool facilities are pretty good and they have a bar there. Lots of kids so if you don't like them it might not be your scene. For a great breakfast place with casual street side dining and excellent food checkout the Boardwalk Bistro/Cafe in Mission Beach. Mission Bay Sportscenter is great for renting Catamarans and other sailboats. Try to go during the week to avoid the Summer-time weekend traffic which gets a bit heavy in the Mission Bay area, especially in the morning on the way to the beach, and the afternoon on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!!”
Reviews.Author: familytravelers_50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time when we stayed at this hotel during a weeklong conference the last week of June. When we first arrived at 2:30 am (due to extensive flight delays), we were assigned a room that had 2 queen beds and was on the garden terrace. After viewing the room and having read reviews about these rooms, we requested that our original request for a king bed (we had called two times prior to our arrival to ensure that a room would be saved for us in the tower since we had such a late arrival and then even more delays). The night manager upgraded us for free to a club room which meant we had access all week to the amenties in the club room. We had a room on the next to top floor overlooking the bay and could enjoy cold drinks on our patio. The club breakfast was especially nice, especially the staff who worked there (she was from OK like us). The koi pond was very nice, the pool was quite large, and the jacuzzi was also large and nice. We were close enough to walk across the bridge (or ride the bus) to a wide range of restaurants by the bay or to ride the rollercoaster. We also used the public bus service which runs right by the hotel to go to La Jolla and also to the trolley. Basically, we had access to public transportation to get everywhere we wanted to go (Old Town, the old San Diego mission, and Gaslamp Quarter). We loved the seafood restaurant located directly east of the hotel, easy access by the boardwalk by the marina - it was a local spot where the several of those who used the marina ate and the ahi was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad...you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirlatl
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here while on a business trip for my husband. We booked through Priceline and paid $100 a night (darned per diems!), which was fair, but I would say that the hotel is not worth any more than that. It was very quiet, and not bad, but not the 4-star property they claim to be either. Rooms B The room itself was okay, a pretty standard 3 star room, with a very tiny bathroom. The bathroom did have marble countertops, but that does not a 4-star make. I do have to say that they did a great job with the lighting—so often hotel rooms do not have enough lamps and/or overheads, but our room here was very well lit. There was a very small balcony with a couple of metal chairs and a tiny plastic table. We did enjoy the fact that we could see the fireworks (put on by neighboring Seaworld, I believe) from the balcony. We did not enjoy the fact that our room (we were either on the 3rd or 4th floor) was directly over the area where they have the dumpsters, making being on the deck hard on the olfactory glands! ). I normally would have asked to switch rooms, but we were exhausted by the time we got there, and it just did not seem worth the effort for one night. If you are planning to stay here, I would recommend asking for a room on a high floor, with a view of the marina (we had a bit of one, but it was heavily obstructed by HVAC systems or similar equipment Service A The valets were very friendly, check in was quick and courteous, and the bellhops were also nice as can be. We had dinner at the Blue Bay California Bistro at the base of the main tower, and our waiter was quite friendly and brought our food out very quickly. There were only about 2 other parties in the restaurant at the time, so not sure if it would always be that quick, but hopefully so! Restaurants B+ I was disappointed to see that the Islandia bar and restaurant was closed during our stay. We asked and were told that it is only open for dinner Wed-Sat, and for Sunday brunch (we were there on a Sunday night). It is the more upscale of the two restaurants at the hotel, and looks out directly onto the marina. The dinner we had at the California Bistro was actually delicious, though, so we were pleased with that  They have a pretty basic menu of sandwiches, burgers, salads, etc, but very fresh ingredients are used, making the sandwiches we had quite tasty. Bars C If the Islandia Bar had been open during our stay, this category would probably have gotten a much higher score. It looked spacious and pleasant, with (I believe) a seating area out on the deck where you can relax and enjoy the sunset or the lights of the marina. But, again, this was closed, so the only other bar option was a very small, dark, depressing one at the base of the tower. We walked in and pretty much walked right back out—it just had sort of a grim atmosphere. Pool/Grounds B- The grounds are kept clean, there’s a small koi pond, which was nice, and the landscaping is well maintained. But nothing particularly spectacular here. The pool itself was not at all impressive—small and very basic, surrounded by a fence which tends to take away from the overall look of the grounds. I’m sure they have to have the fence up for liability purposes, though, since many families stay here. There is also a tiny (maybe 20 feet by 15 feet) manmade “beach” right off the marina. Be forewarned: this is not an actual beach, but more of a dirty sandbox. If you want to lay in some sand, I would recommend the Hotel Del Coronado or even the La Valencia in La Jolla (just up the hill from a bit of beach) instead. Location Depends If you are planning on spending a lot of time at Seaworld, the location probably cannot be beat! The location is also pretty much equidistant to La Jolla and Coronado, among other areas, so if you want someplace where you are 30-40minutes from nearly everything, this may be a good choice for you. If you are just planning on spending most of your time in downtown/Old Town/Coronado (for example), though, this hotel is probably not the best option. There are also no restaurants within walking distance, which can be a problem when they only have one restaurant open. If you want something different, your options are to order room service (pretty much the same menu as the Cali Bistro) or to get in the car and drive a little ways away (not always appealing when you are exhausted from traveling!) Overall, this is a decent hotel, just not quite up to the standards of a 4-star property, in my opinion. If you can get it for around $100 a night, and don’t want anything fancy (or want to be very close to SeaWorld but not anywhere else), it is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Okay at a certain price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As has been well documented here, the Hyatt is an older hotel. It consists of a Tower building plus some 2 story buildings that look more like apartment grade construction. The location is in fact great. The tower building where my room is, is okay. It is perfectly servicable and his nice views. It is nothing special though. I think the reviews I have read here on trip advisor seem to vary depending on the price paid. Those who paid under $100 seem to like it best. I agree at under $100 I would have no problem with this place. At $170 (my rate for a conference peak summer season) it is hard to be so enthusiastic about this place. It is just too old and the quality of everything is just not up to that price point. Realisitically it is a 3 star hotel. You need to stay here with the right expectation. Hopefully you can get a rate that makes it feel like a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not very kid-friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We brought our two children (5 and 2) during Fourth of July weekend. The hotel is very nice, but the room was just o.k. We had a room on the 4th floor of the tower with a view of the bay. The grounds are very well kept. The pool area was o.k. Granted, it was a busy weekend, but both days we swam in the pool, they ran out of towells. Other than swimming, there is not much for the kids. The pool area is not very large for such a big hotel. The location was nice, but there was no beach area at the hotel. We had to walk over the bridge to get to the beach. The hotel is also extremely close to Sea World. The room service menu has a nice variety for kids and the prices were very reasonable. The staff was extremely nice. Valet parking was $15/day while self-parking was $11/day (first come, first served). All-in-all, a very nice trip but we'd probably select a more kid-friendly hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great area, but a little hard to find off of the I-5. The rooms were average for a Hyatt. We even had a Marina view in the Tower section. The grounds are nice and they have a wonderful pool area. I needed directions 3 times and they were wrong each time, but otherwise the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. We had to check out by 5am...they only had 1 person working the front desk and valet. We waited for sometime that we almost missed our flight since the San Diego airport is very busy at that time of the morning. As a whole the property is not bad it just needs some updates, especially the bathrooms. It's a nice place for families since there is so much to do in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Good with adjustments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reading everyone reviews prior to my visit, my stay at the Hyatt Islandia was very nice. The first room was musty smelling and small. However, I did refuse the first room and was able to get moved to the Towers. This room was great. This is an older Hyatt so there are some signs of age. However, the staff was above average and the food was great. It is also a very convenient location for sight-seeing. LaJolla is minutes away and Old Town San Diego is too. The pool and grounds were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Content: To all you negative reviewers. I just want you to know that we found this hotel to be absolutely beautiful. We bid on priceline and got it for $80.00. We upgraded it for another 45.00 per night incliding parking to a mini suite with a marina and bay view. The room was huge and in great condition. At $125.00 a night we considered it a bargain. The view was breathtaking. The hotel had nice bars and restaurants.Beautiful grounds ,the jacuzzi was very relaxing, and the staff was very friendly. The marina had kyack's that you can rent by the hour and a little fish market where you can get a beer and shrimp cocktail afterwards. All in all a wonderful get away. I think it's what you make of it. Some people are never satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok- if you are going to stay at the Hyaatt Regency Islandia in San Diego there are 2 important things you need to remember: 1. When checking in, request that you stay in the "Tower". There is an annex next door that they will put people in, but I hear that is not very good. 2. Also when checking in, request a room (again in the Tower) with a "Marina view". If you do the two things above, you will have a good stay. We stayed there in May of 2005 (in the Tower with a Marina view of course), and had pleasent experience. The hotel is listed as a 4-star, hotel, but it is not. However, I would rank it as a strong 3-star hotel (maybe even 3 1/2 star). The staff were very friendly. We used Priceline and got the room for $97 dollars per night (plus $10 per night to self-park). The location is 10 minutes away from everything so that was a plus too. Happy traveling! Kid

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: AFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a driving holiday around Southern California. Had stayed here many years ago at a convention - had some concerns having read earlier reviews. We booked into a Regency Club room in the Tower and the room was fine but not great. The food in the Club was poor and the service pretty much non-existant. On the positive side the hotel is in a great location with great views over the marina, also its very quiet so guaranteed a good nights sleep. We didn't eat in the restaurants as the menu was pretty bland and overpriced but plenty of good restaurants within a 10 minute drive

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cb35
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Hyatt Islandia in San Diego stayed 3 nights the first week of May 05. $114/night through Hotwire. Others got a better deal through Priceline it looks like. Lesson learned there is to wait as long as possible if you want to get a lower rate. Anyway....on to the review. I would give this hotel 3.5 stars on a 5 star scale. Upon check in immediately requested a Tower Room based on reviews on this site. I was granted one on the 3rd floor tower and was told it would cost extra to stay any higher. Whether that was BS or not I will never know. Overall, I thought the staff was pretty good, helpful and courteous. The room I stayed in was satisfactory to us. It had a double queens with a balcony. Room size I thought was better than a normal hotel in its class. The small balcony was a nice touch. I didn't have the problems with cleaniness that others have posted. We have breakfast one morning at the restaurant in the tower. I thought the food was excellent, but pretty pricey for a breakfast. Overall, worth it. The more expensive restaurant located on the hotel grounds, I didn't experience. The hostess was pretty rude when we entered near the end of Sunday brunch. I see others had similar concerns. Pool and Jacuzzi area I thought were excellent and pretty quiet during my stay. This was definitely an older crowd at this hotel, not many families that I saw. Internet terminal in the lobby is $4.95 minimum, pretty pricey for one person for checking email, but not bad for two people. I think $4.95 got you 12 minutes or so. There is only one terminal, so for non business travelers w/o their laptop, this could be an issue during peak periods. Location was pretty decent, close to bus stop into the city and close to the freeway. It was in a quiet marina area, no problems with noise during our stay. Parking is $10/day, which I guess is status quo for hotels in this area. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the $120/night and lower. Their website quotes prices at $175+, which is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance / do not over pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked via PRICELINE ($82 per night)and then upgraded to the REGENCY CLUB ($50 per night additional but well worth it for our family of 4). Older property in a great area ( Mission Bay) that was centrally located to everything we wanted to do in San Diego ( zoo, Sea World, Coronado, La Jolla, Old Town, Balboa Park, Downtown). The hotel itself is in need of some gentle upkeep ( paint, plumbing, etc) but was by no means dirty or run down. Lush grounds and be sure to stay in the main tower ( 5th floor or higher). I would hesitate paying more then $ 150 but the rooms were large ( 2 quuen beds with balcony) and would try again here if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: FandE401
Reviews.Content: First of all, we were there for a conference that my husband was attending, so the hotel was chosen for us. We stayed at Hyatt Islandia in MIssion Bay. A nice location right on the bay, a marina on one side, close to Belmont Park & the beach & "boardwalk" area. The hotel room wasn't ready when we arrived at 3:15 so we went for a ride & some lunch/supper (it was 6:15 "our time" so we were hungry). Returned to the hotel a littel before 5 and were told the room still wasn't ready so they offered us an upgrade to a Marina Suite. While we were debating the relative merits of taking a suite, the original room became available, but the offer was still out there, so we took it! Had a bedroom w/2 queen beds, TV, a patio w/2 chairs overlooking the marina, a little wet bar area, and a living room w/TV, table, chairs & sofa/pull out bed. Decor a bit shabby, the sofa was uncomfortable to sit on to watch TV, but we were hardly in the room so it wasn't a big deal. What a kick to sit on the patio and see pelicans and a seal or two poking around the boats in the marina! They nickel & dime you to death there, however. $10 a night to self park (altho' we did have under the bldg. parking, which was great when it was raining) and $20 night for internet connection! Business travelers have come to expect WiFi at the better hotels (think Omni), not that price for a dialup connection! The bathroom lighting should have been better - kind of hard to put on even the little bit of makeup I use with the lighting provided! Even the connecting area where the wet bar and another counter with 3 mirrors were poorly lit. They have a "thing" they do there to save water - they say they'll only change your towels and linens every three days to conserve water (save our planet) unless you call and tell them no thanks. I certainly did call and say we wanted fresh towels daily, thank you very much. We've been on a couple of cruises where they do something similar (there's a REAL need to save water in their case), but they do it in a better way...they say if you want the towels refreshed, leave the used ones on the floor, otherwise hang them back on the rack to dry if you plan to reuse. I think that's more user-friendly than making a customer call to say they want clean towels. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It's a nice location, close to the beaches and the highway both, and the facilities seemed very nice. We did not use the pool, but they have a small sandy area with chaise lounges they call a "beach" for those that want some sun with no water. it's not really a beach, but you get the same effect for sunbathing. Breakfast at the Blue Bay in the hotel was good - we had the breakfast buffet which was standard hotel buffet stuff - scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, fruit, bacon, sausage, french toast, biscuits, gravy, syrup (I think I'm leaving something out, but can't remember what). We did not have any other meals than breakfast there (I ordered an omelet off the menu one morning, it was very good). We tried to go to the Islandia Grille on the Thursday night around 9:30pm...hours on the door said open 'til 10:30 but all the doors were locked. We just wanted maybe an appetizer and a drink at the bar. A bartender came out and said they were closed. Hmmm...was that a management decision or just the bartender's choice??? We did enjoy a drink in the Towers Lounge a couple of evenings...comfortable chairs and loveseats to sit in and chat, and a decent sized bar if you wanted to sit there. No food (at least not that we saw). Front desk staff were very nice, concierge was knowledgeable and the bell captain was great for giving us directions to Petco Park (to see the Padres).

Reviews.Title: “Would have requested a discount or refund if not for Priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Drove in from Phoenix for a weekend at Sea World. The Valet was very nice. The Bellmen, Fabio and the other gentlemen were amazing. Dennis at the front desk was very nice as well. Then we go to our rooms....(both in the tower thanks to dennis). Rooms were DIRTY. Trash had not been removed from prior guests, looked under bed for lost shoe and found it hadn't been vaccuumed in quite some time, crumbs on one of the bed's spread along with a hair pin, junk left by the air vent, plexiglass around the patio room was filthy (not just water spots). There was mold on both shower curtains and the shower drain doesn't drain, so you get a shower and a bath at the same time...Gross!! People we met in the Pool/Jacuzzi were having same challenges and complaining that they would not bring towels to the pool for us at 10P. Good points...The grounds were well kept, the food was very good, the bunny is cute and the Koi are nice to watch. We only paid $79 per night thru Priceline. If we had paid $200 or more per night, I would have requested a refund or a discount. This is NOT how a four star hotel operates. We travel to serveral hotels/resorts per year...definitely stayed at nicer MOTELS!

Reviews.Title: “Average, nothing more, nothing less”
Reviews.Author: Ckatla
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average, but certainly not the 4 start accomodations claimed by Price Line. Parking was a bit of a problem, our rental car was hit while parked in the $10 per night self parking area. Would recommend valet parking for just a few dollars extra per night. Restaurant was just average, while menu descriptions sounded great, food was just OK. Also on the morning before checking out, staff knocked on door twice while "Do Not Disturb" sign was on the door. Don't expect 4 star accomodations and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Loved the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: misterburns
Reviews.Content: My partner got our stay at the Hyatt from Priceline - $100 a night!!!! for Tuesday-Thursday. The hotel exterior was beautiful. Getting our room was pleasant, but when we entered the room, it didn't face the koi pond as promised by the clerk - it faced the parking lot. Plus, it was smoky, and it was supposed to be non-smoking. We went back to the desk, and the clerk apologized about 100 times and upgraded us to the junior suite in the towers. Man, what a difference! Huge room, great balcony overlooking the koi pond, wonderful big bed, table with chairs, just great. Everyone who works here greets you warmly, even the maids! they are all trained very well - even calling room service was nice! And food was great and fast. I used the gym on the second floor, and it was the best gym i've ever seen in a hotel. New workout equipment - aerobic stuff, and free weights, and other equipment! towel, water, tvs, mats... the whole nine yards. Great! The grounds are amazing - so tropical and lush, with the aforementioned koi pond, big swimming pool and big hot tub - great to get into at night. The hyatt is right by the marina - all the boats are steps away! it's just gorgeous. Plus there is nothing right beside it - it's all by itself, away from downtown but only 10 minutes to get into the city. A little bunny rabbit hangs around the grounds by the koi pond, just eating grass and being happy. It was perfect weather, a nice breeze and sunny, and just so nice to hang out in the tropical little paradise here. yes, the hotel is a bit old - not exactly up to date - but it is still nicely decorated and lovely. and i bet if you don't stay in the main tower, you won't like it as much - but if you do stay in the main tower, and especially if you get upgraded to a suite, you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here one night after a day at Sea World. We usually book with Priceline and have great luck with hotels. Our last trip to San Diego we stayed at the Grand Hyatt Manchester, which was immaculate. So even though pictures of this hotel didn't depict such beauty, I thought the Hyatt name alone meant quality. WRONG! I could have easily went to a Motel 6 or Super 8 and had a nicer hotel room. We stayed in a room right above the lobby area, not in the tower. I don't know if the tower rooms are any better but the room we stayed in was small, not very well maintained, extremely outdated, and smelly. Had we been staying for more than one night I would have demanded a different room. My suggestion is DON'T stay here. If you have to, try requesting a tower room. Maybe you'll have better luck there!

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper than last time and just as good”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel this year. This time we bid $10 less than previously on priceline and the Hyatt still came up. Pleasant and friendly front desk staff allocated us a Tower room with excellent views across the water. Rooms are large and nicely furnished although the bathroom is somewhat dated - but how much time do you spend in the bathroom. The grounds are expansive and beautifully maintained - I think most folks would be happy here. If you do stay, drive down to Kono's on Pacific Beach beside Crystal Pier Hotel for breakfast. Double eggs, bacon, toasted muffins and tea will cost only $6 and the experience is well worh the wait and queue!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: sticchik
Reviews.Content: What A nightmare! This place is dated and needs a major facelift. Our room on the 17th floor had a shower that filled up with water coming up from the drain daily... I let the front desk know and they acted as though it was a common occcurance. how nasty. we paid @ 200 a night for this gross out. thank god for the view because i truly would have been out of my mind. Stay somewhere else. I used to live in SD and thought this would be great... location etc. No way. we will stay in Pacific beach or Ocean Beach next time. A Super 8 would have been better by far.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Mountain77
Reviews.Content: You’ve got to be kidding me…3 ½ stars for this dump. First of all, we were not even in the main tower building but rather in a small two-story building attached to the main one. The outside of the building looks old but that is just the typical late 50s-60s style but I still had some hope for the interior of the room. Carpeting covers the outdoor patio…yes carpeting outside that soaks up all the moisture and whatever else may drop all over it. The door was hard to open and had been all patched up in a messy fashion, then as soon as we enter the room, a terrible musty stench greeted us. The furniture is bad pastel wood with gaudy gold hardware. I could have put up with this if the room hadn’t smelled so much. The bathroom looked a little more up to date, but not much. We heard the plumbing pipes from the rooms above and on either side throughout the night. Thank goodness we were only staying one night after a day at Sea World, otherwise I would have checked out and demanded a refund. It will take me a long time to stay at another Hyatt hotel, if I ever do. A Holiday Inn Express would have been 1000 times better for a lower price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Islandia! My husband and I extended our business trip a few days to enjoy the beautiful area. We had easy access to many of the San Diego activities, without the noise and congestion of downtown, but are still close to it. The resort feel was relaxing and the tower rooms had a great view! I recommend it and will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location For Water Views Without City Congestion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from an internet deals list that had many choices including Hotel Circle, Downtown, Old Town and Pacific Beach. I was skeptic after reading some of the reviews, but once we got there we were so glad we had selected this location. We would not have been happy with the other hotels we visited that were on the list. The view of the bay, ocean and Mission Bay Park from the tower was excellent. The location was outstanding -- near beaches, downtown, old town and hilltop scenic routes. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and spacious. Parking rate wasn't too unreasonable considering I just returned from San Francisco whose hotel charged $40 a day to park. While I'm not sure what our room rate was since we booked a package -- however for us -- air, hotel and car @ $700 per person from the east coast for 5 days was well worth it. While it may not be a true 4 star resort it is at least a 3 1/2, but the rainbow we saw every morning and the sunset we saw every evening from our balcony made it a 5 star trip to us. Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: christina260
Reviews.Content: We took a trip for a girls weekend out and stayed in this hotel. It was great. The second we walked into the lobby to check in we were treated like queen's. The entire staff was friendly and took time out to answer any questions we had. The hotel is in San Deigo but the grounds were so nice you felt like you were in Hawaii. It was very tropical. The pool was heated and clean. The spa was huge and very clean as well. Our room was awesome. This is the first hotel that I have slept in where the bed was great. The bed was soft, and so were the pillows. The room was very clean. We had a great view of all the docked boats, and we were surrounded by water. At night we left our sliding door open and we can here all of the seals playing right outside. We got a newspaper on our door step every morning. The room service was fast and good. We ate breakfast at one of the hotel resturants and it was not very good, but the service was great. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. It is also a great place for families with children. This hotel made a weekend vacation one of the best vacations I have ever taken.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBearsFan650
